English: These are the words which Moses spoke to all Israel on this side of the Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain opposite Suph, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
Bahnar: Nâu nơ̆r Môis pơma khan kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael, gah hơlĕch kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơ lăm thŭng Araba jê̆ pơlei Supha sơlam pơlei Paran păng Tôphêl, La'ban. Haserôt păng Đisahap.

English: It is eleven days’ journey from Horeb by way of Mount Seir to Kadesh Barnea.
Bahnar: Yak năm mơjĭt-mônh năr kơ trong đơ̆ng Hôrêp truh tơ Kades Barnêa, rok trong kông Seir.

English: Now it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spoke to the children of Israel according to all that the LORD had given him as commandments to them
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă puăn-jĭt năr mă mônh khei mơjĭt-mônh, Môis pơma khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael dôm tơdrong mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang. Kră Yang tơtă kơ sư athei pơma khan kơ lu đe noh.

English: after he had killed Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and Og king of Bashan, who dwelt at Ashtaroth in Edrei.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư blah pơlôch Sihôn pơtao Amôrit oei tơ pơlei Hesbôn păng Ôk pơtao Basan oei tơ pơlei Astarôt păng pơlei Êdrei.

English: On this side of the Jordan in the land of Moab, Moses began to explain this law, saying
Bahnar: Tơ gah hơlĕch kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, lăm dêh Môap, Môis pơtơm bơtho tơblang khôi juăt noh khan

English: “The LORD our God spoke to us in Horeb, saying: ‘You have dwelt long enough at this mountain.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n đei khan boih hăm lu bơ̆n tơ Hôrêp thoi âu: Lu iĕm oei tơ kông đunh dêh bơih.

English: Turn and take your journey, and go to the mountains of the Amorites, to all the neighboring places in the plain, in the mountains and in the lowland, in the South and on the seacoast, to the land of the Canaanites and to Lebanon, as far as the great river, the River Euphrates.
Bahnar: Năm bĕ yak dăr dơ̆ng năm tơklă tơ kông groi kon pơlei Amôrit kư̆m năm truh tơ lu tơring jê̆ lu sư lăm thŭng glă Araba păng tơ kông groi bơmơ̆t teh dơnă tơ tơring gah gơal rok cheng đak dơsĭ, mơ̆t tơ dêh kon pơlei Kanaan păng char Liban, truh tơ đak krong tih noh krong Ơphrat.

English: See, I have set the land before you; go in and possess the land which the LORD swore to your fathers—to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—to give to them and their descendants after them.’
Bahnar: Inh jao ăn kơ iĕm dêh âu; mơ̆t păng iŏk oei bĕ, dêh mă Kră Yang đei pơkă ăn kơ lu 'bok lu iĕm Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp, hăm lu kon sâu sư.

English: “And I spoke to you at that time, saying: ‘I alone am not able to bear you.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh inh đei pơma hăm lu iĕm; minh 'nu inh ưh kơ kĕ wă pŭ pơđĭ lu iĕm.

English: The LORD your God has multiplied you, and here you are today, as the stars of heaven in multitude.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm ăn kơ iĕm bơngai rai lơ, năr 'nâu lu iĕm lơ thoi sơnglŏng kơpal plĕnh.

English: May the LORD God of your fathers make you a thousand times more numerous than you are, and bless you as He has promised you!
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm pơm kơ lu iĕm chek lar rai lơ rơbâu hơtăl păng ăn pŭn hiôk, kiơ̆ kơ Sư đei khan pơkă boih kơ lu iĕm.

English: How can I alone bear your problems and your burdens and your complaints?
Bahnar: Minh 'nu inh bơ̆jang pơm liơ gơh kĕ pŭ dôm tơdrong anat anot păng tơdrong lu kon pơlei pơjah pơjăng băl?

English: Choose wise, understanding, and knowledgeable men from among your tribes, and I will make them heads over you.’
Bahnar: Rơih chă bĕ lăm adrĕch adrung lu iĕm lu bơngai hơgei đe ang juăt kơ sek tơlang inh gô pôk ăn lu sư pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu iĕm.

English: And you answered me and said, ‘The thing which you have told us to do is good.’
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei tơl thoi âu: Tơdrong ih athei ăn noh 'lơ̆ng dêh. Lu nhôn gô pơm.

English: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise and knowledgeable men, and made them heads over you, leaders of thousands, leaders of hundreds, leaders of fifties, leaders of tens, and officers for your tribes.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh iŏk lu bơngai wă pơm yŏng đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung lu iĕm, lu bơngai hơgei đe ang păng đêl juăt kơ đei tơdrong truh pôk sư pơm yŏng lu iĕm, wei-lăng minh-rơbâu 'nu wei minh-hrĕng 'nu wei-lăng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu, dah wei-lăng mơjĭt 'nu bơngai păng wei-lăng lăm adrĕch adrung lu iĕm.

English: “Then I commanded your judges at that time, saying, ‘Hear the cases between your brethren, and judge righteously between a man and his brother or the stranger who is with him.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei kơnh, inh tơtă ăn kơ lu 'bok sek tơlang kơ lu iĕm; mơ̆ng bĕ tơduă 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm păng iŏk tơdrong tơpăt na sek tơlang tơdrong đei pơjah băl rim 'nu hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư, dah hăm lu bơngai tơmoi nai mă oei hăm sư.

English: You shall not show partiality in judgment; you shall hear the small as well as the great; you shall not be afraid in any man’s presence, for the judgment is God’s. The case that is too hard for you, bring to me, and I will hear it.’
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong jang sek tơlang, lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t minh pah; athei mơ̆ng mă bơngai iĕ dah bơngai pơm tih, 'nĕ hli kơ bơngai bu, yua kơ tơdrong sek tơlang âu kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơdah đei tơdrong kiơ anat kơ lu iĕm, athei chông ba tơ inh, inh gô mơ̆ng lăm tơdrong noh.

English: And I commanded you at that time all the things which you should do.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lăm kơplah noh inh gô pơkă kơ lu iĕm dôm tơdrong lu iĕm gô pơm.

English: “So we departed from Horeb, and went through all that great and terrible wilderness which you saw on the way to the mountains of the Amorites, as the LORD our God had commanded us. Then we came to Kadesh Barnea.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n yak đơ̆ng Hôrêp năm rok hlôi kơ char glă să păng krưp dêh mă lu iĕm 'bôh boih. Rok tơklă kông groi kon pơlei Amôrit, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n đei pơkă kơ bơ̆n, đơ̆ng noh lu bơ̆n truh tơ Karđes Parnêa.

English: And I said to you, ‘You have come to the mountains of the Amorites, which the LORD our God is giving us.
Bahnar: Inh khan boih kơ lu iĕm: Lu iĕm truh boih tơ kông groi kon pơlei Amôrit, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n ăn kơ lu bơ̆n.

English: Look, the LORD your God has set the land before you; go up and possess it, as the LORD God of your fathers has spoken to you; do not fear or be discouraged.’
Bahnar: To, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih pơjao boih dêh âu kơ ih; năm tŏk bĕ, iŏk dêh noh, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok iĕm đei khan boih kơ lu iĕm; 'nĕ kơ rơdu 'nĕ kơ hli.

English: “And every one of you came near to me and said, ‘Let us send men before us, and let them search out the land for us, and bring back word to us of the way by which we should go up, and of the cities into which we shall come.’
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu iĕm năm tơ inh păng khan: Wơh bĕ lu bơngai năm adrol kơ lu nhôn, wă kơ lu sư năm chop lăng dêh noh păng wih roi ăn kơ lu nhôn, trong ayơ lu nhôn wă tŏk năm păng pơlei ayơ lu nhôn gô mơ̆t.

English: “The plan pleased me well; so I took twelve of your men, one man from each tribe.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r âu inh lăp đon, inh rơih mơjĭt-'bar 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm, đơ̆ng rim adrĕch minh 'nu.

English: And they departed and went up into the mountains, and came to the Valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.
Bahnar: Mơjĭt-'bar 'nu lu đe noh năm, tŏk tơ kông, năm truh tơ thŭng Êskôl chop lăng dêh noh.

English: They also took some of the fruit of the land in their hands and brought it down to us; and they brought back word to us, saying, ‘It is a good land which the LORD our God is giving us.’
Bahnar: Lu sư phĕ chĕp ba plei 'long đơ̆ng dêh noh, ăn kơ lu bơ̆n; roi ăn kơ lu bơ̆n khan: Dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n ăn kơ lu bơ̆n 'lơ̆ng dêh.

English: “Nevertheless you would not go up, but rebelled against the command of the LORD your God
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă năm ôh păng sơngah kơ nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm tơtă.

English: and you complained in your tents, and said, ‘Because the LORD hates us, He has brought us out of the land of Egypt to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm pơma jŏk lăm bơsŭn lu iĕm khan: Yua kơ Kră Yang areh kơ lu bơ̆n, na chông tơlĕch bơ̆n đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, wă jao lu bơ̆n lăm tơpang ti lu kon pơlei Amôrit, wă pơlôch pơrăm bơ̆n.

English: Where can we go up? Our brethren have discouraged our hearts, saying, “The people are greater and taller than we; the cities are great and fortified up to heaven; moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakim there.” ’
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n wă năm tơ yơ? 'Nhŏng oh lu bơ̆n pơm kơ lu bơ̆n hli na khan: Adrĕch noh tih păng kơjung hloh kơ lu bơ̆n; pơlei lu sư ei tih păng man dur kơjăp kơjung truh tơ plĕnh; tơ noh lu nhôn kư̆m 'bôh lu kon sâu kon pơlei Anakim tih kơjung.

English: “Then I said to you, ‘Do not be terrified, or afraid of them.
Bahnar: Na inh khan kơ lu iĕm: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli tơrơ kơ kiơ.

English: The LORD your God, who goes before you, He will fight for you, according to all He did for you in Egypt before your eyes
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm năm adrol, sư gô tơblah dŏng lu iĕm, kư̆m thoi sư đei pơm boih 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm tơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: and in the wilderness where you saw how the LORD your God carried you, as a man carries his son, in all the way that you went until you came to this place.’
Bahnar: Păng lăm char glă, jơ̆ anih lu iĕm 'bôh lăm trong lu iĕm yak năm, mă truh tơ anih 'nâu, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk glơng iĕm thoi minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo pôk glơng kon drŏ-nglo sư kơdih.

English: Yet, for all that, you did not believe the LORD your God
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm oei ưh kơ lui kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm 'mơ̆i.

English: who went in the way before you to search out a place for you to pitch your tents, to show you the way you should go, in the fire by night and in the cloud by day.
Bahnar: Jơ̆ Tơ'ngla năm adrol chông lu iĕm năm rok trong wă chơchă kơ lu iĕm minh anih oei; kơmăng yua ŭnh, kơ'năr yua hơmơ̆l, wă ba trong lu iĕm yak năm.

English: “And the LORD heard the sound of your words, and was angry, and took an oath, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu iĕm, na blĕk dêh păng pơkăm khan

English: ‘Surely not one of these men of this evil generation shall see that good land of which I swore to give to your fathers
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei drŏ-nglo bu lăm adrĕch kơnê̆ âu gô 'bôh dêh 'lơ̆ng rŏ mă Inh đei pơkă wă ăn kơ lu 'bok iĕm.

English: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him and his children I am giving the land on which he walked, because he wholly followed the LORD.’
Bahnar: Lăp Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê; sư gô 'bôh dêh noh păng Inh gô ăn kơ sư hăm kon sâu sư dêh noh, mă đêl jơ̆ng sư juă. Yua kơ sư kiơ̆ Kră Yang kơjăp 'lơ̆ng hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m.

English: The LORD was also angry with me for your sakes, saying, ‘Even you shall not go in there.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng lu iĕm na Kră Yang kư̆m hil kơ inh, na khan: Ih kư̆m lei-lăi, ưh kơ gơh wă mơ̆t tơ dêh noh ôh.

English: Joshua the son of Nun, who stands before you, he shall go in there. Encourage him, for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
Bahnar: Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun, jơ̆ đĭch đam ih, sư gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh noh; pơm bĕ kơ jơhngơ̆m sư kơjăp, yua kơ đơ̆ng sư gô ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael gơh đei iŏk dêh noh.

English: ‘Moreover your little ones and your children, who you say will be victims, who today have no knowledge of good and evil, they shall go in there; to them I will give it, and they shall possess it.
Bahnar: Lu kon hơ'lơ̆p lu iĕm păng lu iĕm khan thoi kơ minh pôm tơmam prăn đĕch păng lu kon drŏ-nglo iĕm dang ei tam mă băt ôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng dah tơdrong kơnê̆, gô mơ̆t tơ dêh noh; Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư dêh âu bơ̆jang sa

English: But as for you, turn and take your journey into the wilderness by the Way of the Red Sea.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei bĕ lu iĕm, brŏk hơlơ̆k bĕ, chă thông huang tơ char glă tơklă đak Dơsĭ 'Brê.

English: “Then you answered and said to me, ‘We have sinned against the LORD; we will go up and fight, just as the LORD our God commanded us.’ And when everyone of you had girded on his weapons of war, you were ready to go up into the mountain.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu sư tơl inh: Lu nhôn pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang; lu nhôn gô năm blah păng pơm dôm tơdrong mă Kră Yang lu bơ̆n đei pơkă, kơ bơ̆n! Rim 'nu kơ lu drŏ-nglo lu iĕm hơmet tơlei tơ̆n chĕp đao hơlă tŏk tơ kông năm tơblah.

English: “And the LORD said to me, ‘Tell them, “Do not go up nor fight, for I am not among you; lest you be defeated before your enemies.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư; 'nĕ kơ tŏk păng 'nĕ kơ tơblah, yua kơ Inh ưh kơ oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm ôh. Kơnh hli kơ lu iĕm tơblah jei đe.

English: So I spoke to you; yet you would not listen, but rebelled against the command of the LORD, and presumptuously went up into the mountain.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh đei roi dơ̆ng kơ lu iĕm, mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ôh, pơma plơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă; lu iĕm 'bĕnh hăm tơdrong pơang, lu iĕm tơdui băl năm tŏk tơ dêh kông groi.

English: And the Amorites who dwelt in that mountain came out against you and chased you as bees do, and drove you back from Seir to Hormah.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai Amôrit mă oei lăm kông groi noh, lĕch đơ̆ng kông druh puh lu iĕm thoi sut, blah pơrăm lu iĕm lăm Seir truh tơ Horma.

English: Then you returned and wept before the LORD, but the LORD would not listen to your voice nor give ear to you.
Bahnar: Na lu iĕm brŏk nhơ̆m krao Kră Yang, mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng păng ưh kơ đei pơgling đon mơ̆ng lu iĕm.

English: “So you remained in Kadesh many days, according to the days that you spent there.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm oei tơ Kades đunh ưh kơ băt dang yơ!

English: “Then we turned and journeyed into the wilderness of the Way of the Red Sea, as the LORD spoke to me, and we skirted Mount Seir for many days.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơ̆n wơ̆t hơlơ̆k na yak năm tơ lăm char glă tơ gah đak Dơsĭ 'Brê, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ inh păng lu nhôn năm đunh năr dăr kơ kông groi Seir.

English: “And the LORD spoke to me, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei khan kơ inh

English: ‘You have skirted this mountain long enough; turn northward.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm năm dăr kơ dêh kông groi âu kư̆m hrăp đunh boih, na năm bĕ tơ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: And command the people, saying, “You are about to pass through the territory of your brethren, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir; and they will be afraid of you. Therefore watch yourselves carefully.
Bahnar: Roi bĕ kơ kon pơlei băt: Lu iĕm năm brih wă jê̆ teh đak lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm, kon sâu Êsâu, lu bơngai oei lăm char Seir, lu sư gô hli kơ lu iĕm na lu iĕm athei kơchăng bĕ.

English: Do not meddle with them, for I will not give you any of their land, no, not so much as one footstep, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau as a possession.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ đei tơblah hăm lu sư, yua kơ Inh ưh kơ ăn kơ lu iĕm char lu sư noh ôh, mă khan minh anih teh đêl tơpang jơ̆ng lu iĕm juă kư̆m ưh kơ ăn 'mơ̆i, yua kơ Inh đei ăn boih kơ Êsâu kông groi Seir âu wă kơ sư bơ̆jang sa.

English: You shall buy food from them with money, that you may eat; and you shall also buy water from them with money, that you may drink.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô răt tơmam sa đơ̆ng lu sư hăm jên hu thoi noh lu iĕm đei tơmam sŏng sa, lu iĕm kư̆m gô răt đak nhă đơ̆ng lu sư hăm jên hu na lu iĕm đei đak nhă.

English: “For the LORD your God has blessed you in all the work of your hand. He knows your trudging through this great wilderness. These forty years the LORD your God has been with you; you have lacked nothing.” ’
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn pŭn hiôk dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti iĕm pơm; Sư băt boih kơ tơdrong lu iĕm năm rok char glă să âu, lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm 'nâu, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm oei hăm iĕm boih; huay kơ kơ'bah kiơ ôh.

English: “And when we passed beyond our brethren, the descendants of Esau who dwell in Seir, away from the road of the plain, away from Elath and Ezion Geber, we turned and passed by way of the Wilderness of Moab.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơ̆n năm hlôi, weh đơ̆ng 'nhŏng oh lu bơ̆n, lu kon drŏ-nglo Êsâu, lu bơngai oei lăm char Seir, Bơ̆n weh đơ̆ng trong Araba, rok wer kơ trong Êlat păng Êsiôn Gêber tŏk đak Dơsĭ 'Brê năm tơpăt rok trong char glă Môap.

English: Then the LORD said to me, ‘Do not harass Moab, nor contend with them in battle, for I will not give you any of their land as a possession, because I have given Ar to the descendants of Lot as a possession.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: 'Nĕ kơ ayăt păng 'nĕ kơ tơblah hăm lu kon pơlei Môap; yua kơ Inh ưh kơ đei ăn kơ iĕm ôh dêh âu wă bơ̆jang sa, Inh ăn boih pơlei Ar kơ kon sâu Lot bơ̆jang sa.

English: (The Emim had dwelt there in times past, a people as great and numerous and tall as the Anakim.
Bahnar: Adrol sơ̆, kon pơlei Êmim oei tơ noh, jơ̆ minh adrĕch kon pơlei tih, lơ, akâu tih hơbŏ thoi adrĕch bơngai Anakim.

English: They were also regarded as giants, like the Anakim, but the Moabites call them Emim.
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m krao kon pơlei âu kon pơlei Rêphaim, a tih hơbŏ thoi adrĕch bơngai Anakim; mă-lei kon pơlei Môap krao lu sư bơngai Êmim.

English: The Horites formerly dwelt in Seir, but the descendants of Esau dispossessed them and destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their place, just as Israel did to the land of their possession which the LORD gave them.)
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Hôrit adrol sơ̆ kư̆m oei tơ char Seir; mă-lei kon sâu Êsâu pơlôch pơrăm đĭ kon pơlei păng oei tơplih kơ lu sư tơ noh, kư̆m thoi bơngai Isơrael pơm kơ dêh mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn kơ lu sư bơ̆jang sa.

English: “ ‘Now rise and cross over the Valley of the Zered.’ So we crossed over the Valley of the Zered.
Bahnar: Dang ei, iung bĕ năm tŏk thong đak glung Sêret. Thoi noh lu nhôn năm hlôi boih kơ thong đak glung Sêret.

English: And the time we took to come from Kadesh Barnea until we crossed over the Valley of the Zered was thirty-eight years, until all the generation of the men of war was consumed from the midst of the camp, just as the LORD had sworn to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, măng năr lu nhôn, lĕch đơ̆ng Kades Barnêa, truh tơ năm hlôi kơ đak glung Sêret, đunh đei pêng-jĭt tơhngam sơnăm đĭ lăm minh chăl dĭng mah đĭ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo mă gơh pơm linh lôch đĭ đơ̆ng lăm kơđông, kư̆m thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă boih.

English: For indeed the hand of the LORD was against them, to destroy them from the midst of the camp until they were consumed.
Bahnar: Tơpă, yua kơ đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang hil pơrăm lu sư đơ̆ng lăm kơđông dĭng mah răm đĭ.

English: “So it was, when all the men of war had finally perished from among the people
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu bơngai pơm linh hlôi tôch hiong đĭ boih đơ̆ng kon pơlei

English: that the LORD spoke to me, saying
Bahnar: na Kră Yang khan kơ inh

English: ‘This day you are to cross over at Ar, the boundary of Moab.
Bahnar: Năr âu, lu iĕm gô năm rok pơlei Ar lăm dêh Môap.

English: And when you come near the people of Ammon, do not harass them or meddle with them, for I will not give you any of the land of the people of Ammon as a possession, because I have given it to the descendants of Lot as a possession.’ ”
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm năm truh jê̆ kon sâu Ammôn, 'nĕ kơ ayăt păng tơblah hăm lu sư hŏ; yua kơ Inh ưh kơ ăn kơ iĕm ôh dêh char đơ̆ng kon sâu Ammôn jing teh iĕm jang sa, đơ̆ng Inh ăn boih dêh noh kơ lu kon sâu Lot bơ̆jang sa.

English: (That was also regarded as a land of giants; giants formerly dwelt there. But the Ammonites call them Zamzummim
Bahnar: Dêh âu dêh Rêphaim, adrol sơ̆ kon pơlei Rêphaim oei tơ noh, kon pơlei Ammôn krao anăn Samsumim.

English: a people as great and numerous and tall as the Anakim. But the LORD destroyed them before them, and they dispossessed them and dwelt in their place
Bahnar: Minh adrĕch kon pơlei tih păng lơ, hơbŏ sư tih kơjung thoi adrĕch kon pơlei Anakim, mă-lei Kră Yang pơrăm lê̆ lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Amôn; kon pơlei Amôn puh tơgar iŏk dêh noh păng oei hloi tơ noh

English: just as He had done for the descendants of Esau, who dwelt in Seir, when He destroyed the Horites from before them. They dispossessed them and dwelt in their place, even to this day.
Bahnar: kư̆m thoi Kră Yang pơm kơ lu kon sâu Êsâu, oei tơ char Seir, kơplah mă Kră Yang pơrăm kon pơlei Hôrit 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon sâu Êsâu; lu sư puh tơgar iŏk dêh kon pơlei Hôrit păng oei hloi tơ noh dĭng truh dang ei.

English: And the Avim, who dwelt in villages as far as Gaza—the Caphtorim, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and dwelt in their place.)
Bahnar: Bĕ gah kon pơlei Awim, oei đơ̆ng lăm lu pơlei iĕ truh tơ pơlei Gasa, kon pơlei Kaptorim, oei đơ̆ng char Kaptôr pơrăm lu sư na oei hloi tơ noh.

English: “ ‘Rise, take your journey, and cross over the River Arnon. Look, I have given into your hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin to possess it, and engage him in battle.
Bahnar: Iung bĕ, yak năm hlôi kơ đak glung Arnôn to;b Inh jao Sihôn, pơtao Hesbôn, bơngai Amôrit, hăm dêh lu sư lăm tơpang ti iĕm; pơtơm iŏk bĕ păng tơblah hăm lu sư.

English: This day I will begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the nations under the whole heaven, who shall hear the report of you, and shall tremble and be in anguish because of you.’
Bahnar: Năr âu Inh gô pơm ăn kơ lu kon pơlei pơla mă oei lăm kơpal teh âu gô hli păng krưp dêh đei kơtơ̆ng roi gah iĕm, lu kon pơlei noh gô tơtơ̆ păng hli krưp dêh kơ iĕm.

English: “And I sent messengers from the Wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng char glă Kađêmôt, inh wơh bơngai năm roi kơ Sihôn, pơtao Hesbôn, iŏk nơ̆r pơma hiôk hăm lu sư khan

English: ‘Let me pass through your land; I will keep strictly to the road, and I will turn neither to the right nor to the left.
Bahnar: Apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn yak năm rok dêh ih. Nhôn yak năm rok kiơ̆ trong tih, nhôn ưh kơ weh tơ 'ma dah tơ 'ngiĕo ôh.

English: You shall sell me food for money, that I may eat, and give me water for money, that I may drink; only let me pass through on foot
Bahnar: Ih iŏk jên hu 'nâu tĕch ăn tơmam sa wă kơ nhôn đei sa; iŏk jên hu 'nâu tĕch ăn đak, wă kơ ôn inh đei đak nhă; păng wă kơ inh gơh rok năm hloi.

English: just as the descendants of Esau who dwell in Seir and the Moabites who dwell in Ar did for me, until I cross the Jordan to the land which the LORD our God is giving us.’
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi kon sâu Êsâu mă oei tơ char Seir păng kon pơlei Môap mă oei tơ char Ar hlôi ăn boih kơ inh thoi noh gô dĭng mă nhôn tŏk năm hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, wă mơ̆t tơ dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nhôn wă ăn kơ nhôn.

English: “But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass through, for the LORD your God hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate, that He might deliver him into your hand, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sihôn, pơtao Hesbôn, ưh kơ ăn kơ lu nhôn yak năm rok teh đak lu sư ôh; yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm jơhngơ̆m kơ̆l pơtao arăng, wă jao sư lăm tơpang ti nhôn, kư̆m thoi năr 'nâu.

English: “And the LORD said to me, ‘See, I have begun to give Sihon and his land over to you. Begin to possess it, that you may inherit his land.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Âu na dang ei Inh jao ăn kơ iĕm Sihôn păng dêh char sư, iŏk bĕ wă kơ ih gơh oei bơ̆jang sa lăm char sư.

English: Then Sihon and all his people came out against us to fight at Jahaz.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Sihôn păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei sư lĕch wă tơ'bơ̆p păng tơblah hăm lu bơ̆n tơ pơlei Jahas.

English: And the LORD our God delivered him over to us; so we defeated him, his sons, and all his people.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n jao sư kơ lu bơ̆n; kon drŏ-nglo hăm đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei sư tơblah jei bơ̆n.

English: We took all his cities at that time, and we utterly destroyed the men, women, and little ones of every city; we left none remaining.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh bơ̆n iŏk đĭ lu pơlei tih sư, pơrăm đĭ lu pơlei tih păng pơrăm đĭ-đăng drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn păng lu kon hơ'lơ̆p, ưh kơ đei lê̆ minh 'nu bu.

English: We took only the livestock as plunder for ourselves, with the spoil of the cities which we took.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n plah tơgar iŏk sem dơrong păng mŭk tơmam lăm pơlei tih mă đêl blah iŏk jei bơ̆n.

English: From Aroer, which is on the bank of the River Arnon, and from the city that is in the ravine, as far as Gilead, there was not one city too strong for us; the LORD our God delivered all to us.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng pơlei Arôe; mă oei tơter thong đak glung Arnôn păng lu pơlei tih oei lăm thŭng truh tơ Gileat, ưh kơ đei minh pôm pơlei tih ayơ mă pơm kơjăp dêh 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơ̆n; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n jao đĭ lu pơlei noh ăn kơ bơ̆n.

English: Only you did not go near the land of the people of Ammon—anywhere along the River Jabbok, or to the cities of the mountains, or wherever the LORD our God had forbidden us.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ pôm dêh kon sâu Ammôn mă oei jơ̆p tơter đak krong Jabôk, dah lu pơlei tih kơpal kông groi, dah mă anih ayơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n khă ưh kơ ăn lu bơ̆n tơgar iŏk.

English: “Then we turned and went up the road to Bashan; and Og king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơ̆n wơ̆t hơlơ̆k rok trong char Basan păng Ôk pơtao char Basan iung blah bơ̆n, sư păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei sư wă tơblah lu bơ̆n tơ Êdrei.

English: And the LORD said to me, ‘Do not fear him, for I have delivered him and all his people and his land into your hand; you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Ih 'nĕ hli kơ sư ôh, yua kơ Inh jao sư, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei păng dêh sư lăm tơpang ti iĕm boih; iĕm gô pơm kơ sư kư̆m thoi iĕm pơm boih kơ Sihôn, pơtao đe Amôrit, mă oei tơ pơlei Hesbôn.

English: “So the LORD our God also delivered into our hands Og king of Bashan, with all his people, and we attacked him until he had no survivors remaining.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n jao boih lăm tơpang ti lu bơ̆n Ôk, pơtao char Basan păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei sư: Lu bơ̆n blah pơrăm lu sư dĭng truh tơ ưh pă đei minh 'nu bơngai bu oei arih dơ̆ng.

English: And we took all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we did not take from them: sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơ̆n iŏk đĭ lu pơlei tih sư, ưh kơ đei pơlei tih ayơ đơ̆ng mă lu bơ̆n ưh kơ tam iŏk; đei tơdrâu-jĭt tŏ pơlei tih păng đĭ tơring Argôp, teh đak pơtao Ôk lăm dêh Basan.

English: All these cities were fortified with high walls, gates, and bars, besides a great many rural towns.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu pơlei tih noh jơ̆ pơlei kơjăp đei dur kơjung, 'măng jang păng đei 'long chơkăl; hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng kư̆m đei lơ lu pơlei mă ưh kơ đei dur.

English: And we utterly destroyed them, as we did to Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children of every city.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n pơrăm goh đĭ lu sư, kư̆m thoi lu bơ̆n pơm boih kơ Sihôn, pơtao đe Hesbôn, pơrăm đĭ lu pơlei tih, lu bơngai drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn păng lu kon hơ'lơ̆p.

English: But all the livestock and the spoil of the cities we took as booty for ourselves.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơ̆n blah iŏk lu sem dơrong păng mŭk tơmam mă lu pơlei đêl tơblah jei bơ̆n.

English: “And at that time we took the land from the hand of the two kings of the Amorites who were on this side of the Jordan, from the River Arnon to Mount Hermon
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơ̆n blah iŏk teh đơ̆ng 'bar 'nu pơtao Amôrit lăm char noh mă oei pah to Krong Jôrđăn, iŏk đơ̆ng glung Arnôn truh tơ Kông Hermôn.

English: (the Sidonians call Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir)
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Siđôn krao kông Hermôn noh kông Siriôn, gah kon pơlei Amôrit krao kông Sênir

English: all the cities of the plain, all Gilead, and all Bashan, as far as Salcah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu pơlei tih lăm char glă Gileat păng Basan truh tơ pơlei Salêka păng pơlei Êdrei 'bar tŏ pơlei tih teh đak pơtao Ôk lăm char Basan.

English: “For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of the giants. Indeed his bedstead was an iron bedstead. (Is it not in Rabbah of the people of Ammon?) Nine cubits is its length and four cubits its width, according to the standard cubit.
Bahnar: Gah adrĕch Rêphaim oei đei minh 'nu Ôka arih pơtao char Basan, giơng sư pơm păng mam tor giơng tơsĭn hơgăt, wơ̆l giơng puăn hơgăt. Oei đei tơ Raba pơlei tih kon sâu Ammôn

English: “And this land, which we possessed at that time, from Aroer, which is by the River Arnon, and half the mountains of Gilead and its cities, I gave to the Reubenites and the Gadites.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu bơ̆n đei iŏk dêh noh, jing char bơ̆n inh asong ăn kơ adrĕch Rubên păng Gat iŏk đơ̆ng tơring gah yă-nơ̆m pơlei Arôe, tơ rok thŭng đak glung Arnôn păng minh puăt kông groi Gileat, hăm lu pơlei tih sư.

English: The rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to half the tribe of Manasseh. (All the region of Argob, with all Bashan, was called the land of the giants.
Bahnar: Inh klah asong minh puăt kơ adrĕch Manase, mă oei minh puăt lăm kông groi Gileat păng char Basan teh đak pơtao Ôk, wă khan đĭ tơring Argôp lăm char Basan. Tơring ei đe krao dêh Rêphaim.

English: Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob, as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maachathites, and called Bashan after his own name, Havoth Jair, to this day.)
Bahnar: Jair adrĕch Manase, iŏk đĭ tơring Argôp truh tơ hơdral kon pơlei Gêsur păng Makathit, krao anăn sư kơdih pơlei Hawôt Jar lu pơlei lăm dêh Basan, truh tơ dang ei.

English: “Also I gave Gilead to Machir.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m asong ăn kơ Makir dêh Gileat.

English: And to the Reubenites and the Gadites I gave from Gilead as far as the River Arnon, the middle of the river as the border, as far as the River Jabbok, the border of the people of Ammon
Bahnar: Gah lu adrĕch Rubên păng Gat, inh klah asong ăn teh iŏk đơ̆ng gơal char Gileat tơ thong đak glung Arnôn, hơdral gah yă-nơ̆m iŏk đơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk đak krong Jabôk krong 'nâu hơdral lu kon sâu Ammôn.

English: the plain also, with the Jordan as the border, from Chinnereth as far as the east side of the Sea of the Arabah (the Salt Sea), below the slopes of Pisgah.
Bahnar: Hơdral gah bơmơ̆t noh thŭng glă Jôrđăn lăm teh Araba, đơ̆ng Kinêret truh tơ thŭng glă đak dơsĭ Araba noh đak Dơsĭ 'Boh, b tơ jơ̆ng kông Pisga, tơ gah hơlĕch.

English: “Then I commanded you at that time, saying: ‘The LORD your God has given you this land to possess. All you men of valor shall cross over armed before your brethren, the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, inh tơtă kơ lu iĕm, khan, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm jao boih dêh âu kơ lu iĕm iŏk bơ̆jang sa; đĭ-đăng lu bơngai nuih kơtang lu iĕm athei chĕp đao hơlă yak năm adrol kơ lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n, kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: But your wives, your little ones, and your livestock (I know that you have much livestock) shall stay in your cities which I have given you
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu kon akăn păng sem dơrong lu iĕm. Inh băt kơ lu iĕm đei lơ sem dơrong, lê̆ oei kơtă lăm pơlei tih mă inh ăn boih kơ lu iĕm.

English: until the LORD has given rest to your brethren as to you, and they also possess the land which the LORD your God is giving them beyond the Jordan. Then each of you may return to his possession which I have given you.’
Bahnar: Dĭng mă Kră Yang ăn 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm đei tơdrong pơdơh hiôk thoi bơ̆n păng lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm kư̆m gơh iŏk boih dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm ăn kơ lu sư tơ gah pah to đak Krong Jôrđăn; klaih kơ noh đĭ-đăng kơ lu iĕm gơh wih brŏk bơ̆jang sa mă teh inh đei ăn boih kơ lu iĕm.

English: “And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, ‘Your eyes have seen all that the LORD your God has done to these two kings; so will the LORD do to all the kingdoms through which you pass.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh inh pơkă boih kơ Jôsuê: Măt ih 'bôh boih dôm tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm hlôi pơm boih kơ 'bar 'nu pơtao âu; Kră Yang kư̆m gô pơm thoi noh kơ dôm lu teh đak ayơ mă iĕm wă năm mơ̆t.

English: You must not fear them, for the LORD your God Himself fights for you.’
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli lu teh đak noh; yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm gô blah dŏng lu iĕm.

English: “Then I pleaded with the LORD at that time, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah ei; inh krao khan hăm Kră Yang thoi âu

English: ‘O Lord GOD, You have begun to show Your servant Your greatness and Your mighty hand, for what god is there in heaven or on earth who can do anything like Your works and Your mighty deeds?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih hlôi tơ'bôh kơ đĭch đam Ih tơdrong krưp tih păng tơpang ti mơyang Ih, yua kơpal plĕnh ala teh âu ưh kơ đei yang ayơ gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang thoi Ih.

English: I pray, let me cross over and see the good land beyond the Jordan, those pleasant mountains, and Lebanon.’
Bahnar: Inh apinh Ih ăn kơ inh gơh 'bôh teh đak 'lơ̆ng rŏ, hăm kông groi tih rŏ păng kông Liban mă oei pah to đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: “But the LORD was angry with me on your account, and would not listen to me. So the LORD said to me: ‘Enough of that! Speak no more to Me of this matter.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan; yua kơ đơ̆ng lu iĕm na Kră Yang hil kơ inh, kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Tôm boih; 'nĕ pă roi gah tơdrong 'nâu dơ̆ng kơ Inh.

English: Go up to the top of Pisgah, and lift your eyes toward the west, the north, the south, and the east; behold it with your eyes, for you shall not cross over this Jordan.
Bahnar: Tŏk bĕ tơ kông Pisga, đơ̆ng noh ih lăng tơ gah bơmơ̆t, tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, tơ gah gơal păng tơ gah hơlĕch, na ih lăng dêh noh, yua kơ ih ưh kơ gơh năm hlôi kơ Krong Jôrđăn 'nâu.

English: But command Joshua, and encourage him and strengthen him; for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which you will see.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei athei jao bĕ kơ Jôsuê, tơgŭm jơhngơ̆m sư mă kơjăp, yua kơ sư gô chông ba kon pơlei 'nâu, tŏk blah iŏk dêh mă ih đei lăng 'bôh noh.

English: “So we stayed in the valley opposite Beth Peor.
Bahnar: Lei na lu bơ̆n oei lăm thŭng jê̆ Bet Pêôr.

English: “Now, O Israel, listen to the statutes and the judgments which I teach you to observe, that you may live, and go in and possess the land which the LORD God of your fathers is giving you.
Bahnar: Ơ Isơrael! Mơ̆ng bĕ khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă mă inh gô pơhrăm lu iĕm, wă kơ lu iĕm gơh đei arih păng gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu iĕm wă ăn kơ lu iĕm iŏk.

English: You shall not add to the word which I command you, nor take from it, that you may keep the commandments of the LORD your God which I command you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ thim kiơ păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hŭt lê̆ kiơ dôm nơ̆r inh wă khan kơ iĕm, mă-lei athei wei răk dôm nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, nơ̆r tơtă mă inh wă bơtho kơ lu iĕm.

English: Your eyes have seen what the LORD did at Baal Peor; for the LORD your God has destroyed from among you all the men who followed Baal of Peor.
Bahnar: Măt lu iĕm hlôi 'bôh boih dôm tơdrong Kră Yang pơm tơ Baal Pêôr. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm đei pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ Baal Pêôr đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm.

English: But you who held fast to the LORD your God are alive today, every one of you.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu oei kiơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm kơjăp, oei arih ngăl truh năr âu.

English: “Surely I have taught you statutes and judgments, just as the LORD my God commanded me, that you should act according to them in the land which you go to possess.
Bahnar: Inh đei bơtho lu iĕm lu nơ̆r tơtă păng khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh tơtă boih kơ inh, wă kơ lu iĕm pơm kiơ̆ mưh iĕm mơ̆t oei boih tơ lăm dêh char noh.

English: Therefore be careful to observe them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples who will hear all these statutes, and say, ‘Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei wei răk pơm kiơ̆ bĕ dôm lu nơ̆r tơtă păng khôi juăt âu; yua kơ noh jơ̆ tơdrong hơgei păng tơdrong hlôh wao lu iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp lu adrĕch adrung đe nai. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng gah khôi juăt âu, na lu sư khan: Lu kon pơlei âu jơ̆ minh adrĕch hơgei păng hlôh wao!

English: “For what great nation is there that has God so near to it, as the LORD our God is to us, for whatever reason we may call upon Him?
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei adrĕch tih ayơ mă đei yang jê̆ lu sư thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei jê̆ lu bơ̆n ling-lang na mơ̆ng rim nơ̆r krao khan thoi bơ̆n

English: And what great nation is there that has such statutes and righteous judgments as are in all this law which I set before you this day?
Bahnar: Hăm đei ưh adrĕch adrung tih ayơ đei lu nơ̆r tơtă păng khôi juăt 'lơ̆ng tơpăt thoi khôi juăt đĭ tơdrong juăt âu, mă inh pơdah 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm âu?

English: Only take heed to yourself, and diligently keep yourself, lest you forget the things your eyes have seen, and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life. And teach them to your children and your grandchildren
Bahnar: Athei wei răk, pơ'lơ̆ng kơdih akâu iĕm, kơnh hli kơ iĕm hiơt dôm tơdrong mă măt lu iĕm 'bôh boih păng 'nĕ ăn lu tơdrong noh lĕch đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm păng athei bơtho bĕ kơ lu kon sâu se iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: especially concerning the day you stood before the LORD your God in Horeb, when the LORD said to me, ‘Gather the people to Me, and I will let them hear My words, that they may learn to fear Me all the days they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children.’
Bahnar: 'Blŏk bĕ kơ năr iĕm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm tơ Hôrêp kơplah noh Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: Krao akŭm bĕ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei, wă kơ lu sư mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, wă pơhrăm ăn kơ lu sư băt hli yom kơ Inh kơplah lu sư oei arih tơ kơpal teh âu păng wă kơ lu sư bơtho nơ̆r âu ăn kơ lu kon sâu se lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: “Then you came near and stood at the foot of the mountain, and the mountain burned with fire to the midst of heaven, with darkness, cloud, and thick darkness.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm năm jê̆ păng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng kông, 'bơ̆t kông ŭnh oei sa dơhlông truh tơ plĕnh, đei hơmơ̆l măng mu găm suek gom.

English: And the LORD spoke to you out of the midst of the fire. You heard the sound of the words, but saw no form; you only heard a voice.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh Kră Yang khan kơ lu iĕm, lu iĕm kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư pơma, mă-lei ưh kơ đei 'bôh akâu Sư ôh, lăp kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma đĕch.

English: So He declared to you His covenant which He commanded you to perform, the Ten Commandments; and He wrote them on two tablets of stone.
Bahnar: Sư roi ăn kơ lu iĕm băt tơdrong Sư pơgơ̆p nơ̆r Sư tơtă wă kơ lu iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆, thoi mơjĭt nơ̆r tơtă, Sư chih tơ kơpal 'bar hlak tơmo lat.

English: And the LORD commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, that you might observe them in the land which you cross over to possess.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah noh, Kră Yang athei inh bơtho tơ'bôh kơ lu iĕm dôm nơ̆r tơtă păng khôi juăt wă kơ lu iĕm pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong noh tơ lăm dêh mă lu iĕm gô tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn năm mơ̆t iŏk.

English: “Take careful heed to yourselves, for you saw no form when the LORD spoke to you at Horeb out of the midst of the fire
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei kơchăng bĕ kơdih, yua kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ đei 'bôh ôh akâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, đơ̆ng lăm tŏk-bŏk ŭnh lăm năr Sư pơma khan kơ lu iĕm tơ kông Hôrêp.

English: lest you act corruptly and make for yourselves a carved image in the form of any figure: the likeness of male or female
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ kơnh hli kơ lu iĕm pơrăm akâu kơdih, na chă pơm kơdih lu rup yang, pơm hơbŏ thoi rup bơngai drŏ-nglo dah bơngai drŏ-kăn

English: the likeness of any animal that is on the earth or the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the air
Bahnar: dah hơbŏ thoi rup kon sem brem mơmŏ kơpal teh, dah hơbŏ thoi rup kon sem brem đei pơnăr păr kơpal plĕnh

English: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground or the likeness of any fish that is in the water beneath the earth.
Bahnar: dah hơbŏ thoi rup lu hơdrông kơep mơmŏ ah klak kơpal teh, dah hơbŏ thoi lu rup ka oei lăm đak.

English: And take heed, lest you lift your eyes to heaven, and when you see the sun, the moon, and the stars, all the host of heaven, you feel driven to worship them and serve them, which the LORD your God has given to all the peoples under the whole heaven as a heritage.
Bahnar: Kơnh hli kơ lu iĕm pơm ngoi lăng tơ plĕnh 'bôh măt 'năr, măt khei, lu sơnglŏng dôm lu tơmam kơpal plĕnh, kơnh iĕm 'maih wă kơkuh kơ dôm lu tơmam noh păng drap kơkuh kơ lu sư. Mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei asong ăn tơmam noh kơ kon bơngai oei ala teh âu.

English: But the LORD has taken you and brought you out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be His people, an inheritance, as you are this day.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm, Kră Yang rơih păng iŏk lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, thoi ŭnh đei 'buh bơsei ngur lăm ŭnh wă kơ lu iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla Sư kơdih, thoi iĕm năr âu.

English: Furthermore the LORD was angry with me for your sakes, and swore that I would not cross over the Jordan, and that I would not enter the good land which the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang hil kơ inh; yua kơ lu iĕm na Sư pơkăm khan ưh kơ ăn inh tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn păng ưh kơ ăn inh mơ̆t tơ dêh 'lơ̆ng rŏ mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm wă ăn kơ lu iĕm bơ̆jang sa.

English: But I must die in this land, I must not cross over the Jordan; but you shall cross over and possess that good land.
Bahnar: Inh gô lôch tơ lăm dêh âu, ưh kơ gơh tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, mă-lei lu iĕm gô năm hlôi păng iŏk dêh 'lơ̆ng rŏ ei.

English: Take heed to yourselves, lest you forget the covenant of the LORD your God which He made with you, and make for yourselves a carved image in the form of anything which the LORD your God has forbidden you.
Bahnar: Athei kơchăng bĕ kơdih akâu iĕm, 'nĕ kơ hiơt tơdrong pơgơ̆p đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm mă đei pơgơ̆p hăm lu iĕm păng 'nĕ kơ pơm rup yang, rup sem brem ayơ mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm khă.

English: For the LORD your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm thoi kơ ŭnh soh chhông păng jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei băt kơ gar.

English: “When you beget children and grandchildren and have grown old in the land, and act corruptly and make a carved image in the form of anything, and do evil in the sight of the LORD your God to provoke Him to anger
Bahnar: Mưh lu iĕm đei kon sâu păng oei tơ dêh noh đunh boih, tơdah lu iĕm pơm yoch kơnê̆ pơrăm akâu kơdih thoi pơm kơ rup yang dah rup sem brem kiơ, mă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ kiơ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm wă pơm kơ Sư blĕk.

English: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that you will soon utterly perish from the land which you cross over the Jordan to possess; you will not prolong your days in it, but will be utterly destroyed.
Bahnar: Năr âu inh krao plĕnh păng teh pơm kơdranh kơ lu iĕm thoi âu dah lu iĕm ưh kơ chu pơm kiơ̆ Kră Yang, lu iĕm gô lôch hiong 'bônh đĕch đơ̆ng dêh iĕm wă năm iŏk tơ pah to đak Krong Jôrđăn. Lu iĕm ưh kơ oei tơ noh đunh ôh, mă-lei gô lôch đĭ.

English: And the LORD will scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left few in number among the nations where the LORD will drive you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm kơ iĕm tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ teh đak đe, oei pă tŏ sĕt đĕch mă tơ anih Kră Yang puh lu iĕm.

English: And there you will serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see nor hear nor eat nor smell.
Bahnar: Tơ noh lu iĕm gô kơkuh kơ rup yang pơm păng 'long păng tơmo, jơ̆ tơdrong jang tơpang ti kon bơngai pơm, ưh kơ gơh 'bôh, ưh kơ kơtơ̆ng ưh kơ gơh sa, kư̆m ưh kơ băt 'bâu.

English: But from there you will seek the LORD your God, and you will find Him if you seek Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng noh lu iĕm gô krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, layơ iĕm chă Kră Yang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m, đĭ tơdrong tơchĕng na gơh tơ'bơ̆p Sư.

English: When you are in distress, and all these things come upon you in the latter days, when you turn to the LORD your God and obey His voice
Bahnar: Kơplah lu iĕm đei tơdrong pơmat-tat păng đei dôm tơdrong truh kơ iĕm, lăm năr mă tuch-luch, lu iĕm gô wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư.

English: (for the LORD your God is a merciful God), He will not forsake you nor destroy you, nor forget the covenant of your fathers which He swore to them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei băt mơnat ưh kơ achăng lê̆ păng ưh kơ pơrăm pơlôch iĕm ôh; kư̆m ưh kơ hiơt kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă đơ̆ng Sư pơkă pơkăm boih hăm 'bok lu iĕm.

English: “For ask now concerning the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and ask from one end of heaven to the other, whether any great thing like this has happened, or anything like it has been heard.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, iĕm athei apinh lăng iŏk đơ̆ng jơhnơr đei adrol kơ iĕm sơ̆, đơ̆ng năr Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing kon bơngai kơpal teh, đơ̆ng tôch plĕnh âu truh tơ tôch plĕnh to, hăm tam đei tơdrong kiơ truh boih tih dah đei kơtơ̆ng tơdrong kiơ boih thoi noh?

English: Did any people ever hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and live?
Bahnar: Hăm tam đei minh adrĕch ayơ kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh thoi lu iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng boih mă oei arih dang ei.

English: Or did God ever try to go and take for Himself a nation from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs, by wonders, by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
Bahnar: Hăm tam đei yang kiơ rơih iŏk minh adrĕch kon pơlei 'nâu đơ̆ng adrĕch kon pơlei nai kơ sư kơdih, hăm tơdrong pơlong lăng, hăm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp, hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang đơ̆ng ti sư, hăm tơdrong tơblah, hăm tơdrong hli krưp thoi đĭ-đăng tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm đei pơm boih kơ lu iĕm hăm dêh char Êyiptơ 'bơ̆t tơm măt lu iĕm?

English: To you it was shown, that you might know that the LORD Himself is God; there is none other besides Him.
Bahnar: Đei tơ'bôh boih kơ lu iĕm dôm tơdrong noh, wă băt kơ Kră Yang 'noh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ bu nai dơ̆ng.

English: Out of heaven He let you hear His voice, that He might instruct you; on earth He showed you His great fire, and you heard His words out of the midst of the fire.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh Sư ăn kơ iĕm kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư, wă bơtho pơhrăm iĕm, tơ kơpal teh Sư ăn kơ iĕm 'bôh ŭnh tih Sư păng đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh lu iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư pơma.

English: And because He loved your fathers, therefore He chose their descendants after them; and He brought you out of Egypt with His Presence, with His mighty power
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng Sư 'mêm kơ lu 'bok iĕm, na rơih iŏk adrĕch adrung lu iĕm 'nâu, kơ Sư kơdih păng Sư yua tơdrong mơsêh tih Sư krao tơlĕch boih iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: driving out from before you nations greater and mightier than you, to bring you in, to give you their land as an inheritance, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Sư puh lê̆ lu adrĕch adrung tih hloh păng pran hloh kơ iĕm, wă ba iĕm năm mơ̆t tơ dêh noh păng ăn kơ iĕm teh noh wă kơ lu iĕm jang sa, thoi iĕm đei 'bôh dang ei.

English: Therefore know this day, and consider it in your heart, that the LORD Himself is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath; there is no other.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, dang ei iĕm athei băt păng chih răk bĕ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm: Kră Yang noh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kơpal plĕnh ti păng tơ ala teh âu; ưh kơ đei bu nai dơ̆ng.

English: You shall therefore keep His statutes and His commandments which I command you today, that it may go well with you and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which the LORD your God is giving you for all time.”
Bahnar: Wei răk bĕ dôm lu khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Sư, tơdrong mă inh bơtho boih kơ iĕm năr 'nâu, wă kơ iĕm păng kon sâu iĕm gơh đei hiôk-hian wă kơ lu iĕm oei arih sot lăm dêh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ iĕm ling-lang truh ning-mônh.

English: Then Moses set apart three cities on this side of the Jordan, toward the rising of the sun
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Môis klah lê̆ pêng tŏ pơlei tih tơ gah hơlĕch kơ Krong Jôrđăn

English: that the manslayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unintentionally, without having hated him in time past, and that by fleeing to one of these cities he might live
Bahnar: wă kơ lu bơngai pơlôch bơngai kơdâu ôn tơ noh, bơngai mă pơlôch rông 'bôt sư hơch 'bơm ưh kơ pơrơ̆ng ôh, ưh kơ đei chă ayăt băl đơ̆ng adrol, wă kơ sư gơh klaih đơ̆ng đe wă pơlôch 'mong, na kơdâu ôn mơ̆t lăm pơlei noh.

English: Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau for the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
Bahnar: Noh pơlei Bêser, lăm dêh teh dơnă lê̆ kơ lu adrĕch Rubên; Ramôt lăm tơring Gileat, lê̆ kơ lu adrĕch Gat păng pơlei Gôlan tơring Basan lê̆ kơ adrĕch Manase.

English: Now this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih khôi juăt mă Môis tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: These are the testimonies, the statutes, and the judgments which Moses spoke to the children of Israel after they came out of Egypt
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong tơbăt păng khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă mă Môis bơtho ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: on this side of the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel defeated after they came out of Egypt.
Bahnar: Mă oei gah hơlĕch đak Krong Jôrđăn, lăm thŭng tơklă Bet Pêôr tơ dêh Sihôn, pơtao kon pơlei Amôrit, oei tơ pơlei Hesbôn, Môis păng kon pơlei Isơrael blah iŏk jei đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And they took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, two kings of the Amorites, who were on this side of the Jordan, toward the rising of the sun
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael tơgar iŏk dêh noh hloi păng dêh Ôk pơtao char Basan, noh 'bar 'nu pơtao kon pơlei Amôrit oei tơ gah hơlĕch kơ Krong Jôrđăn

English: from Aroer, which is on the bank of the River Arnon, even to Mount Sion (that is, Hermon)
Bahnar: Teh âu iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Arôe jih thong đak Arnôn, truh tơ Kông Siriôn, wă khan kông Hermôn.

English: and all the plain on the east side of the Jordan as far as the Sea of the Arabah, below the slopes of Pisgah.
Bahnar: Păng đĭ tơmăn glă tơ gah hơlĕch kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, truh tơ đak dơsĭ Araba,a boih ala jơ̆ng kông Pisga.

English: And Moses called all Israel, and said to them: “Hear, O Israel, the statutes and judgments which I speak in your hearing today, that you may learn them and be careful to observe them.
Bahnar: Môis krao đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael na khan: Ơ bơngai Isơrael! Mơ̆ng bĕ dôm lu khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă inh roi ăn kơ lu iĕm băt năr 'nâu; lu iĕm athei pơhrăm hŏk iŏk mă pơ'lơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu tơdrong noh.

English: The LORD our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n đei pơgơ̆p boih hăm lu bơ̆n tơ kông Hôrêp.

English: The LORD did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, those who are here today, all of us who are alive.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ hăm lu 'bok bơ̆n đĕch mă Kră Yang pơgơ̆p boih noh ôh, mă-lei hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơ̆n dang ei mă oei arih 'nâu.

English: The LORD talked with you face to face on the mountain from the midst of the fire.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơma boih hăm lu iĕm tơ kơpal kông đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh.

English: I stood between the LORD and you at that time, to declare to you the word of the LORD; for you were afraid because of the fire, and you did not go up the mountain. He said
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, inh dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk Kră Yang hăm lu iĕm, wă bơtho nơ̆r đơ̆ng Sư ăn kơ lu iĕm; yua kơ lu iĕm hli kơ ŭnh, lu iĕm ưh kơ tŏk tơ kơpal kông. Kră Yang khan

English: ‘I am the LORD your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, Tơ'ngla tơlĕch lu iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, lĕch đơ̆ng pơm đĭch.

English: ‘You shall have no other gods before Me.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơkuh kơ yang nai, 'nguaih kơ Inh.

English: ‘You shall not make for yourself a carved image—any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm rup yang na kơkuh, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pơm rup nhen thoi tơmam kơpal plĕnh dah nhen sem brem thoi tơ ala teh âu, dah nhen thoi ka lăm đak sŭng.

English: you shall not bow down to them nor serve them. For I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp lu rup noh păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ soi sơmah kơ lu sư noh, yua kơ Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, wă khan jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei băt gar. Bơngai bu areh kơ Inh, Inh gô phak bơngai noh truh tơ kon sâu se sư pêng puăn jơhnơr.

English: but showing mercy to thousands, to those who love Me and keep My commandments.
Bahnar: Păng gô 'mêm kơ lu bơngai mă 'mêm kơ Inh păng wei răk dôm lu nơ̆r Inh tơtă truh kơ rơbâu jơhnơr.

English: ‘You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not hold him guiltless who takes His name in vain.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ yua anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm na pơma kư̆ kă; yua kơ Kră Yang gô phak tơpă dôm lu bơngai bu wă yua anăn Sư na pơma kư̆ kă.

English: ‘Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as the LORD your God commanded you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk kơ năr tơpơh wă pơm năr giĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, kư̆m thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm pơkă ăn boih kơ iĕm.

English: Six days you shall labor and do all your work
Bahnar: Iĕm athei bơ̆jang lăm tơdrâu năr đĕch

English: but the seventh day is the Sabbath of the LORD your God. In it you shall do no work: you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your cattle, nor your stranger who is within your gates, that your male servant and your female servant may rest as well as you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm năr tơpơh noh năr pơdơh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; 'nĕ kơ bơ̆jang minh tơdrong kiơ, kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn iĕm, đĭch drŏ-nglo đam drŏ-kăn iĕm, dah rơmo, aseh iĕm, dah lu sem dơrong iĕm, dah lu tơmoi chă oei pơdơh lăm hnam iĕm, wă kơ lu đĭch đam drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn iĕm kư̆m pơdơh thoi iĕm mơ̆n.

English: And remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God brought you out from there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm; therefore the LORD your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk thoi lu iĕm hlôi pơm đĭch boih tơ dêh Êyiptơ, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm yua ti mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang chông ba iĕm lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng noh; yua kơ thoi noh na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm đei tơtă boih kơ iĕm, wă kơ iĕm 'blŏk kơ năr pơdơh.

English: ‘Honor your father and your mother, as the LORD your God has commanded you, that your days may be long, and that it may be well with you in the land which the LORD your God is giving you.
Bahnar: Athei lui yom kơ mĕ 'bă ih, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang tơtă boih kơ ih wă kơ ih gơh arih sot păng đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk tơ kơpal teh âu mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih ăn kơ ih.

English: ‘You shall not murder.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơlôch bơngai.

English: ‘You shall not commit adultery.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: ‘You shall not steal.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ tơtông klĕ.

English: ‘You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh kơ lu bơngai nai.

English: ‘You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife; and you shall not desire your neighbor’s house, his field, his male servant, his female servant, his ox, his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor’s.’
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ 'nhĕng plah iŏk akăn đe, kư̆m 'nĕ 'nhĕng hnam đe, dah chŭn mir, đĭch drŏ-nglo đam drŏ-kăn, rơmo, aseh, dah tơmam kiơ nai.

English: “These words the LORD spoke to all your assembly, in the mountain from the midst of the fire, the cloud, and the thick darkness, with a loud voice; and He added no more. And He wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal kông, đơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk ŭnh, đơ̆ng lăm hơmơ̆l păng đơ̆ng lăm măng mu, đei nơ̆r re kơtang; Kră Yang khan dôm lu nơ̆r âu ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu iĕm, Sư ưh kơ đei thim ôh; Sư chih dôm lu nơ̆r noh tơ kơpal 'bar hlak tơmo lat na jao ăn kơ inh.

English: “So it was, when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, that you came near to me, all the heads of your tribes and your elders.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu iĕm kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng lăm măng mu kơplah ŭnh oei sa kông lu iĕm năm tơ inh, đĭ-đăng lu kră pơgơ̆r păng dôm lu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch iĕm

English: And you said: ‘Surely the LORD our God has shown us His glory and His greatness, and we have heard His voice from the midst of the fire. We have seen this day that God speaks with man; yet he still lives.
Bahnar: Na khan: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn tơ'bôh boih tơdrong rang mơnhal păng tơdrong krưp tih Sư kơ lu nhôn păng lu nhôn đei kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r Sư đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh; năr âu lu nhôn 'bôh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma dơnuh hăm kon bơngai mă-lei lu nhôn oei arih.

English: Now therefore, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of the LORD our God anymore, then we shall die.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei, yua kơ kiơ lu nhôn athei lôch? Ŭnh tih âu gô sa lu nhôn, tơdah lu nhôn oei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, noh lu nhôn gô lôch tơpă.

English: For who is there of all flesh who has heard the voice of the living God speaking from the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei pơma đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh, nhen thoi lu nhôn, mă-lei oei arih?

English: You go near and hear all that the LORD our God may say, and tell us all that the LORD our God says to you, and we will hear and do it.’
Bahnar: Ih năm mă jê̆ bĕ, wă kơ mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn khan na roi ăn kơ lu nhôn dơ̆ng, na lu nhôn gô mơ̆ng păng pơm kiơ̆.

English: “Then the LORD heard the voice of your words when you spoke to me, and the LORD said to me: ‘I have heard the voice of the words of this people which they have spoken to you. They are right in all that they have spoken.
Bahnar: Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r đơ̆ng iĕm, na Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Inh kơtơ̆ng boih dôm lu nơ̆r kon pơlei âu pơma hăm ih; lu sư pơma thoi noh trŏ boih.

English: Oh, that they had such a heart in them that they would fear Me and always keep all My commandments, that it might be well with them and with their children forever!
Bahnar: Ô tơdah lu kon pơlei âu đei jơhngơ̆m hli yom kơ Inh hăm wei răk dôm lu nơ̆r Inh tơtă ling-lang lu sư păng kon sâu lu sư gơh đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk ling-lang.

English: Go and say to them, “Return to your tents.”
Bahnar: Năm roi bĕ kơ lu kon pơlei pơla brŏk tơ anih bơsŭn kơdih.

English: But as for you, stand here by Me, and I will speak to you all the commandments, the statutes, and the judgments which you shall teach them, that they may observe them in the land which I am giving them to possess.’
Bahnar: Gah ih, oei bĕ 'bơ̆t dâu hăm Inh, Inh gô roi ăn kơ ih băt dôm nơ̆r tơtă, tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r tơbăt ih gô bơtho ăn dơ̆ng kơ lu sư, wă kơ lu sư pơm kiơ̆ tơ lăm dêh mă Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư.

English: “Therefore you shall be careful to do as the LORD your God has commanded you; you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu iĕm athei kơchăng pơm kiơ̆, thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n hlôi pơkă boih. 'Nĕ kơ weh gah 'ma, dah gah 'ngiĕo.

English: You shall walk in all the ways which the LORD your God has commanded you, that you may live and that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you shall possess.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei yak kiơ̆ đĭ trong mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm tơtă, wă kơ lu iĕm gơh đei pŭn hiôk păng oei arih sot lăm dêh mă iĕm gô iŏk.

English: “Now this is the commandment, and these are the statutes and judgments which the LORD your God has commanded to teach you, that you may observe them in the land which you are crossing over to possess
Bahnar: 'Nâu jơ̆ khôi juăt, nơ̆r tơtă păng nơ̆r tơbăt đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, tơtă boih kơ inh bơtho ăn kơ lu iĕm, wă kơ lu iĕm pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong noh tơ lăm dêh mă lu iĕm gô mơ̆t oei.

English: that you may fear the LORD your God, to keep all His statutes and His commandments which I command you, you and your son and your grandson, all the days of your life, and that your days may be prolonged.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu iĕm păng kon sâu iĕm băt kơ hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, đĭ chăl arih tơ kơpal teh wei răk dôm lu tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r Sư tơtă; wă kơ lu iĕm oei arih sot.

English: Therefore hear, O Israel, and be careful to observe it, that it may be well with you, and that you may multiply greatly as the LORD God of your fathers has promised you—‘a land flowing with milk and honey.’
Bahnar: Ơ Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ păng pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong noh wă kơ iĕm gơh đei pŭn hiôk păng rai lơ, dêh char thoi đak toh đak sut mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok iĕm đei pơkă hăm lu iĕm.

English: “Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one!
Bahnar: Ơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael mơ̆ng bĕ: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, Kră Yang minh đĕch, ưh kơ đei 'bar.

English: You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your strength.
Bahnar: Na lu iĕm athei đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak, đĭ đon tơchĕng đĭ jơhngơ̆m pran 'mêm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: “And these words which I command you today shall be in your heart.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei chih răk lăm jơhngơ̆m lu nơ̆r mă inh đei bơtho lu iĕm năr âu.

English: You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, when you walk by the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up.
Bahnar: Athei adrin bơtho ăn dôm tơdrong noh kơ lu kon iĕm păng bơtho tơdrong âu kơplah sư oei lăm hnam, dah oei năm rok trong, dah wă tep, dah iung đơ̆ng tep.

English: You shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes.
Bahnar: Ih athei chô̆ nơ̆r âu tơ kơkŏng ih, pơ̆n pơm tơdra 'bơ̆t klĕng ih wă kơ 'blŏk.

English: You shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
Bahnar: Ih athei chih răk nơ̆r âu tơ jrăng 'măng hnam ih păng tơ 'măng jang pơlei.

English: “So it shall be, when the LORD your God brings you into the land of which He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give you large and beautiful cities which you did not build
Bahnar: Layơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm chông ba iĕm mơ̆t tơ dêh mă Sư đei pơkă pơkăm wă ăn kơ lu 'bok iĕm Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp, wă ăn kơ iĕm, đei pơlei tih păng mơdrŏng mă lu iĕm ưh kơ đei man pơdơ̆ng.

English: houses full of all good things, which you did not fill, hewn-out wells which you did not dig, vineyards and olive trees which you did not plant—when you have eaten and are full
Bahnar: Hnam oei 'bĕnh-'bang kơ mŭk tơmam 'lơ̆ng mă lu iĕm ưh kơ đei răt mong, lu sơlŭng đak mă lu iĕm ưh kơ đei sir, tơm hơmu păng 'long ôliwơ mă lu iĕm ưh kơ đei pơtăm, gô đei sa mah rơkah rơkai.

English: then beware, lest you forget the LORD who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kơchăng bĕ kơdih 'nĕ hiơt kơ Kră Yang tơ'ngla chông tơlĕch iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, đơ̆ng pơm đĭch.

English: You shall fear the LORD your God and serve Him, and shall take oaths in His name.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm bơ̆jang kơ Sư păng yua anăn Sư na pơkă pơkăm

English: You shall not go after other gods, the gods of the peoples who are all around you
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ kiơ̆ lu yang nai, lu yang mă lu adrĕch adrung oei jum dăr kơ iĕm.

English: (for the LORD your God is a jealous God among you), lest the anger of the LORD your God be aroused against you and destroy you from the face of the earth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai iĕm, jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei băt gar, tơdah lu iĕm kơkuh kơ yang nai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil mĭl kơ iĕm păng Sư gô pơlôch tơhiong iĕm đơ̆ng kơpal teh âu

English: “You shall not tempt the LORD your God as you tempted Him in Massah.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơlong lăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, thoi iĕm đei pơlong lăng Sư tơ Masa.

English: You shall diligently keep the commandments of the LORD your God, His testimonies, and His statutes which He has commanded you.
Bahnar: Athei kơchăng wei răk dôm lu nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă păng nơ̆r Sư tơbăt, khôi juăt Sư mă inh đei bơtho ăn kơ iĕm.

English: And you shall do what is right and good in the sight of the LORD, that it may be well with you, and that you may go in and possess the good land of which the LORD swore to your fathers
Bahnar: Athei pơm dôm tơdrong kiơ Kră Yang, khan 'lơ̆ng khan trŏ, na iĕm đei pŭn hiôk păng gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh 'lơ̆ng rŏ mă Kră Yang hlôi pơkă wă ăn kơ lu 'bok iĕm.

English: to cast out all your enemies from before you, as the LORD has spoken.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô puh lê̆ đĭ lu bơngai ayăt đơ̆ng anăp iĕm kư̆m thoi Sư đei pơkă boih.

English: “When your son asks you in time to come, saying, ‘What is the meaning of the testimonies, the statutes, and the judgments which the LORD our God has commanded you?’
Bahnar: Ning-mônh, dah đei kon sâu iĕm jet: Dôm lu khôi juăt, tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n tơtă wă khan kiơ?

English: then you shall say to your son: ‘We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt, and the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand
Bahnar: Na iĕm gô tơl, sơ̆ lu bơ̆n pơm đĭch kơ Pharaôn tơ dêh Êyiptơ na Kră Yang đei yua ti pran kơtang Sư chông ba lu bơ̆n lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ ei

English: and the LORD showed signs and wonders before our eyes, great and severe, against Egypt, Pharaoh, and all his household.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei pơm tơ'bôh boih dôm lu tơdra hlĭch păng mơsêh mơyang krưp dêh tơpă, pơrăm dêh Êyiptơ, Pharaôn păng đĭ lu yŏng mơng sư 'bơ̆t anăp bơ̆n.

English: Then He brought us out from there, that He might bring us in, to give us the land of which He swore to our fathers.
Bahnar: Na Sư chông ba tơlĕch boih lu bơ̆n đơ̆ng dêh ei, Sư chông anhăk lu nhôn mơ̆t tơ dêh Sư mă pơkă wă ăn kơ 'bok lu bơ̆n; păng wă ăn kơ lu bơ̆n.

English: And the LORD commanded us to observe all these statutes, to fear the LORD our God, for our good always, that He might preserve us alive, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei bơtho khan kơ bơ̆n athei pơm kiơ̆ đĭ-đăng dôm tơdrong juăt âu păng băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang, wă kơ lu bơ̆n gơh đei hiôk-hian ling-lang păng oei arih thoi lu bơ̆n năr 'nâu.

English: Then it will be righteousness for us, if we are careful to observe all these commandments before the LORD our God, as He has commanded us.’
Bahnar: Tơdah lu bơ̆n kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ đĭ lu nơ̆r tơtă âu đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, na gơh jô̆ bơ̆n 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: “When the LORD your God brings you into the land which you go to possess, and has cast out many nations before you, the Hittites and the Girgashites and the Amorites and the Canaanites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, seven nations greater and mightier than you
Bahnar: Layơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm chông ba iĕm mơ̆t iŏk dêh mă Sư pơkă păng puh tơweh đĭ lu adrĕch đe 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm, noh lu kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Girgasit kon pơlei Amôrit, kon pơlei Kanaan, kon pơlei Pêrisit, kon pơlei Hêwit păng kon pơlei Jêbus, wă khan tơpơh adrĕch tih păng pran hloh kơ iĕm.

English: and when the LORD your God delivers them over to you, you shall conquer them and utterly destroy them. You shall make no covenant with them nor show mercy to them.
Bahnar: Layơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jao lu adrĕch noh kơ iĕm păng iĕm blah pơrăm đĭ lu sư jei iĕm, kơplah noh iĕm athei pơlôch đĭ lu sư, 'nĕ kơ pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm lu sư păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ mơnat kơ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: Nor shall you make marriages with them. You shall not give your daughter to their son, nor take their daughter for your son.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pơm pô̆ 'băn hăm lu sư, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ ăn kon drŏ-kăn iĕm oei kơ kon drŏ-nglo lu sư, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ iŏk oei kon drŏ-kăn lu sư ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo iĕm.

English: For they will turn your sons away from following Me, to serve other gods; so the anger of the LORD will be aroused against you and destroy you suddenly.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu adrĕch 'nâu gô pơhlŭ kon drŏ-nglo ih, achăng lê̆ Inh, na awih awăn kơ lu yang nai, đơ̆ng noh kơnh Kră Yang gô hil mĭl kơ iĕm, na sư gô pơlôch ih hloi.

English: But thus you shall deal with them: you shall destroy their altars, and break down their sacred pillars, and cut down their wooden images, and burn their carved images with fire.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'nâu iĕm athei pơm kơ lu sư: Pơrăm lê̆ lu chơnang soi, teh pơchah lê̆ lu gơ̆ng pơm yang lu sư păng athei kăl tơpăk lê̆ yang Asêrim păng soh pơđĭ rup yang đơ̆ng sư man dah traih.

English: “For you are a holy people to the LORD your God; the LORD your God has chosen you to be a people for Himself, a special treasure above all the peoples on the face of the earth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm jing minh adrĕch 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; Sư rơih iŏk iĕm đơ̆ng lu adrĕch kơpal teh đak âu. Wă kơ iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla Sư.

English: The LORD did not set His love on you nor choose you because you were more in number than any other people, for you were the least of all peoples
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'mêm kơeng păng rơih iŏk lu iĕm ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ lu iĕm bơngai lơ hloh kơ adrĕch lu đe nai ôh. Tơpă lu iĕm tŏ sĕt hloh kơ lu adrĕch lu đe nai.

English: but because the LORD loves you, and because He would keep the oath which He swore to your fathers, the LORD has brought you out with a mighty hand, and redeemed you from the house of bondage, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ Kră Yang 'mêm kơ lu iĕm păng wei nơ̆r pơkă hăm lu 'bok iĕm sơ̆, Kră Yang yua tơpang ti pran kơtang Sư dui lu iĕm lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng pơm đĭch păng dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng tơpang ti Pharaôn, pơtao dêh Êyiptơ.

English: “Therefore know that the LORD your God, He is God, the faithful God who keeps covenant and mercy for a thousand generations with those who love Him and keep His commandments
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei băt kơnăl kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, 'noh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt, wei tơdrong pơgơ̆p păng 'mêm truh tơ rơbâu jơhnơr kơ lu bơngai bu mă 'mêm kơ Sư păng wei răk dôm nơ̆r sư tơtă.

English: and He repays those who hate Him to their face, to destroy them. He will not be slack with him who hates Him; He will repay him to his face.
Bahnar: Păng pơm 'mong kơ lu bơngai bu mă areh kơ Sư, na pơlôch pơđĭ lê̆ lu sư. Sư ưh kơ pơhiơ̆ ôh pơm kơ bơngai bu mă areh kơ Sư, Sư gô pơm plơ̆ hloi hăm lu bơngai sơngah kơ Sư.

English: Therefore you shall keep the commandment, the statutes, and the judgments which I command you today, to observe them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, iĕm athei kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơtă, tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r tơbăt, mă inh đei bơtho ăn kơ iĕm năr âu.

English: “Then it shall come to pass, because you listen to these judgments, and keep and do them, that the LORD your God will keep with you the covenant and the mercy which He swore to your fathers.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm mơ̆ng păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu tơdrong juăt âu, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô wei nơ̆r pơgơ̆p păng tơdrong 'mêm mơnat mă Sư đei pơkă hăm lu 'bok iĕm sơ̆.

English: And He will love you and bless you and multiply you; He will also bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your land, your grain and your new wine and your oil, the increase of your cattle and the offspring of your flock, in the land of which He swore to your fathers to give you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang sư 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm, ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm ăn kơ lu kon sâu iĕm rai lơ hrôh ngôh; Sư gô ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu kon iĕm đơ̆ng blu pôih, ăn tơmam đơ̆ng teh, ăn phe 'ba, hơ'bo, plei hơmu păng đak rơmă plei 'long ôliwơ kơ iĕm, ăn rơmo, triu rai lơ lăm teh đak, mă sư đei pơkă pơkăm boih hăm 'bok iĕm, wă ăn kơ iĕm.

English: You shall be blessed above all peoples; there shall not be a male or female barren among you or among your livestock.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô đei pŭn hiôk hloh kơ lu adrĕch nai, lăm lu iĕm gô ưh kơ đei bơngai bu mă hơwŏng, drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, tơno dah akăn lăm sem dơrong iĕm.

English: And the LORD will take away from you all sickness, and will afflict you with none of the terrible diseases of Egypt which you have known, but will lay them on all those who hate you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang huay ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong jĭ jăn păng tơdrong jĭ apoh đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ mă-lei Sư gô ăn tơdrong jĭ noh truh kơ lu bơngai mă areh kơ ih.

English: Also you shall destroy all the peoples whom the LORD your God delivers over to you; your eye shall have no pity on them; nor shall you serve their gods, for that will be a snare to you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pơrăm lê̆ đĭ lu adrĕch mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm jao ăn kơ iĕm boih kư̆m 'nĕ kơ mơnat kơ lu sư păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ kơkuh kơ lu yang sư; yua kơ tơdrong noh gô pơm hơđong hơ'năk kơ iĕm.

English: “If you should say in your heart, ‘These nations are greater than I; how can I dispossess them?’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ khan lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm: Lu adrĕch 'nâu lơ pran hloh kơ bơ̆n, liơ bơ̆n gơh kĕ puh tơweh lê̆ lu sư?

English: you shall not be afraid of them, but you shall remember well what the LORD your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli kơ lu sư, mă-lei iĕm athei 'blŏk dôm tơdrong kiơ, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm đei pơm boih kơ Pharaôn păng đĭ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: the great trials which your eyes saw, the signs and the wonders, the mighty hand and the outstretched arm, by which the LORD your God brought you out. So shall the LORD your God do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong pơlong lăng tih dêh măt lu iĕm 'bôh boih, dôm lu tơdrong mơsêh tih hlĭch chrơp, tơpang ti mơsêh, pran kơtang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm đei chông tơlĕch iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ boih. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm kư̆m gô pơm kơ đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch mă iĕm hli noh.

English: Moreover the LORD your God will send the hornet among them until those who are left, who hide themselves from you, are destroyed.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô wơh ong năm druh sôch lu sư, dĭng mă lu bơngai kơdâu ôn, kư̆m pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu sư.

English: You shall not be terrified of them; for the LORD your God, the great and awesome God, is among you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hli tơrơ kơ lu sư; yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm oei hơdai iĕm, noh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă pran kơtang hloh păng trŏ kơ hli.

English: And the LORD your God will drive out those nations before you little by little; you will be unable to destroy them at once, lest the beasts of the field become too numerous for you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô puh lê̆ adrĕch 'nâu 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm 'net 'net; iĕm ưh kơ gơh pơlôch lu sư minh 'măng tăm ôh, kơnh hli kơ sem bri rai lơ na pơrăm iĕm dơ̆ng

English: But the LORD your God will deliver them over to you, and will inflict defeat upon them until they are destroyed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô jao lu sư kơ iĕm păng gô pơm kơ lu sư đei tơdrong hli rŭng răng tih, dĭng truh layơ mă lu sư lôch hiong đĭ.

English: And He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you will destroy their name from under heaven; no one shall be able to stand against you until you have destroyed them.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơjao lu pơtao lăm tơpang ti iĕm, na iĕm gô sŭt đĭ anăn lu sư đơ̆ng ala teh âu; ưh kơ đei bơngai bu kĕ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm, dĭng truh tơ iĕm pơlôch đĭ lu sư.

English: You shall burn the carved images of their gods with fire; you shall not covet the silver or gold that is on them, nor take it for yourselves, lest you be snared by it; for it is an abomination to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei soh pơđĭ lu rup yang lu sư. 'Nĕ kơ hưch ham, 'nĕ kơ iŏk kơdih hu dah maih đơ̆ng lăm lu sư man rup noh, kơnh hli kơ iĕm 'leh hơđong; yua kơ tơmam 'noh yua kơ tơmam noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei areh dêh.

English: Nor shall you bring an abomination into your house, lest you be doomed to destruction like it. You shall utterly detest it and utterly abhor it, for it is an accursed thing.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ chĕp ba tơmơ̆t lăm hnam iĕm tơmam mă trŏ areh dêh noh, kơnh hli kơ iĕm wang dai lôch răm. Iĕm athei lăng areh krưp, yua kơ tơmam noh trŏ kơ wă pơrăm.

English: “Every commandment which I command you today you must be careful to observe, that you may live and multiply, and go in and possess the land of which the LORD swore to your fathers.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ bĕ đĭ dôm nơ̆r tơtă mă đơ̆ng inh roi ăn kơ lu iĕm năr âu, wă kơ lu iĕm arih, gơh pơjing băl rai lơ, na mơ̆t iŏk dêh mă Kră Yang đei pơkă pơkăm hăm lu 'bok iĕm sơ̆.

English: And you shall remember that the LORD your God led you all the way these forty years in the wilderness, to humble you and test you, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep His commandments or not.
Bahnar: Athei 'blŏk kơ đĭ-đăng trong mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm chông anhăk ba iĕm lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm kơ 'nâu tơ lăm char glă pơmat-tat, wă pơlong iĕm, wă kơ băt iĕm hăm đei wei răk dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă dah ưh.

English: So He humbled you, allowed you to hunger, and fed you with manna which you did not know nor did your fathers know, that He might make you know that man shall not live by bread alone; but man lives by every word that proceeds from the mouth of the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ iĕm pơngot 'me rong iĕm ăn kơ iĕm sa mana mă iĕm păng lu yă 'bok kư̆m tam mă biơh băt, wă bơtho iĕm băt, kon bơngai arih ưh kơ trŏ arih đơ̆ng tơmam sa đĕch ôh, mă-lei kon bơngai arih đơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Your garments did not wear out on you, nor did your foot swell these forty years.
Bahnar: Lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm hơbĕn iĕm ao ưh kơ hiah jơ̆ng iĕm kư̆m huay kơ pơ'ngeh.

English: You should know in your heart that as a man chastens his son, so the LORD your God chastens you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei băt kơdih, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, teh bơtho kư̆m thoi 'Bă teh bơtho kon drŏ-nglo sư kơdih.

English: “Therefore you shall keep the commandments of the LORD your God, to walk in His ways and to fear Him.
Bahnar: Hli yom bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, wei răk dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă, yak năm kiơ̆ trong Sư

English: For the LORD your God is bringing you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of fountains and springs, that flow out of valleys and hills
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wă gô chông ba iĕm mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'lơ̆ng, đei lơ đak glung, đei đak krong, đak mơlĕch ro lăm thŭng thong păng tơ kơpal kông groi.

English: a land of wheat and barley, of vines and fig trees and pomegranates, a land of olive oil and honey
Bahnar: Dêh noh đei 'ba mi, 'ba tơ'bâu, plei hơmu, 'long hơra, plei gărnăt, đak rơmă plei 'long ôliwơ păng đak sut

English: a land in which you will eat bread without scarcity, in which you will lack nothing; a land whose stones are iron and out of whose hills you can dig copper.
Bahnar: Dêh noh đei tơmam sa mah rơkah rơkai; ưh kơ đei kơ'bah kiơ. Dêh noh đei tơmo bơsei păng đơ̆ng lăm kông iĕm gô sir iŏk kong

English: When you have eaten and are full, then you shall bless the LORD your God for the good land which He has given you.
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm sŏng sa phĭ mah rơkah rơkai, iĕm gô bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, yua kơ teh đak 'lơ̆ng mă đơ̆ng Sư ăn boih kơ iĕm.

English: “Beware that you do not forget the LORD your God by not keeping His commandments, His judgments, and His statutes which I command you today
Bahnar: Athei kơchăng bĕ, 'nĕ hiơt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wei răk dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă, nơ̆r Sư tơbăt păng khôi juăt Sư mă đơ̆ng inh bơtho lu iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: lest—when you have eaten and are full, and have built beautiful houses and dwell in them
