Bahnar: Hli kơ gô sŏng sa phĭ mah rơkah rơkai boih, pơm hnam 'lơ̆ng rŏ, đei anih oei kơjăp boih

English: and when your herds and your flocks multiply, and your silver and your gold are multiplied, and all that you have is multiplied
Bahnar: păng tơdah rơmo triu chek lar roi lơ, hu, maih păng mŭk tơmam rai tŏk boih

English: when your heart is lifted up, and you forget the LORD your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage
Bahnar: Athei kơchăng 'nĕ kơ pơang păng 'nĕ hiơt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, Tơ'ngla chông ba iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, lĕch đơ̆ng pơm đĭch.

English: who led you through that great and terrible wilderness, in which were fiery serpents and scorpions and thirsty land where there was no water; who brought water for you out of the flinty rock
Bahnar: Kră Yang chông ba iĕm rok char glă să pă băt krưp dêh, đei 'bih tang, hơguăt, teh hrĕng kro, ưh kơ đei đak ôh, Sư ăn đak lĕch đơ̆ng tơmo arăk tơpă.

English: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers did not know, that He might humble you and that He might test you, to do you good in the end
Bahnar: Lăm char glă Sư boih wei rong ăn kơ iĕm sa 'bĕng mana, mă lu 'bok iĕm tam lah băt, ăn kơ lu iĕm pơmat-tat wă pơlong lăng iĕm tuch-luch ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu iĕm.

English: then you say in your heart, ‘My power and the might of my hand have gained me this wealth.’
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ, 'nĕ chă pơma lăm jơhngơ̆m khan: Noh yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong hơgei păng pran kơtang tơpang ti inh na mă gơh đei dôm mŭk tơmam mơdrŏng 'nâu.

English: “And you shall remember the LORD your God, for it is He who gives you power to get wealth, that He may establish His covenant which He swore to your fathers, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, noh jơ̆ đơ̆ng Sư ăn kơ iĕm jing mơdrŏng; wă pơsĭt tơdrong pơgơ̆p Sư pơkă pơkăm hăm 'bok iĕm sơ̆.

English: Then it shall be, if you by any means forget the LORD your God, and follow other gods, and serve them and worship them, I testify against you this day that you shall surely perish.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm hiơt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, na kiơ̆ lu yang nai, bơ̆jang păng drap kơkuh kơ lu yang ei, inh khan tơpă năr âu. Lu iĕm gô lôch hiong đĭ!

English: As the nations which the LORD destroys before you, so you shall perish, because you would not be obedient to the voice of the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu adrĕch nai 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm thoi yơ. Sư kư̆m pơlôch pơrăm lu iĕm thoi noh mơ̆n yua kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm ôh.

English: “Hear, O Israel: You are to cross over the Jordan today, and go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourself, cities great and fortified up to heaven
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ! Lu iĕm wă tŏk kơ Krong Jôrđăn, wă mơ̆t tơblah puh tơweh lu adrĕch tih păng pran hloh kơ iĕm pơlei tih đei dur kơjung kơjăp truh tơ plĕnh.

English: a people great and tall, the descendants of the Anakim, whom you know, and of whom you heard it said, ‘Who can stand before the descendants of Anak?’
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch bơngai tih kơjung, pran kon sâu Anakim, mă iĕm băt boih păng iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng đe roi khan: Bơngai bu gơh kĕ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp kon sâu Anak?

English: Therefore understand today that the LORD your God is He who goes over before you as a consuming fire. He will destroy them and bring them down before you; so you shall drive them out and destroy them quickly, as the LORD has said to you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm athei băt tơpă: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm năm adrol kơ iĕm, nhen thoi pla ŭnh khơ̆ng dơhlông sa, Kră Yang boih Sư gô pơlôch pơrăm lu sư. Pơm kơ lu sư chu thuơ, lu iĕm gô pơlôch lu sư 'mônh đĕch, thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă hăm lu iĕm.

English: “Do not think in your heart, after the LORD your God has cast them out before you, saying, ‘Because of my righteousness the LORD has brought me in to possess this land’; but it is because of the wickedness of these nations that the LORD is driving them out from before you.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, blah puh lê̆ lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ kơ tơchĕng khan: Noh yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt bơ̆n na mă Kră Yang chông bơ̆n mơ̆t iŏk dêh noh mă tơpă yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ adrĕch âu, na Kră Yang blah puh lu sư đơ̆ng anăp iĕm.

English: It is not because of your righteousness or the uprightness of your heart that you go in to possess their land, but because of the wickedness of these nations that the LORD your God drives them out from before you, and that He may fulfill the word which the LORD swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Bahnar: Iĕm mơ̆t iŏk dêh đơ̆ng lu adrĕch âu ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ôh, dah kiơ̆ tơnăp ưh ôh, mă-lei yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei blah puh lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng anăp iĕm, wă pơsĭt kơ nơ̆r sư pơkă pơkăm hăm lu 'bok iĕm Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp.

English: Therefore understand that the LORD your God is not giving you this good land to possess because of your righteousness, for you are a stiff-necked people.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, iĕm athei băt; ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt iĕm, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm gơh iŏk teh đak 'lơ̆ng 'nâu; lu iĕm jơ̆ minh adrĕch arăng kơ̆l.

English: “Remember! Do not forget how you provoked the LORD your God to wrath in the wilderness. From the day that you departed from the land of Egypt until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against the LORD.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk, 'nĕ kơ hiơt lu iĕm hlôi tơblĕk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lăm char glă, đơ̆ng năr iĕm lĕch hlôi kơ dêh Êyiptơ truh tơ năr 'nâu, iĕm ling-lang blah pơm plơ̆ kơ Kră Yang.

English: Also in Horeb you provoked the LORD to wrath, so that the LORD was angry enough with you to have destroyed you.
Bahnar: Tơ Hôrêp lu iĕm kư̆m hlôi tơblĕk Kră Yang; na Sư blĕk hil dĭng mah Sư wă pơlôch pơđĭ lu iĕm

English: When I went up into the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant which the LORD made with you, then I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh năm tŏk tơ kông iŏk 'bar hlak tơmo lat, 'bar hlak tơmo tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă Kră Yang hlôi pơgơ̆p hăm lu iĕm, inh oei tơ kơpal kông puăn-jĭt năr păng puăn-jĭt măng; ưh kơ sŏng sa kư̆m ưh kơ nhă đak

English: Then the LORD delivered to me two tablets of stone written with the finger of God, and on them were all the words which the LORD had spoken to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
Bahnar: na Kră Yang pơjao ăn kơ inh 'bar hlak tơmo lat, đơ̆ng hơnglâu ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chih 'mơ̆i; đei tôm dôm lu nơ̆r mă Kră Yang pơma đơ̆ng lăm tŏk-bŏk ŭnh tơ kơpal kông, lăm năr iĕm oei akŭm.

English: And it came to pass, at the end of forty days and forty nights, that the LORD gave me the two tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant.
Bahnar: Tôm puăn-jĭt năr păng puăn-jĭt măng boih, Kră Yang pơjao ăn kơ inh 'bar hlak tơmo lat, 'bar hlak tơmo tơdrong pơgơ̆p.

English: “Then the LORD said to me, ‘Arise, go down quickly from here, for your people whom you brought out of Egypt have acted corruptly; they have quickly turned aside from the way which I commanded them; they have made themselves a molded image.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh; iung bĕ iĕm, jur mă tĕnh tĕnh, yua kơ lu kon pơlei mă ih chông ba lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ pơm yoch răm boih; 'nao lăp 'biơ̆ đĕch weh achăng lê̆ trong đơ̆ng Inh bơtho tơtă kơ lu sư; lu sư tuh hling minh pôm rup yang!

English: “Furthermore the LORD spoke to me, saying, ‘I have seen this people, and indeed they are a stiff-necked people.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Inh 'bôh boih kon pơlei 'nâu, jơ̆ minh adrĕch arăng kơ̆l.

English: Let Me alone, that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven; and I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they.’
Bahnar: Lê̆ Inh pơlôch pơđĭ lu sư păng sŭt lê̆ anăn lu sư đơ̆ng lăm teh đak âu, đơ̆ng noh inh gô pơm ăn kơ ih jing minh adrĕch pran kơtang păng lơ kơdrâ̆m hloh kơ lu sư.

English: “So I turned and came down from the mountain, and the mountain burned with fire; and the two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
Bahnar: Inh hăt hot jur đơ̆ng kông, kông ŭnh oei sa; 'bar pah tơpang ti inh chĕp 'bar hlak tơmo lat tơdrong pơgơ̆p.

English: And I looked, and behold, you had sinned against the LORD your God—had made for yourselves a molded calf! You had turned aside quickly from the way which the LORD had commanded you.
Bahnar: Inh lăng 'bôh lu iĕm pơm yoch blah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, 'nao lăp 'biơ̆ đĕch lu iĕm weh achăng lê̆ trong Kră Yang bơtho pơkă, tuh man pơm kơdih iĕm minh pôm rup kon rơmo.

English: Then I took the two tablets and threw them out of my two hands and broke them before your eyes.
Bahnar: Inh chĕp 'bar hlak tơmo lat noh, klơ̆m lê̆ 'bar hlak tơmo lat noh pơchah hĕch 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm.

English: And I fell down before the LORD, as at the first, forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water, because of all your sin which you committed in doing wickedly in the sight of the LORD, to provoke Him to anger.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu iĕm pơm kơnê̆, pơm tơdrong yoch tih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang che bơle tơblĕk Sư, na inh drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang lăm puăn-jĭt năr păng puăn-jĭt măng thoi adrol ki, ưh kơ đei sŏng sa păng ưh kơ đei nhă.

English: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure with which the LORD was angry with you, to destroy you. But the LORD listened to me at that time also.
Bahnar: Inh hli kơ Kră Yang blĕk hil mĭl dĭng mah Sư wă pơlôch pơgoh lu iĕm: Mă-lei Kră Yang oei mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh mơ̆n.

English: And the LORD was very angry with Aaron and would have destroyed him; so I prayed for Aaron also at the same time.
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m blĕk hil dêh kơ Arôn, mah truh kơ wă pơlôch sư; inh kư̆m krao khan ăn kơ Arôn lăm kơplah noh.

English: Then I took your sin, the calf which you had made, and burned it with fire and crushed it and ground it very small, until it was as fine as dust; and I threw its dust into the brook that descended from the mountain.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh iŏk tơmam, rup kon rơmo mă lu iĕm pơm păng soh lê̆ lăm ŭnh, teh pơhĕch lê̆, dĭng thoi 'mui teh; đơ̆ng noh inh tuh hŭt lê̆ 'mui noh lăm glung đak ro đơ̆ng kông.

English: “Also at Taberah and Massah and Kibroth Hattaavah you provoked the LORD to wrath.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m đei pơm tơblĕk Kră Yang tơ Tabêra, tơ Masa păng tơ Kirôt, Hatawa.

English: Likewise, when the LORD sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, ‘Go up and possess the land which I have given you,’ then you rebelled against the commandment of the LORD your God, and you did not believe Him nor obey His voice.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang athei lu iĕm weh đơ̆ng Kades Barnêa, pơkă khan: Năm iŏk bĕ dêh mă Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm, mă-lei lu iĕm blah plơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm tơtă, ưh kơ lui kơ Sư păng ưh kơ chu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư ôh.

English: You have been rebellious against the LORD from the day that I knew you.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr inh băt kơ lu iĕm truh dang ei inh 'bôh lu iĕm ling-lang pơma blah Kră Yang.

English: “Thus I prostrated myself before the LORD; forty days and forty nights I kept prostrating myself, because the LORD had said He would destroy you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang khan Sư wă pơlôch đĭ lu iĕm. Na inh đei drap bon kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang lăm puăn-jĭt năr păng puăn-jĭt măng boih.

English: Therefore I prayed to the LORD, and said: ‘O Lord GOD, do not destroy Your people and Your inheritance whom You have redeemed through Your greatness, whom You have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
Bahnar: Inh krao khan apinh thoi âu: Ơ Kră Yang mơsêh mơyang, apinh Ih 'nĕ kơ pơlôch kon pơlei Ih, noh jơ̆ tơmam Ih, đei dŏng pơklaih lu sư chông ba lu sư lĕch hlôi boih đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ hăm tơpang ti mơsêh pran kơtang Ih.

English: Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; do not look on the stubbornness of this people, or on their wickedness or their sin
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ lu đĭch đam Ih, Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp; păng 'nĕ pă jô̆ dôm tơdrong kơ chu arăng kơ̆l, tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu kon pơlei 'nâu.

English: lest the land from which You brought us should say, “Because the LORD was not able to bring them to the land which He promised them, and because He hated them, He has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.”
Bahnar: Tơdah ưh lei kon pơlei dêh Êyiptơ gô khan; Kră Yang ưh kơ chông ba lu kon pơlei noh wă mơ̆t tơ dêh Sư pơkă, yua kơ Sư areh kơ lu sư, na chông wă pơlôch lu sư tơ lăm char glă.

English: Yet they are Your people and Your inheritance, whom You brought out by Your mighty power and by Your outstretched arm.’
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơla âu jơ̆ kon pơlei Ih păng tơmam Ih, lu bơngai mă Ih hlôi yua tơdrong mơsêh pran kơtang tih chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: “At that time the LORD said to me, ‘Hew for yourself two tablets of stone like the first, and come up to Me on the mountain and make yourself an ark of wood.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Ih athei man 'bar hlak tơmo lat thoi 'bar hlak tơmo lat adrol ki păng năm tŏk tơ Inh tơ kơpal kông ti; ih kư̆m athei pơm minh pôm hom păng tơ̆r.

English: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke; and you shall put them in the ark.’
Bahnar: Inh gô chih tơ kơpal 'bar hlak tơmo lat noh dôm nơ̆r Inh đei chih tơ 'bar hlak tơmo lat adrol ki mă ih teh pơchah lê̆ boih, đơ̆ng noh tah 'bar hlak tơmo lat âu lăm hom.

English: “So I made an ark of acacia wood, hewed two tablets of stone like the first, and went up the mountain, having the two tablets in my hand.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh pơm minh pôm hom păng 'long keo pơm 'bar hlak tơmo lat thoi 'bar hlak tơmo lat adrol ki, đơ̆ng noh năm tŏk tơ kông, chĕp 'bar hlak tơmo lat noh

English: And He wrote on the tablets according to the first writing, the Ten Commandments, which the LORD had spoken to you in the mountain from the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly; and the LORD gave them to me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang sư chih tơ kơpal 'bar hlak tơmo noh nơ̆r sư đei chih thoi adrol ki, mă mơjĭt Khôi juăt tơtă mă Kră Yang pơma kơ lu iĕm đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh tơ kơpal kông, lăm năr iĕm akŭm. Đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang pơjao ăn tơmo lat kơ inh.

English: Then I turned and came down from the mountain, and put the tablets in the ark which I had made; and there they are, just as the LORD commanded me.”
Bahnar: Inh jur wih đơ̆ng kông, tah lê̆ 'bar hlak tơmo lat noh tơ lăm hom mă đêl inh pơm păng lê̆ 'bar hlak tơmo lat tơ noh truh dang ei, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang pơkă kơ inh boih.

English: (Now the children of Israel journeyed from the wells of Bene Jaakan to Moserah, where Aaron died, and where he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered as priest in his stead.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael năm đơ̆ng sơlŭng đak Jakan truh tơ Mêsêra; Arôn lôch păng 'bŭ tơ noh, Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo sư, bơ̆jang pơm 'bok soi tơm tơplih kơ sư.

English: From there they journeyed to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of rivers of water.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh kon pơlei Isơrael năm truh tơ Gutgôđa đơ̆ng Gutgôđa truh tơ Jôtbata, jơ̆ dêh mă đei lơ đak glung.

English: At that time the LORD separated the tribe of Levi to bear the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand before the LORD to minister to Him and to bless in His name, to this day.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Kră Yang klah lê̆ adrĕch Lêwi pha, wă tung hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang wă bơ̆jang pơm 'bok soi kơ Sư păng yua anăn Kră Yang sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ kon pơlei. Truh tơ dang ei

English: Therefore Levi has no portion nor inheritance with his brethren; the LORD is his inheritance, just as the LORD your God promised him.)
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai Lêwi ưh kơ đei teh jang sa hơdai hăm lu 'nhŏng oh lu sư, Kră Yang boih jơ̆ tơmam lu sư, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei khan boih hăm lu sư.

English: “As at the first time, I stayed in the mountain forty days and forty nights; the LORD also heard me at that time, and the LORD chose not to destroy you.
Bahnar: Inh oei tơ kơpal kông lăm puăn-jĭt năr păng puăn-jĭt măng kư̆m thoi adrol ki, na Kră Yang mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh; lăp đon ưh pă wă pơlôch iĕm

English: Then the LORD said to me, ‘Arise, begin your journey before the people, that they may go in and possess the land which I swore to their fathers to give them.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Iung bĕ, năm adrol kơ kon pơlei, mơ̆t iŏk dêh mă Inh đei pơkă pơkăm hăm 'bok lu sư.

English: “And now, Israel, what does the LORD your God require of you, but to fear the LORD your God, to walk in all His ways and to love Him, to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Isơrael, dang ei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm tơtă athei pơm kiơ? Athei băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, yak kiơ̆ đĭ trong Sư, 'mêm kơ Sư păng bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m, đĭ bơhngol iĕm

English: and to keep the commandments of the LORD and His statutes which I command you today for your good?
Bahnar: wei răk khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang mă inh đei bơtho ăn kơ lu iĕm năr 'nâu, wă kơ lu iĕm đei pŭn hiôk?

English: Indeed heaven and the highest heavens belong to the LORD your God, also the earth with all that is in it.
Bahnar: Lu plĕnh păng lu tăl plĕnh kơjung hloh, teh păng dôm tơmam kơpal teh noh jơ̆ đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: The LORD delighted only in your fathers, to love them; and He chose their descendants after them, you above all peoples, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Noh boih Kră Yang 'mêm kơ 'bok lu iĕm, Sư rơih iŏk iĕm đơ̆ng lăm lu kon pơlei nai. Thoi lu iĕm năr âu.

English: Therefore circumcise the foreskin of your heart, and be stiff-necked no longer.
Bahnar: Na lu iĕm, athei băt hli yom kơ Kră Yanga 'nĕ pă arăng kơ̆l dơ̆ng.

English: For the LORD your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great God, mighty and awesome, who shows no partiality nor takes a bribe.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ lu yang păng yŏng kơ đĭ-đăng lu yŏng, wă khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, mơsêh mơyang păng trŏ kơ hli yom. Sư ưh kơ pơdê bơngai bu, kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơgâm sa bu.

English: He administers justice for the fatherless and the widow, and loves the stranger, giving him food and clothing.
Bahnar: Sư tơgŭm lu bơngai mơti păng bơngai adro po, 'mêm mơnat kơ bơngai tơmoi, ăn tơmam sa păng hơbĕn ao kơ lu sư.

English: Therefore love the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei 'mêm mơnat kơ lu bơngai tơmoi yua kơ lu iĕm kư̆m jing bơngai tơmoi lăm dêh Êyiptơ.

English: You shall fear the LORD your God; you shall serve Him, and to Him you shall hold fast, and take oaths in His name.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, bơ̆jang kơ Sư, oei kơjăp lăm Sư păng yua anăn Sư pơkă pơkăm.

English: He is your praise, and He is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome things which your eyes have seen.
Bahnar: Sư boih mă Tơ'ngla lu iĕm hơri ư-ang păng Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm Tơ'ngla hlôi pơm dôm tơdrong pran kơtang tih păng krưp, mă măt lu iĕm 'bôh boih.

English: Your fathers went down to Egypt with seventy persons, and now the LORD your God has made you as the stars of heaven in multitude.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'bok lu iĕm jur tơ dêh Êyiptơ, đei lăp tơpơh-jĭt 'nu đĕch; mă dang ei, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm lơ thoi sơnglŏng tơ kơpal plĕnh ti.

English: “Therefore you shall love the LORD your God, and keep His charge, His statutes, His judgments, and His commandments always.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei băt 'mêm yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang păng athei wei răk dôm tơdrong juăt Sư, nơ̆r Sư athei păng nơ̆r Sư tơtă.

English: Know today that I do not speak with your children, who have not known and who have not seen the chastening of the LORD your God, His greatness and His mighty hand and His outstretched arm
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu, lu iĕm athei băt inh ưh kơ đei pơma bơtho kơ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p iĕm ôh, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ tam băt păng kư̆m ưh tam 'bôh. Tam mă kơtơ̆ng lu nơ̆r bơtho khan đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư, ti mơsêh pran kơtang tih Sư.

English: His signs and His acts which He did in the midst of Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to all his land
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch păng tơdrong Sư pơm boih kơ dêh Êyiptơ, kơ Pharaôn, pơtao Êyiptơ păng đĭ kon pơlei lăm dêh sư

English: what He did to the army of Egypt, to their horses and their chariots: how He made the waters of the Red Sea overflow them as they pursued you, and how the LORD has destroyed them to this day
Bahnar: dôm tơdrong Sư pơm boih kơ linh Êyiptơ lu hao aseh păng gre aseh Êyiptơ, kơplah lu sư druh 'moi iĕm, na Kră Yang ăn kơ đak dơsĭ 'Brê lơ̆p pơrăm lê̆ lu sư.

English: what He did for you in the wilderness until you came to this place
Bahnar: Kon sâu lu iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong Sư pơm boih kơ lu iĕm lăm char glă mă dĭng tơ lu iĕm truh tơ anih 'nâu.

English: and what He did to Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben: how the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, their households, their tents, and all the substance that was in their possession, in the midst of all Israel
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong Sư pơm kơ Đathan păng Abiram, kon drŏ-nglo Êliap, sâu Rubên kơplah teh hơđang ha luăn bre sư păng hnam dơnŏ sư bơsŭn păng đĭ dôm tơmam kiơ gah lu sư kơplah lu sư oei hơdai lu kon pơlei Isơrael sơ̆.

English: but your eyes have seen every great act of the LORD which He did.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm 'bôh păng măt dôm tơdrong tih mă Kră Yang hlôi pơm boih.

English: “Therefore you shall keep every commandment which I command you today, that you may be strong, and go in and possess the land which you cross over to possess
Bahnar: Thoi noh iĕm athei wei răk bĕ dôm nơ̆r tơtă mă inh bơtho ăn kơ lu iĕm năr 'nâu, wă kơ lu iĕm đei jơhngơ̆m pran, mơ̆t iŏk dêh mă lu iĕm wă iŏk tơ pah to Krong Jôrđăn.

English: and that you may prolong your days in the land which the LORD swore to give your fathers, to them and their descendants, ‘a land flowing with milk and honey.’
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu iĕm arih sot tơ teh đak mă Kră Yang pơkă boih wă ăn kơ lu 'bok iĕm păng ăn kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư, teh đak toh păng đak sut.

English: For the land which you go to possess is not like the land of Egypt from which you have come, where you sowed your seed and watered it by foot, as a vegetable garden
Bahnar: Dêh mă lu iĕm gô mơ̆t iŏk noh ưh kơ sĭ thoi dêh Êyiptơ, mă anih lu iĕm lĕch sơ̆, yua kơ tơ Êyiptơ mưh iĕm rei adrĕch, iĕm bơ̆ đak 'mơ̆i bơwei nhen thoi pơgar.

English: but the land which you cross over to possess is a land of hills and valleys, which drinks water from the rain of heaven
Bahnar: Mă-lei dêh lu iĕm gô năm mơ̆t iŏk noh, jơ̆ minh dêh đei kông groi păng teh dơnă 'lơ̆ng, yua đak 'mi đơ̆ng plĕnh ruh hngôm.

English: a land for which the LORD your God cares; the eyes of the LORD your God are always on it, from the beginning of the year to the very end of the year.
Bahnar: 'Noh jơ̆ minh pôm dêh mă măt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm bơwei, đơ̆ng sơnăm blŭng-a sơ̆ truh tơ tôch.

English: ‘And it shall be that if you earnestly obey My commandments which I command you today, to love the LORD your God and serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm chu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơtă mă inh bơtho ăn kơ lu iĕm năr 'nâu, đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak 'mêm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng bơ̆jang kơ Sư.

English: then I will give you the rain for your land in its season, the early rain and the latter rain, that you may gather in your grain, your new wine, and your oil.
Bahnar: Na Sư gô ăn đak 'mi jur trŏ kơ bơyan mă bơyan nê̆-năm mă bơyan puih, lu iĕm gô đei 'ba hơ'bo, sik hơmu 'nao păng đak rơmă plei 'long ôliwơ.

English: And I will send grass in your fields for your livestock, that you may eat and be filled.’
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m gô pơm ăn kơ mir tơmăn đei 'nhĕt chăt ăn kơ sem dơrong iĕm; iĕm gô đei sŏng sa phĭ mah rơkah rơkai.

English: “Take heed to yourselves, lest your heart be deceived, and you turn aside and serve other gods and worship them
Bahnar: Athei kơchăng wă kơ lu iĕm huay lui kơ đe pơhlŭ pơlung, achăng lê̆ Kră Yang, na drap kơkuh kơ yang nai.

English: lest the LORD’s anger be aroused against you, and He shut up the heavens so that there be no rain, and the land yield no produce, and you perish quickly from the good land which the LORD is giving you.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Kră Yang gô hil mĭl kơ lu iĕm, sư gô tang lê̆ plĕnh, na ưh pă đei đak 'mi dơ̆ng, teh pă đei plei sa: Lu iĕm gô lôch hiong đơ̆ng lăm dêh char 'lơ̆ng, mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn kơ lu iĕm.

English: “Therefore you shall lay up these words of mine in your heart and in your soul, and bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm, athei chih răk lăm jơhngơ̆m păng lăm kơ̆l 'ngok, dôm nơ̆r inh bơtho iĕm, 'bot sư tơ ti wă kơ iĕm 'blŏk păng pơ̆n sư tơ klĕng iĕm.

English: You shall teach them to your children, speaking of them when you sit in your house, when you walk by the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up.
Bahnar: Athei bơtho dơ̆ng kơ lu kon sâu iĕm, tơ'blŏk mă lu sư oei ngôi lăm hnam dah yak rok trong, kơplah oei tep dah iung đơ̆ng tep.

English: And you shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates
Bahnar: Athei chih răk dôm lu nơ̆r âu tơ jrăng 'măng hnam păng tơ 'măng jang iĕm.

English: that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied in the land of which the LORD swore to your fathers to give them, like the days of the heavens above the earth.
Bahnar: Thoi noh măng năr oei đei kơpal teh kơ lu iĕm păng kon sâu lu iĕm gơh oei đei đunh sot lăm dêh mă Kră Yang pơkă boih wă ăn kơ lu 'bok iĕm kư̆m thoi iĕm.

English: “For if you carefully keep all these commandments which I command you to do—to love the LORD your God, to walk in all His ways, and to hold fast to Him
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm kơchăng wei răk păng pơm kiơ̆ đĭ dôm nơ̆r tơtă, mă inh bơtho boih kơ lu iĕm athei, 'mêm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, yak kiơ̆ trong Sư păng oei pơgơ̆p kơjăp hăm Sư.

English: then the LORD will drive out all these nations from before you, and you will dispossess greater and mightier nations than yourselves.
Bahnar: Lei Kră Yang gô pơpuh lê̆ đĭ lu adrĕch adrung 'nâu đơ̆ng anăp lu iĕm, lu iĕm gô iŏk oei lăm teh đak adrĕch adrung tih păng pran hloh kơ iĕm.

English: Every place on which the sole of your foot treads shall be yours: from the wilderness and Lebanon, from the river, the River Euphrates, even to the Western Sea, shall be your territory.
Bahnar: Tơ anih ayơ tơpang jơ̆ng lu iĕm juă, tơ noh jing anih lu iĕm. Teh hơdral lu iĕm đơ̆ng char glă truh tơ Liban đơ̆ng Krong Ơphrat truh tơ dơsĭ gah bơmơ̆t.a

English: No man shall be able to stand against you; the LORD your God will put the dread of you and the fear of you upon all the land where you tread, just as He has said to you.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bơngai bu kĕ iung dơ̆ng blah 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm gô pơm ăn kơ đe hli tơrơ kơ lu iĕm lăm jơ̆p kơ dêh lu iĕm juă, thoi Sư đei pơkă khan boih kơ lu iĕm.

English: “Behold, I set before you today a blessing and a curse
Bahnar: Dang ei Inh ăn 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm rơih iŏk tơdrong pŭn hiôk păng tơdrong hiap pơtê̆.

English: the blessing, if you obey the commandments of the LORD your God which I command you today
Bahnar: Tơdrong pŭn hiôk, tơdah lu iĕm mơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, mă inh roi ăn kơ iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: and the curse, if you do not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn aside from the way which I command you today, to go after other gods which you have not known.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hiap pơtê̆, tơdah lu iĕm kuă kơ mơ̆ng păng ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ ôh dôm nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, mă weh achăng lê̆ nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, na yak kiơ̆ trong lu yang nai, mă lu iĕm ưh kơ băt.

English: Now it shall be, when the LORD your God has brought you into the land which you go to possess, that you shall put the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chông ba iĕm mơ̆t iŏk dêh đêl pơkă na sơkat pŭn hiôk tơ kơpal kông Gêrasim păng tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ tơ kơpal kông Êbal.

English: Are they not on the other side of the Jordan, toward the setting sun, in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the plain opposite Gilgal, beside the terebinth trees of Moreh?
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ kông âu tơ pah to Krong Jôrđăn, gah to kơ trong tih, năm tơ gah măt 'năr mơ̆t jê̆ lu 'long kôih tơ Môre lăm tơring kon pơlei Kanaan oei tơ lăm thŭng Araba, tơ jê̆ pơlei Gilgal jê̆ lu 'long kôih tơ Môre?

English: For you will cross over the Jordan and go in to possess the land which the LORD your God is giving you, and you will possess it and dwell in it.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm tŏk kơ Krong Jôrđăn, wă mơ̆t iŏk dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm ăn kơ lu iĕm. Mưh lu iĕm đei iŏk dêh păng bơ̆jang sa păng oei hloi tơ noh

English: And you shall be careful to observe all the statutes and judgments which I set before you today.
Bahnar: lu iĕm athei pơkă tơpă pơm kiơ̆ đĭ dôm tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă mă inh đei bơtho tơ'bôh kơ lu iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: “These are the statutes and judgments which you shall be careful to observe in the land which the LORD God of your fathers is giving you to possess, all the days that you live on the earth.
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơih tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă mă lu iĕm athei kơchăng wei răk păng pơm kiơ̆ đĭ chăl arih lu iĕm oei tơ lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok iĕm ăn kơ lu iĕm iŏk oei.

English: You shall utterly destroy all the places where the nations which you shall dispossess served their gods, on the high mountains and on the hills and under every green tree.
Bahnar: Pơrăm đĭ lu anih ayơ lu adrĕch adrung, mă lu iĕm gô blah puh lê̆, lu anih kơkuh kơ yang lu sư, tơ kơpal kông kơjung dah tơ kơpal groi dah tơ ala yơ̆p 'long

English: And you shall destroy their altars, break their sacred pillars, and burn their wooden images with fire; you shall cut down the carved images of their gods and destroy their names from that place.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơrăm chơnang soi teh pơchah lu rup yang tơmo păng soh lu jrăng Asêrim lu sư lăm ŭnh păng teh pơhĕch lu rup man yang lu sư păng sŭt lê̆ đĭ anăn lu rup yang noh lăm anih noh.

English: You shall not worship the LORD your God with such things.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm kiơ̆ thoi lu adrĕch noh.

English: “But you shall seek the place where the LORD your God chooses, out of all your tribes, to put His name for His dwelling place; and there you shall go.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm athei chă anih ayơ lăm adrĕch Isơrael, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm gô rơih iŏk pơm anih oei păng 'măn Anăn Sư, lu iĕm akŭm kơkuh.

English: There you shall take your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the heave offerings of your hand, your vowed offerings, your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks.
Bahnar: Chĕp ba tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r tơ noh, lu tơmam soi iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt, tơmam soi pha, lu tơmam soi pơsĭt đêl nơ̆r pơkă, tơmam soi hăm jơhngơ̆m lăp păng lu kon kơdră rơmo triu bơbe tuh blŭng-a.

English: And there you shall eat before the LORD your God, and you shall rejoice in all to which you have put your hand, you and your households, in which the LORD your God has blessed you.
Bahnar: Tơ noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, chơt hiôk sŏng sa hăm hnam dơnŏ, yua kơ dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti iĕm kơdih, na đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm.

English: “You shall not at all do as we are doing here today—every man doing whatever is right in his own eyes
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm thoi lu bơ̆n oei pơm năr âu tơ âu, noh rim 'nu pơm kiơ̆ kơ đon sư tơchĕng kơdih khan trŏ.

English: for as yet you have not come to the rest and the inheritance which the LORD your God is giving you.
Bahnar: Dang ei lu iĕm tam mă mơ̆t tơ anih pơdơh păng tam mă đei iŏk teh bơ̆jang sa mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm wă ăn.

English: But when you cross over the Jordan and dwell in the land which the LORD your God is giving you to inherit, and He gives you rest from all your enemies round about, so that you dwell in safety
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm gô tŏk tơ pah to kơ Krong Jôrđăn, oei lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm wă ăn bơ̆jang sa. Sư gô ăn hiôk hơđơ̆ng pơdơh, ưh pă đei lu ayăt wang dăr.

English: then there will be the place where the LORD your God chooses to make His name abide. There you shall bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the heave offerings of your hand, and all your choice offerings which you vow to the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu iĕm gô chĕp ba tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam iĕm soi pơyơ̆r iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt, tơmam soi pha, lu tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng hloh, mă lu iĕm drơ̆ng pơkă wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơ anih mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô rơih wă ăn Anăn Sư oei.

English: And you shall rejoice before the LORD your God, you and your sons and your daughters, your male and female servants, and the Levite who is within your gates, since he has no portion nor inheritance with you.
Bahnar: Tơ noh lu iĕm, kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn, đĭch drŏ-nglo păng đĭch drŏ-kăn lu iĕm lu bơngai Lêwi mă oei lăm pơlei hơdai lu iĕm, lu bơngai mă ưh kơ đei iŏk tơmam dah teh jang sa kơdih gô chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: Take heed to yourself that you do not offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm athei kơchăng ưh kơ gơh pơyơ̆r tơ lu anih nai mă lu iĕm wă.

English: but in the place which the LORD chooses, in one of your tribes, there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all that I command you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh tơ anih mă Kră Yang gô rơih minh anih đơ̆ng lăm teh đak lăm minh adrĕch, tơ anih noh lu iĕm athei pơm dôm tơdrong mă inh đei bơtho khan.

English: “However, you may slaughter and eat meat within all your gates, whatever your heart desires, according to the blessing of the LORD your God which He has given you; the unclean and the clean may eat of it, of the gazelle and the deer alike.
Bahnar: Mă tơ anih ayơ lăm pơlei lu iĕm kơdih, iĕm gơh koh sa lu sem dơrong mơ̆ng kơ iĕm, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong pŭn hiôk mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei asong ăn kơ lu iĕm; mă bơngai kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach dah bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kư̆m gơh sa 'nhĕm noh thoi iĕm sa 'nhĕm juei păng 'nhĕm kơtŏng jĭl bram.

English: Only you shall not eat the blood; you shall pour it on the earth like water.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ sa pham; athei tuh hŭt lê̆ tơ teh thoi tuh hŭt đak.

English: You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain or your new wine or your oil, of the firstborn of your herd or your flock, of any of your offerings which you vow, of your freewill offerings, or of the heave offering of your hand.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa lăm pơlei iĕm kơdih, lu tơmam iŏk đơ̆ng minh lăm mơjĭt, 'ba, sik hơmu đak rơmă plei ôliwơ, dah lu kon rơmo triu bơbe tuh blŭng-a, dah tơmam kiơ iĕm drơ̆ng pơkă wă pơyơ̆r, dah iĕm pơyơ̆r hăm jơhngơ̆m wă, dah lu tơmam pơyơ̆r nai, lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa lăm pơlei iĕm kơdih.

English: But you must eat them before the LORD your God in the place which the LORD your God chooses, you and your son and your daughter, your male servant and your female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates; and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God in all to which you put your hands.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm, kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn đĭch drŏ-nglo păng đam drŏ-kăn iĕm, hăm lu bơngai Lêwi oei hơdai lăm pơlei iĕm, athei sa lu kon sem tơmam noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, tơ anih Sư rơih; lu iĕm gô chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti iĕm kơdih.

English: Take heed to yourself that you do not forsake the Levite as long as you live in your land.
Bahnar: Đĭ chăl arih iĕm, athei kơchăng, 'nĕ kơ hiơt hŭt lê̆ bơngai Lêwi mă đei lăm dêh noh.

English: “When the LORD your God enlarges your border as He has promised you, and you say, ‘Let me eat meat,’ because you long to eat meat, you may eat as much meat as your heart desires.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm pơih hơdral rai să ăn kơ iĕm, thoi Sư đei pơkă khan kơ iĕm, yua kơ iĕm hơpơi 'maih sa 'nhĕm na khan: “Inh gô sa 'nhĕm,” iĕm gô sa mơ̆ng kơ iĕm wă sa dôm yơ.

English: If the place where the LORD your God chooses to put His name is too far from you, then you may slaughter from your herd and from your flock which the LORD has given you, just as I have commanded you, and you may eat within your gates as much as your heart desires.
Bahnar: Tơdah anih mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm rơih boih wă dan Anăn Sư, ataih đơ̆ng iĕm oei, iĕm gơh 'bet sa rơmo dah triu lăm khŭl mă Kră Yang iĕm ăn kơ iĕm kư̆m thoi Inh pơkă kơ iĕm; iĕm gơh sa 'nhĕm mơ̆ng kơ wă sa lăm pơlei iĕm kơdih.

English: Just as the gazelle and the deer are eaten, so you may eat them; the unclean and the clean alike may eat them.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơh sa 'nhĕm thoi sa 'nhĕm kơtŏng păng jĭl bram; đĭ-đăng bơngai yoch kơnê̆ dah bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kư̆m gơh sa.

English: Only be sure that you do not eat the blood, for the blood is the life; you may not eat the life with the meat.
Bahnar: Mă-lei athei kơchăng, 'nĕ kơ sa pham; yua kơ pham đei tơdrong arih, lei na ưh kơ gơh ôh sa tơdrong arih hơdai hăm 'nhĕm.

English: You shall not eat it; you shall pour it on the earth like water.
Bahnar: Iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa pham; athei tuh hŭt lê̆ tơ teh thoi đak.

English: You shall not eat it, that it may go well with you and your children after you, when you do what is right in the sight of the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ sa pham, wă kơ iĕm păng kon sâu iĕm gơh đei pŭn hiôk, yua kơ pơm 'lơ̆ng trŏ thoi Kră Yang lăp đon.

English: Only the holy things which you have, and your vowed offerings, you shall take and go to the place which the LORD chooses.
Bahnar: Gah lu sem dơrong mă iĕm 'măn lê̆ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh wă pơyơ̆r păng kiơ̆ thoi đei pơkă boih dah wă pơsĭt đơ̆ng nơ̆r pơkă wă pơyơ̆r, na rôp anhăk ba năm tơ anih mă Kră Yang rơih boih.

English: And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the meat and the blood, on the altar of the LORD your God; and the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out on the altar of the LORD your God, and you shall eat the meat.
Bahnar: Tơ noh lu iĕm pơyơ̆r 'nhĕm păng pham pơm tơmam soi 'buh kơpal chơnang soi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; mưh wă pơyơ̆r tơmam nai, iĕm tuh dan pham kơpal chơnang soi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, na 'nhĕm noh iĕm gơh sa.

English: Observe and obey all these words which I command you, that it may go well with you and your children after you forever, when you do what is good and right in the sight of the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Athei bơwei păng mơ̆ng răk kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong 'nâu mă inh đei bơtho pơkă kơ iĕm 'nâu, wă kơ iĕm păng kon sâu iĕm gơh đei pŭn hiôk ling-lang, yua kơ pơm dôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng trŏ thoi noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon.

English: “When the LORD your God cuts off from before you the nations which you go to dispossess, and you displace them and dwell in their land
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô pơlôch lu adrĕch adrung mă iĕm wă blah iŏk, na oei hloi tơ lăm dêh lu sư.

English: take heed to yourself that you are not ensnared to follow them, after they are destroyed from before you, and that you do not inquire after their gods, saying, ‘How did these nations serve their gods? I also will do likewise.’
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng bĕ đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư lôch đĭ kơnh ih 'leh lăm hơđong, 'nĕ chơchă wă kơ băt yang lu sư, na khan: Lu adrĕch adrung âu bơ̆jang kơkuh kơ yang lu sư thoi yơ kih? Lu bơ̆n gô pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh.

English: You shall not worship the LORD your God in that way; for every abomination to the LORD which He hates they have done to their gods; for they burn even their sons and daughters in the fire to their gods.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ bơ̆jang kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm thoi noh, yua kơ lu sư đei pơm boih dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp Kră Yang areh hloh kơ noh đơ̆ng lu sư soh pơyơ̆r kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu sư kơdih tơ ŭnh pơm tơmam soi 'buh arih kơ yang kơnê̆.

English: “Whatever I command you, be careful to observe it; you shall not add to it nor take away from it.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei kơchăng; pơm kiơ̆ mă trŏ thoi noh 'nĕ kơ hŭt dah pơthim kiơ.

English: “If there arises among you a prophet or a dreamer of dreams, and he gives you a sign or a wonder
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, dah bơngai juăt apo 'bôh chă pơm khan lê̆ adrol dah tơdrong tơdra hlĭch

English: and the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, ‘Let us go after other gods’—which you have not known—‘and let us serve them,’
Bahnar: tơdah tơdra hlĭch păng khan lê̆ adrol noh đei trŏ tơpă na sư khan: Bĕ bơ̆n kiơ̆ lu yang nai; yang mă lu iĕm ưh tam băt, bĕ bơ̆n kơkuh kơ yang noh.

English: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet or that dreamer of dreams, for the LORD your God is testing you to know whether you love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
Bahnar: Na 'nĕ kơ mơ̆ng ôh nơ̆r bơngai khan lê̆ adrol noh dah lu bơngai apo noh roi, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm pơlong lăng lu iĕm, wă băt kơ lu iĕm hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak đĭ đon tơchĕng 'mêm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm dah ưh.

English: You shall walk after the LORD your God and fear Him, and keep His commandments and obey His voice; you shall serve Him and hold fast to Him.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei yak kiơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm păng hli yom kơkuh kơ Sư, wei răk dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă, mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư khan, bơ̆jang kơ Sư păng pơgơ̆p kơjăp hăm Sư.

English: But that prophet or that dreamer of dreams shall be put to death, because he has spoken in order to turn you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of bondage, to entice you from the way in which the LORD your God commanded you to walk. So you shall put away the evil from your midst.
Bahnar: Athei pơlôch bơngai khan lê̆ adrol dah bơngai juăt apo noh, yua kơ sư pơhlŭ pơtơm iĕm iung blah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, Tơ'ngla mă chông ba lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng pơm đĭch, bơngai noh kư̆m chă đon wă pơm kơ iĕm achăng lê̆ trong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm tơhlâu tơ'bôh ăn kơ iĕm trong wă rok kiơ̆, athei pơlôch lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ wă tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm.

English: “If your brother, the son of your mother, your son or your daughter, the wife of your bosom, or your friend who is as your own soul, secretly entices you, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods,’ which you have not known, neither you nor your fathers
Bahnar: Tơdah đei 'nhŏng oh pôm mĕ 'bă, kon drŏ-nglo dah kon drŏ-kăn iĕm, akăn iĕm mă 'mêm kơeng, dah buăl juăt iĕm năm pơtơm pơhlŭ iĕm, khan: Bĕ bơ̆n năm kơkuh kơ yang nai, mă iĕm hăm lu 'bok iĕm kư̆m ưh tam băt

English: of the gods of the people which are all around you, near to you or far off from you, from one end of the earth to the other end of the earth
Bahnar: yang lu adrĕch adrung oei jum dăr kơ iĕm, jê̆ dah ataih, đơ̆ng dêh âu truh tơ tôch dêh to

English: you shall not consent to him or listen to him, nor shall your eye pity him, nor shall you spare him or conceal him
Bahnar: Na iĕm 'nĕ kơ chu kiơ̆ sư, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ mơ̆ng sư, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ mơnat; păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ bơwei dah dŏng lu sư.

English: but you shall surely kill him; your hand shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm athei pơlôch sư hloi. Tơpang ti iĕm kơdih gô pơlôch sư adrol hloh kơ đĭ-đăng, đơ̆ng noh tơpang ti đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei.

English: And you shall stone him with stones until he dies, because he sought to entice you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei iŏk tơmo klơ̆m pơlôch sư, yua kơ sư chă đon pơhlŭ ih iĕm achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, Tơ'ngla chông iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng pơm đĭch.

English: So all Israel shall hear and fear, and not again do such wickedness as this among you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael gô kơtơ̆ng băt dôm tơdrong noh păng hli tơrơ, lei na ưh pă đei pơ̆n pơm minh tơdrong kơnê̆ noh dơ̆ng.

English: “If you hear someone in one of your cities, which the LORD your God gives you to dwell in, saying
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng ang minh lăm lu pơlei tih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ iĕm

English: ‘Corrupt men have gone out from among you and enticed the inhabitants of their city, saying, “Let us go and serve other gods” ’—which you have not known
Bahnar: đei lu bơngai kơnê̆ iung năm pơhlŭ pơlung kon pơlei noh, khan: Bĕ bơ̆n năm kơkuh kơ yang nai, yang mă lu iĕm tam lah băt

English: then you shall inquire, search out, and ask diligently. And if it is indeed true and certain that such an abomination was committed among you
Bahnar: na iĕm athei chă apinh lăng, pơnhen hơlen mă hơđăl. Tơdah tơdrong noh đei tơpă tơdrong kơnê̆ noh đei pơm tơpă tơ lăm lu iĕm

English: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying it, all that is in it and its livestock—with the edge of the sword.
Bahnar: iĕm athei iŏk đao gưm pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai lăm pơlei tih noh. Athei pơrăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai păng lu sem dơrong.

English: And you shall gather all its plunder into the middle of the street, and completely burn with fire the city and all its plunder, for the LORD your God. It shall be a heap forever; it shall not be built again.
Bahnar: Athei pơpôi iŏk pơđĭ lu tơmam đơ̆ng blah iŏk đơ̆ng lăm pơlei tih noh, năm tuh lê̆ tơ cham să na iŏk ŭnh soh pơlei noh păng đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam lăm noh, thoi tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, pơlei noh gô jing rơ̆m ngar ŭnh ling-lang hlŏng hloi, ưh pă bu gơh tơiung pơjing dơ̆ng.

English: So none of the accursed things shall remain in your hand, that the LORD may turn from the fierceness of His anger and show you mercy, have compassion on you and multiply you, just as He swore to your fathers
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam trŏ kơ đe pơrăm tơhiong ưh kơ đei bu mă chro ti iŏk ôh wă kơ Kră Yang huay kơ hil mĭl, na tơ'bôh tơdrong Sư 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm ăn kơ iĕm hrôh ngôh rai lơ thoi sư đei pơkă pơkăm hăm lu 'bok iĕm sơ̆.

English: because you have listened to the voice of the LORD your God, to keep all His commandments which I command you today, to do what is right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm chu nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, wei răk đĭ dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă, mă inh bơtho ăn kơ iĕm năr 'nâu păng pơm tơdrong trŏ 'blep mă Kră Yang lăp đon.

English: “You are the children of the LORD your God; you shall not cut yourselves nor shave the front of your head for the dead.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm jing kon Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, dah đei bơngai lôch 'nĕ kơ 'bet akâu kơdih, dah hơkôih sŏk klĕng

English: For you are a holy people to the LORD your God, and the LORD has chosen you to be a people for Himself, a special treasure above all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.
Bahnar: yua kơ iĕm jing minh adrĕch 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; Kră Yang rơih iŏk boih iĕm đơ̆ng lăm lu adrĕch kon pơlei kơpal teh âu. Wă jing tơmam Sư kơdih lĕch đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng, adrĕch kon pơlei pơla oei ala teh âu.

English: “You shall not eat any detestable thing.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ sa minh anăn tơmam kiơ mă Inh areh lăng krưp kơnê̆.

English: These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu sem brem mă lu iĕm gơh sa: Rơmo, triu, bơbe

English: the deer, the gazelle, the roe deer, the wild goat, the mountain goat, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
Bahnar: juei, jĭl bram, bơbe bri, kơtŏng, keh, rơmo bri, triu bri

English: And you may eat every animal with cloven hooves, having the hoof split into two parts, and that chews the cud, among the animals.
Bahnar: Lăm lu sem brem, mă lu iĕm gơh sa noh lu kon sem brem ayơ đei kơchôp blah 'bar păng gơh mơkan.

English: Nevertheless, of those that chew the cud or have cloven hooves, you shall not eat, such as these: the camel, the hare, and the rock hyrax; for they chew the cud but do not have cloven hooves; they are unclean for you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm lu kon sem brem gơh mơkan đei kơchôp blah 'bar, 'nâu mă lu kon sem brem lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa: Thoi lăk-đa, tơpai bri păng kơne kơdŭt rong lăm hnam, lu sư gơh mơkan; mă-lei ưh kơ đei kơchôp blah 'bar, jô̆ lu 'noh kon sem ưh kơ rơgoh.

English: Also the swine is unclean for you, because it has cloven hooves, yet does not chew the cud; you shall not eat their flesh or touch their dead carcasses.
Bahnar: Păng nhŭng kư̆m ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; yua kơ sư đei kơchôp blah 'bar, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh mơkan: Jô̆ tơmam noh ưh kơ rơgoh ăn kơ lu iĕm, 'nĕ kơ sa 'nhĕm kon sem brem noh păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hơtŭt 'bơm akâu dah lu sư lôch.

English: “These you may eat of all that are in the waters: you may eat all that have fins and scales.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu ka oei arih lăm đak mă lu iĕm gơh sa, ka đei pơnăr păng kơchap.

English: And whatever does not have fins and scales you shall not eat; it is unclean for you.
Bahnar: Lu ka mă ưh kơ đei pơnăr păng ưh kơ đei kơchap lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa ôh; sư kơnê̆ ưh kơ gơh rơgoh.

English: “All clean birds you may eat.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơh sa dôm lu sem păr rơgoh 'lơ̆ng

English: But these you shall not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the buzzard
Bahnar: mă-lei, 'nâu sem păr mă lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa: Klang, grơ̆, klang kok

English: the red kite, the falcon, and the kite after their kinds
Bahnar: klang gơsum, klang kơtơp kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư

English: every raven after its kind
Bahnar: dôm lu sem ak

English: the ostrich, the short-eared owl, the sea gull, and the hawk after their kinds
Bahnar: sem tre-yang, sem bơrơ̆m, sem tre-wĕt, klang kơsum kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư

English: the little owl, the screech owl, the white owl
Bahnar: bơrơ̆m iĕ, bơrơ̆m tih, bơrơ̆m kok

English: the jackdaw, the carrion vulture, the fisher owl
Bahnar: bơrơ̆m char glă, sem bŏng ko, klang kial

English: the stork, the heron after its kind, and the hoopoe and the bat.
Bahnar: klang kok, tre-yang păng hơmiĕt, hơda kiơ̆ kơ khŭl sư.

English: “Also every creeping thing that flies is unclean for you; they shall not be eaten.
Bahnar: Kon sem kơep lep-ler đei pơnăr păr jing kơnê̆ kơ lu iĕm.

English: “You may eat all clean birds.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơh sa lu kon sem kơep lep-ler đei pơnăr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: “You shall not eat anything that dies of itself; you may give it to the alien who is within your gates, that he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner; for you are a holy people to the LORD your God. “You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ sa minh pôm kon sem brem lôch kơmăp, gơh ăn kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei lăm pơlei ih, ăn kơ sư sa, kư̆m gơh tĕch ăn kơ bơngai tơmoi. Yua kơ ih jơ̆ adrĕch rơgoh 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm. 'Nĕ kơ pai hơbĭ 'nhĕm bơbe kon hăm đak toh mĕ sư.

English: “You shall truly tithe all the increase of your grain that the field produces year by year.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ hiơt kơ pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt gah tơmam bơ̆n đêl rei bơih, mă đơ̆ng lăm mir chŭn bơ̆n đei lăm rim sơnăm.

English: And you shall eat before the LORD your God, in the place where He chooses to make His name abide, the tithe of your grain and your new wine and your oil, of the firstborn of your herds and your flocks, that you may learn to fear the LORD your God always.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơh sa tơmam pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt noh lu phe 'ba, sik hơmu, đak rơmă, plei 'long ôliwơ păng lu kon gơgơ̆l rơmo kơdră dah triu 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, lăm anih Sư gô rơih iŏk wă 'măn Anăn Sư wă kơ iĕm pơhrăm iŏk băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ling-lang.

English: But if the journey is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry the tithe, or if the place where the LORD your God chooses to put His name is too far from you, when the LORD your God has blessed you
Bahnar: Tơdah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn pŭn kơ iĕm, tơdah anih mă Kră Yang rơih wă 'măn Anăn Sư ataih dêh, dĭng mah ưh kơ gơh wă năm ba tơmam pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt ei.

English: then you shall exchange it for money, take the money in your hand, and go to the place which the LORD your God chooses.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt noh tơplih iŏk jên hu, chĕp jên hu na năm tơ anih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm gô rơih.

English: And you shall spend that money for whatever your heart desires: for oxen or sheep, for wine or similar drink, for whatever your heart desires; you shall eat there before the LORD your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your household.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm iŏk jên hu noh răt dôm tơmam kiơ mă iĕm wă, rơmo dah triu, sik hơmu, dah tơdrô kơtang, tơmam sa kiơ mă iĕm 'maih wă sa; na iĕm păng hnam dơnŏ gô huch sa chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: You shall not forsake the Levite who is within your gates, for he has no part nor inheritance with you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hiơt achăng lê̆ lu bơngai Lêwi mă oei hơdai lăm pơlei iĕm, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ đei teh jang sa lăm lu iĕm.

English: “At the end of every third year you shall bring out the tithe of your produce of that year and store it up within your gates.
Bahnar: Tôch truh sơnăm mă pêng, iĕm iŏk tơmam minh lăm mơjĭt tơmam iĕm đei lăm sơnăm noh păng tah mong lê̆ tơ anih mong lăm pơlei.

English: And the Levite, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you, and the stranger and the fatherless and the widow who are within your gates, may come and eat and be satisfied, that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi, yua kơ lu ưh kơ đei mŭk tơmam teh jang sa tơ lăm lu iĕm ôh păng lu bơngai tơmoi, lu bơngai mơti păng lu bơngai yă adro mă oei hơdai lăm pơlei iĕm, kư̆m gô năm sa phĭ mah; thoi ei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn pŭn kơ dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti iĕm kơdih pơm.

English: “At the end of every seven years you shall grant a release of debts.
Bahnar: Tôch kơ rim tơpơh sơnăm, iĕm athei ăn rơngei kơ hre

English: And this is the form of the release: Every creditor who has lent anything to his neighbor shall release it; he shall not require it of his neighbor or his brother, because it is called the LORD’s release.
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong juăt ăn rơngei, tơ'ngla mă ăn kơ đe tŏk iŏk noh athei ăn rơngei, ưh pă apinh dơ̆ng đơ̆ng lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm Isơrael păng lu 'nhŏng oh nai đêl tŏk iŏk noh, yua kơ Kră Yang khan boih 'nâu sơnăm ăn rơngei đơ̆ng hre.

English: Of a foreigner you may require it; but you shall give up your claim to what is owed by your brother
Bahnar: Iĕm gơh apinh đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơmoi; mă-lei gah lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm athei ăn rơngei đơ̆ng hre.

English: except when there may be no poor among you; for the LORD will greatly bless you in the land which the LORD your God is giving you to possess as an inheritance
Bahnar: Ưh kơ wă lăm lu iĕm đei bơngai dơnuh, yua kơ đei Kră Yang gô ăn pŭn hiôk rơkah rơkai lăm dêh mă Kră Yang ăn kơ iĕm đei iŏk teh bơ̆jang sa

English: only if you carefully obey the voice of the LORD your God, to observe with care all these commandments which I command you today.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm chu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơtă mă inh đei bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm năr âu.

English: For the LORD your God will bless you just as He promised you; you shall lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow; you shall reign over many nations, but they shall not reign over you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Sư đei pơkă; iĕm gô ăn kơ lơ teh đak gơh tŏk iŏk, mă gah iĕm huay kơ tŏk iŏk đơ̆ng teh đak nai; iĕm gô pơgơ̆r lơ teh đak, teh đak nai ưh kơ gơh pơgơ̆r teh đak iĕm.

English: “If there is among you a poor man of your brethren, within any of the gates in your land which the LORD your God is giving you, you shall not harden your heart nor shut your hand from your poor brother
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lăm dêh mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei asong ăn, oei đei bơngai dơnuh hin, na 'nĕ kơ kret kơ lu bơngai noh.

English: but you shall open your hand wide to him and willingly lend him sufficient for his need, whatever he needs.
Bahnar: Mă-lei athei bơlang ti, asong ăn tŏk iŏk tôm tơmam kiơ mă lu sư kăl wă.

English: Beware lest there be a wicked thought in your heart, saying, ‘The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand,’ and your eye be evil against your poor brother and you give him nothing, and he cry out to the LORD against you, and it become sin among you.
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ, 'nĕ kơ răk mong tơchĕng kơnê̆ 'nâu: Sơnăm mă tơpơh jơ̆ sơnăm ăn rơngei wă truh boih! Kơchăng bĕ, wă kơ iĕm huay kơ đei jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ hăm lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm bơngai dơnuh hin, ưh kơ ăn lu sư gơh tŏk iŏk kiơ, kơnh lu sư krao ôr Kră Yang tơmăk kơ iĕm, iĕm gô đei tơdrong yoch.

English: You shall surely give to him, and your heart should not be grieved when you give to him, because for this thing the LORD your God will bless you in all your works and in all to which you put your hand.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei ăn kơ đe tŏk iŏk mă hơlăng, 'nĕ ăn hăm jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ hiôk; thoi ei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô ăn pŭn hiôk lăm dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti pơm.

English: For the poor will never cease from the land; therefore I command you, saying, ‘You shall open your hand wide to your brother, to your poor and your needy, in your land.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ gô đei ling-lang lu bơngai dơnuh hin oei lăm dêh char, thoi noh, na inh hơpơi khan kơ iĕm; athei bơlang ti hơmrah asong kơ lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai dơnuh pơmat-tat mă oei hơdai lăm dêh char iĕm.

English: “If your brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold to you and serves you six years, then in the seventh year you shall let him go free from you.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai Hêbrơ, drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, tĕch akâu sư kơdih kơ iĕm sư gô jang kơ iĕm lăm tơdrâu sơnăm, na truh lăm sơnăm mă tơpơh, iĕm athei ăn kơ sư rơngei.

English: And when you send him away free from you, you shall not let him go away empty-handed
Bahnar: Kơplah ăn sư rơngei, 'nĕ kơ ăn sư brŏk tơpang ti hoh.

English: you shall supply him liberally from your flock, from your threshing floor, and from your winepress. From what the LORD your God has blessed you with, you shall give to him.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei asong ăn kơ sư sem dơrong, 'ba đơ̆ng anih juă 'ba, sik hơmu đơ̆ng anih rŏl chơpĕt, kiơ̆ kơ đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn pŭn.

English: You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you; therefore I command you this thing today.
Bahnar: Athei 'blŏk kơ iĕm đêl pơm đĭch boih lăm dêh Êyiptơ, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dŏng pơklaih; thoi noh, năr 'nâu inh bơtho khan kơ iĕm nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu.

English: And if it happens that he says to you, ‘I will not go away from you,’ because he loves you and your house, since he prospers with you
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đei đĭch iĕm khan: Inh ưh kơ wă weh đơ̆ng hnam tơ'ngla inh ôh, yua kơ sư băt 'mêm kơ hnam dơnŏ yŏng sư, yua kơ sư đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk oei hăm tơ'ngla sư.

English: then you shall take an awl and thrust it through his ear to the door, and he shall be your servant forever. Also to your female servant you shall do likewise.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei iŏk loih tôt đon sư dan sư 'bơ̆t 'măng, lei na sư gô jing đĭch ling-lang hlŏng hloi, mă đam drŏ-kăn iĕm kư̆m pơm thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: It shall not seem hard to you when you send him away free from you; for he has been worth a double hired servant in serving you six years. Then the LORD your God will bless you in all that you do.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ lăng hơnat ôh ăn kơ đĭch rơngei, yua kơ sư bơ̆jang kơ iĕm tơdrâu sơnăm boih, sa apah dang 'bar wơ̆t kơ minh 'nu bơngai jang hmă; thoi noh na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm lăm dôm tơdrong jang iĕm. Pơyơ̆r kon sem dơrong tuh blŭng-a

English: “All the firstborn males that come from your herd and your flock you shall sanctify to the LORD your God; you shall do no work with the firstborn of your herd, nor shear the firstborn of your flock.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei klah lê̆ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm dôm lu kon kơdră tơno tuh blŭng-a lăm rơmo dah triu iĕm. 'Nĕ kơ choh rơuơ ôh rơmo tơno tuh blŭng-a păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ yuă sŏk triu tơno kơdră tuh blŭng-a.

English: You and your household shall eat it before the LORD your God year by year in the place which the LORD chooses.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm iĕm păng hnam dơnŏ iĕm gô 'buh sa 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, tơ anih mă Sư gô rơih.

English: But if there is a defect in it, if it is lame or blind or has any serious defect, you shall not sacrifice it to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Dah kon sem dơrong tuh blŭng-a đei jĭ kiơ, jo dah măt tol, dah đei tơdrong jĭ nai dơ̆ng, iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ôh.

English: You may eat it within your gates; the unclean and the clean person alike may eat it, as if it were a gazelle or a deer.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm athei 'buh sa lăm pơlei kơdih; bơngai kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach păng bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kư̆m gơh sa đĭ, kư̆m thoi sa 'nhĕm juei dah sa 'nhĕm kơtŏng tơno.

English: Only you shall not eat its blood; you shall pour it on the ground like water.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ sa pham sư; athei tuh hŭt lê̆ pham noh tơ teh thoi tuh đak.

English: “Observe the month of Abib, and keep the Passover to the LORD your God, for in the month of Abib the LORD your God brought you out of Egypt by night.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk kơ khei 'ba huăt, pơm giĕng Năm Brih kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; yua kơ lăm khei trŏ kơ 'ba huăt,a Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm chông anhăk iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ kơmăng.

English: Therefore you shall sacrifice the Passover to the LORD your God, from the flock and the herd, in the place where the LORD chooses to put His name.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm anih mă Kră Yang gô rơih wă 'măn lê̆ Anăn Sư oei, iĕm athei iŏk triu dah rơmo, pơyơ̆r pơm Năm Brih ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: You shall eat no leavened bread with it; seven days you shall eat unleavened bread with it, that is, the bread of affliction (for you came out of the land of Egypt in haste), that you may remember the day in which you came out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life.
Bahnar: Năr giĕng Năm Brih 'nĕ kơ sa 'bĕng hrâu hăm 'buih pông; lăm tơpơh năr iĕm gô sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông, wă khan 'bĕng pơmat-tat, wă kơ iĕm 'blŏk kơ năr iĕm lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ hăt hot.

English: And no leaven shall be seen among you in all your territory for seven days, nor shall any of the meat which you sacrifice the first day at twilight remain overnight until morning.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr jơ̆p kơ lăm teh char iĕm oei, ưh kơ đei bu gơh 'măn 'buih păng 'nhĕm mă pơyơ̆r kơsơ̆ năr mă mônh, 'nĕ kơ lê̆ rơkah truh tơ pơgê dơning.

English: “You may not sacrifice the Passover within any of your gates which the LORD your God gives you
Bahnar: Iĕm ưh kơ gơh pơyơ̆r tơmam soi năr giĕng Năm Brih lăm minh anih ayơ lăm dêh mă Kră Yang iĕm gô ăn kơ iĕm

English: but at the place where the LORD your God chooses to make His name abide, there you shall sacrifice the Passover at twilight, at the going down of the sun, at the time you came out of Egypt.
Bahnar: mă-lei athei pơyơ̆r tơ anih mă Sư gô rơih wă 'măn Anăn Sư oei tơ noh, iĕm gô pơyơ̆r sem dơrong pơm giĕng Năm Brih, gah kơsơ̆, lăp kơplah 'năr mơ̆t, kơnhăm trŏ jơ mă iĕm lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: And you shall roast and eat it in the place which the LORD your God chooses, and in the morning you shall turn and go to your tents.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pai sa 'nhĕm tơmam soi noh tơ anih mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô rơih; truh pơgê dơning wih brŏk tơ bơsŭn iĕm pơdơh.

English: Six days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a sacred assembly to the LORD your God. You shall do no work on it.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrâu năr, iĕm athei sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông, truh năr mă tơpơh, gô đei akŭm kơkuh tih ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, iĕm ưh kơ gơh jang minh tơdrong kiơ.

English: “You shall count seven weeks for yourself; begin to count the seven weeks from the time you begin to put the sickle to the grain.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng pơtơm bơyan kĕch yuă 'ba blŭng-a, iĕm jô̆ tơpơh 'măng giĕng.

English: Then you shall keep the Feast of Weeks to the LORD your God with the tribute of a freewill offering from your hand, which you shall give as the LORD your God blesses you.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh iĕm athei pơm giĕng kơ lu tơpơh 'măng giĕng 'nâu ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ba tơmam pơyơ̆r hăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk, kiơ̆ kơ đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm.

English: You shall rejoice before the LORD your God, you and your son and your daughter, your male servant and your female servant, the Levite who is within your gates, the stranger and the fatherless and the widow who are among you, at the place where the LORD your God chooses to make His name abide.
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn, đĭch drŏ-nglo đĭch drŏ-kăn, lu bơngai Lêwi mă oei hơdai lăm pơlei iĕm, bơngai tơmoi, bơngai mơti păng bơngai adro mă oei hơdai hăm iĕm, kư̆m hơdai wang hiôk chơt tơ anih mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô rơih wă 'măn kơ Anăn Sư.

English: And you shall remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and you shall be careful to observe these statutes.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk kơ đêl pơm đĭch tơ dêh Êyiptơ, na iĕm athei kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu.

English: “You shall observe the Feast of Tabernacles seven days, when you have gathered from your threshing floor and from your winepress.
Bahnar: Iĕm kĕch yuă iŏk 'ba păng phĕ plei hơmu đang boih, iĕm athei pơm giĕng Bơsŭn lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And you shall rejoice in your feast, you and your son and your daughter, your male servant and your female servant and the Levite, the stranger and the fatherless and the widow, who are within your gates.
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn, đĭch drŏ-nglo đam drŏ-kăn, bơngai Lêwi, bơngai tơmoi, bơngai mơti păng bơngai adro oei hơdai lăm pơlei iĕm, kư̆m hơdai wăng hiôk chơt 'blŏk hơdơ̆r pơm giĕng.

English: Seven days you shall keep a sacred feast to the LORD your God in the place which the LORD chooses, because the LORD your God will bless you in all your produce and in all the work of your hands, so that you surely rejoice.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr iĕm athei kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng pơm năr giĕng âu, tơ anih mă Kră Yang gô rơih; yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm lăm đĭ phĕ plei boih păng dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti pơm kơdih; lei na iĕm gô chhôk ngă 'nă hal hơdai.

English: “Three times a year all your males shall appear before the LORD your God in the place which He chooses: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, at the Feast of Weeks, and at the Feast of Tabernacles; and they shall not appear before the LORD empty-handed.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo, rim sơnăm pêng wơ̆t, athei năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, tơ anih mă Sư gô rơih, noh lăm năr pơm giĕng sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'Buih Pông, pơm giĕng kĕch yuă phĕ păng pơm giĕng Bơsŭn; ưh kơ đei bu năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang hăm tơpang ti hoh.

English: Every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of the LORD your God which He has given you.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu gô pơyơ̆r kiơ̆ kơ tơmam lu sư đei, kiơ̆ kơ đei pŭn hiôk mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei ăn.

English: “You shall appoint judges and officers in all your gates, which the LORD your God gives you, according to your tribes, and they shall judge the people with just judgment.
Bahnar: Athei pôk ăn lu 'bok sek tơlang păng yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm lu adrĕch tơ lăm lu pơlei mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm; wă gô sek tơlang kon pơlei hăm tơdrong tơpăt.

English: You shall not pervert justice; you shall not show partiality, nor take a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm glăi kơ tơdrong tơpăt; 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t minh pah; 'nĕ kơ sa tơmam đe răt apah, yua kơ tơmam đe răt apah noh pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai rơngei măt tol păng gơwĕch lê̆ nơ̆r bơngai tơpăt.

English: You shall follow what is altogether just, that you may live and inherit the land which the LORD your God is giving you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơm mă hơnơ̆ng băl păng mă tơpăt, wă kơ lu iĕm gơh arih păng gơh iŏk oei lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn.

English: “You shall not plant for yourself any tree, as a wooden image, near the altar which you build for yourself to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t cheng chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, 'nĕ kơ pơm gơ̆ng rup yang Asêrim.

English: You shall not set up a sacred pillar, which the LORD your God hates.
Bahnar: Kŭm ưh kơ gơh pơdơ̆ng pơm minh pôm jrăng tơmo wă kơkuh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm areh kơ dôm lu tơmam noh.

English: “You shall not sacrifice to the LORD your God a bull or sheep which has any blemish or defect, for that is an abomination to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm rơmo, dah triu đei tơdrong jĭ dah jo jăn noh tơdrong krưp dêh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: “If there is found among you, within any of your gates which the LORD your God gives you, a man or a woman who has been wicked in the sight of the LORD your God, in transgressing His covenant
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai oei hơdai, lăm pơlei mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm, đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, noh pơm glăi tơdrong pơgơ̆p Sư

English: who has gone and served other gods and worshiped them, either the sun or moon or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded
Bahnar: năm bơ̆jang păng kơkuh kơ lu yang nai, thoi măt 'năr, măt khei dah lu sơnglŏng kơpal plĕnh, wă khan pơglăi dôm tơdrong Inh đei bơtho akhan

English: and it is told you, and you hear of it, then you shall inquire diligently. And if it is indeed true and certain that such an abomination has been committed in Israel
Bahnar: Đe roi tơbăt kơ iĕm păng iĕm kơtơ̆ng boih; na athei apinh mă pơnhen tơpă, tơdah tơdrong đe roi noh trŏ tơpă, sĭt thoi noh mă đei lăng hơlen tơpă đei pơm kơnê̆ krưp noh lăm char Isơrael

English: then you shall bring out to your gates that man or woman who has committed that wicked thing, and shall stone to death that man or woman with stones.
Bahnar: Na Iĕm athei chông ba bơngai drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn mă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp noh 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei, klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo.

English: Whoever is deserving of death shall be put to death on the testimony of two or three witnesses; he shall not be put to death on the testimony of one witness.
Bahnar: Athei kiơ̆ nơ̆r 'bar dah pêng 'nu bơngai pơm kơdranh drơ̆ng khan trŏ kơ pơlôch bơngai noh; ưh kơ gơh pơlôch bơngai bu tơdah đei lăp minh 'nu đĕch khan.

English: The hands of the witnesses shall be the first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So you shall put away the evil from among you.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai drơ̆ng athei yơ̆r ti adrol hloh pơlôch bơngai noh, pơtrơp đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh ti lu kon pơlei. Thoi noh, gô pơlôch pơgoh lê̆ lu tơdrong kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei iĕm.

English: “If a matter arises which is too hard for you to judge, between degrees of guilt for bloodshed, between one judgment or another, or between one punishment or another, matters of controversy within your gates, then you shall arise and go up to the place which the LORD your God chooses.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei sek tơlang hơnat thoi pơlôch bơngai, sek tơlang tơdrong đe tơgar dih băl dah tơdrong pơm kơ đe rơka, dah đei tơdrong nai, minh tơdrong truh hơnat kơ iĕm tơpă, thoi noh lu iĕm athei chĕp ba tơdrong sek noh tơ anih mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô rơih.

English: And you shall come to the priests, the Levites, and to the judge there in those days, and inquire of them; they shall pronounce upon you the sentence of judgment.
Bahnar: Năm roi kơ lu 'bok soi tơm adrĕch bơngai Lêwi păng kră sek tơlang hơgei mă oei jang lăm chăl noh, na apinh lu sư gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ iĕm băt sek tơlang trŏ.

English: You shall do according to the sentence which they pronounce upon you in that place which the LORD chooses. And you shall be careful to do according to all that they order you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r lu sư bơtho ăn tơ anih Kră Yang gô rơih, athei kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng lu sư bơtho khan.

English: According to the sentence of the law in which they instruct you, according to the judgment which they tell you, you shall do; you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left from the sentence which they pronounce upon you.
Bahnar: Athei pơm kiơ̆ trŏ tơdrong juăt đơ̆ng lu sư bơtho khan păng pơm kiơ̆ lu sư sek tơlang, 'nĕ kơ weh gah 'ma dah gah 'ngiĕo đơ̆ng lu sư bơtho khan.

English: Now the man who acts presumptuously and will not heed the priest who stands to minister there before the LORD your God, or the judge, that man shall die. So you shall put away the evil from Israel.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu, ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ kơ 'bok soi dah 'bok sek tơlang oei bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, bơngai noh athei pơlôch. Iĕm athei sŭt pơgoh pă đei tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm Isơrael dơ̆ng.

English: And all the people shall hear and fear, and no longer act presumptuously.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh na gô hli tơrơ, ưh pă pơ̆n pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ dơ̆ng.

English: “When you come to the land which the LORD your God is giving you, and possess it and dwell in it, and say, ‘I will set a king over me like all the nations that are around me,’
Bahnar: Layơ iĕm mơ̆t truh lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm đei iŏk oei tơ dêh noh boih, na iĕm khan: Lu bơ̆n rơih minh 'nu pơm pơtao wă pơgơ̆r, kư̆m thoi lu adrĕch adrung mă oei jum dăr kơ bơ̆n.

English: you shall surely set a king over you whom the LORD your God chooses; one from among your brethren you shall set as king over you; you may not set a foreigner over you, who is not your brother.
Bahnar: Iĕm gơh chă rơih bơngai pơm pơtao, mă-lei bơngai đơ̆ng Kră Yang gô rơih, athei rơih chă minh 'nu pơtao đơ̆ng lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm; 'nĕ kơ chă rơih bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ trŏ bơngai Isơrael pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r iĕm.

English: But he shall not multiply horses for himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt to multiply horses, for the LORD has said to you, ‘You shall not return that way again.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao ei 'nĕ kơ mah hiơ̆k dêh wă kơ đei aseh lơ, wă chông ba kon pơlei brŏk hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng tơ dêh Êyiptơ chă aseh; đơ̆ng Kră Yang khan: Lu iĕm 'nĕ pă wih brŏk dơ̆ng trong noh.

English: Neither shall he multiply wives for himself, lest his heart turn away; nor shall he greatly multiply silver and gold for himself.
Bahnar: Pơtao ưh gơh đei akăn lơ, kơnh hli kơ pơm jơhngơ̆m sư wơ̆l jrok kư̆m ưh kơ gơh mong hu, maih lơ kơ sư kơdih.

English: “Also it shall be, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write for himself a copy of this law in a book, from the one before the priests, the Levites.
Bahnar: Kơplah mă sư pơm pơtao, pơtao athei pơm kiơ̆ khôi juăt 'nâu, mă đơ̆ng lu 'bok soi adrĕch bơngai Lêwi, chih wei minh sơ̆p răk kơdih.

English: And it shall be with him, and he shall read it all the days of his life, that he may learn to fear the LORD his God and be careful to observe all the words of this law and these statutes
Bahnar: Pơtao athei wei minh sơ̆p, pơtao athei đŏk lăng ling-lang đĭ chăl arih sư oei kơpal teh wă pơhrăm băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư, pơ'lơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu nơ̆r khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu

English: that his heart may not be lifted above his brethren, that he may not turn aside from the commandment to the right hand or to the left, and that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his children in the midst of Israel.
Bahnar: wă kơ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak sư huay kơ pơang păng pơdê kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư păng huay kơ weh tơ gah 'ma gah 'ngiĕo, achăng lê̆ nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu, wă kơ pơtao păng kon sâu pơtao gơh pơgơ̆r đunh sot oei lăm char Isơrael.

English: “The priests, the Levites—all the tribe of Levi—shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel; they shall eat the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and His portion.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi bơngai Lêwi păng đĭ lu adrĕch bơngai Lêwi, ưh kơ đei teh bơ̆jang sa hơdai hăm lu bơngai Isơrael, lu sư arih sa đơ̆ng đe pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang păng đơ̆ng tơmam Kră Yang.

English: Therefore they shall have no inheritance among their brethren; the LORD is their inheritance, as He said to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu sư ưh kơ đei teh bơ̆jang sa, lăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư; Kră Yang boih tơmam lu sư, thoi nơ̆r Sư pơkă boih hăm lu sư.

English: “And this shall be the priest’s due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it is bull or sheep: they shall give to the priest the shoulder, the cheeks, and the stomach.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih mă tơmam 'măn kơ lu 'bok soi gơh iŏk yua mưh kon pơlei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi minh pôm, rơmo tơno dah triu akăn; minh pah hơngiĕng dah meng tơ'bong păng hlŭng klak.

English: The firstfruits of your grain and your new wine and your oil, and the first of the fleece of your sheep, you shall give him.
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m gô asong ăn kơ lu sư tơmam soi phe 'ba hle, sik hơmu, đak rơmă 'long ôliwơ mă iĕm yuă blŭng-a lăm bơyan păng sŏk lu kon triu yuă blŭng-a.

English: For the LORD your God has chosen him out of all your tribes to stand to minister in the name of the LORD, him and his sons forever.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hlôi rơih boih lu sư adrĕch Lêwi đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai Isơrael wă kơ lu sư oei păng bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang sư păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch.

English: “So if a Levite comes from any of your gates, from where he dwells among all Israel, and comes with all the desire of his mind to the place which the LORD chooses
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai Lêwi wă lê̆ pơlei mă sư oei lăm lu bơngai Isơrael, wă năm tơ anih Kră Yang rơih

English: then he may serve in the name of the LORD his God as all his brethren the Levites do, who stand there before the LORD.
Bahnar: bơngai noh gơh bơ̆jang yua anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư, thoi đĭ-đăng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, bơngai Lêwi, oei bơ̆jang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: They shall have equal portions to eat, besides what comes from the sale of his inheritance.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh kư̆m oei đei asong tơmam sa lei-lăi lăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư, mă khan sư đei boih jên đơ̆ng tĕch tơmam hnam dơnŏ sư.

English: “When you come into the land which the LORD your God is giving you, you shall not learn to follow the abominations of those nations.
Bahnar: Mưh lu iĕm mơ̆t boih lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn. 'Nĕ kơ pơhrăm pơm rok kiơ̆ dôm lu tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp lu adrĕch adrung noh pơm.

English: There shall not be found among you anyone who makes his son or his daughter pass through the fire, or one who practices witchcraft, or a soothsayer, or one who interprets omens, or a sorcerer
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ đei bơngai bu pơyơ̆r kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn sư 'buh arih pơm tơmam soi, kơ yang, 'nĕ kơ pơm bơngai chă tơng lăng, bơngai mă juăt lăng sơnglŏng khan lê̆ adrol tơdrong wă truh, bơngai pơjâu tơwir

English: or one who conjures spells, or a medium, or a spiritist, or one who calls up the dead.
Bahnar: bơngai juăt kơ chă hơlĕnh, chă pơma hăm lu yang, chă pơma hăm atâu.

English: For all who do these things are an abomination to the LORD, and because of these abominations the LORD your God drives them out from before you.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang areh păng lăng krưp dêh lu bơngai bu bơ̆jang pơm tơdrong noh păng yua kơ đĭ dôm tơdrong jang kơnê̆ krưp noh, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm pơpuh lê̆ đĭ lu adrĕch adrung lu đe noh đơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm.

English: You shall be blameless before the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei oei sa mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.
