English: For these nations which you will dispossess listened to soothsayers and diviners; but as for you, the LORD your God has not appointed such for you.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch adrung mă iĕm gô puh lê̆, noh lu bơngai pơm pơjâu, lu chă hlang lăng lu bơngai chă khan lê̆ adrol; mă gah iĕm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ưh kơ ăn ôh iĕm pơm thoi noh.

English: “The LORD your God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from your midst, from your brethren. Him you shall hear
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô pôk minh 'nu bơngai pơm 'bok khan lê̆ adrol thoi inh; đơ̆ng lăm lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm, lu iĕm athei mơ̆ng kiơ̆ sư!

English: according to all you desired of the LORD your God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, ‘Let me not hear again the voice of the LORD my God, nor let me see this great fire anymore, lest I die.’
Bahnar: Noh trŏ thoi iĕm krao apinh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, tơ Hôrêp lăm năr akŭm tih khan: Nhôn krao apinh 'nĕ pă ăn nhôn kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôr dơ̆ng păng 'nĕ pă ăn nhôn 'bôh ŭnh sa khơ̆ng 'nâu dơ̆ng, kơnh nhôn lôch đĭ.

English: “And the LORD said to me: ‘What they have spoken is good.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Lu sư pơma trŏ

English: I will raise up for them a Prophet like you from among their brethren, and will put My words in His mouth, and He shall speak to them all that I command Him.
Bahnar: Inh gô rơih pôk ăn minh 'nu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol thoi ih đơ̆ng, lăm 'nhŏng oh lu sư. Inh gô ăn nơ̆r Inh pơma lăm 'bơ̆r sư, na sư gô pơma ăn kơ lu sư dôm tơdrong Inh tơtă kơ lu sư.

English: And it shall be that whoever will not hear My words, which He speaks in My name, I will require it of him.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai bu ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh, đơ̆ng bơngai mă khan lê̆ adrol noh sư gô yua anăn Inh pơma, na Inh boih gô jô̆ bơngai noh yoch.

English: But the prophet who presumes to speak a word in My name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet shall die.’
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai khan lê̆ adrol đei jơhngơ̆m pơang yua anăn Inh pơma dôm tơdrong kiơ mă Inh ưh kơ athei sư pơma, dah yua anăn lu yang nai, na lu bơngai thoi noh trŏ kơ pơlôch.

English: And if you say in your heart, ‘How shall we know the word which the LORD has not spoken?’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm pơma lăm jơhngơ̆m khan: Liơ lu nhôn gơh băt kơnăl nơ̆r ayơ mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang bơtho khan?

English: when a prophet speaks in the name of the LORD, if the thing does not happen or come to pass, that is the thing which the LORD has not spoken; the prophet has spoken it presumptuously; you shall not be afraid of him.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai khan lê̆ adrol yua anăn Kră Yang na pơma, nơ̆r pơma bơngai noh ưh kơ đei truh păng ưh kơ đei pơsĭt 'blep trŏ, noh ưh kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang mă bơtho khan, bơngai khan lê̆ adrol pơma lĕch đơ̆ng tơdrong sư pơang. 'Nĕ hli kơ sư ôh.

English: “When the LORD your God has cut off the nations whose land the LORD your God is giving you, and you dispossess them and dwell in their cities and in their houses
Bahnar: Layơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm pơlôch pơrăm đĭ boih lu adrĕch adrung mă oei lăm dêh char Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn mưh iĕm đei pơpuh lê̆ lu sư boih, mơ̆t oei lăm lu pơlei păng lăm hnam lu sư boih

English: you shall separate three cities for yourself in the midst of your land which the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'măn lê̆ pha pêng tŏ pơlei kơ lăm tŏk-bŏk dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn iŏk.

English: You shall prepare roads for yourself, and divide into three parts the territory of your land which the LORD your God is giving you to inherit, that any manslayer may flee there.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pơm trong, klah asong pêng tŏ tơring lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm asong wă bơ̆jang sa; Wă ăn kơ lu bơngai pơlôch đe ôn kơ'nơp tơ noh.

English: “And this is the case of the manslayer who flees there, that he may live: Whoever kills his neighbor unintentionally, not having hated him in time past
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih tơdrong juăt kơ lu bơngai pơlôch bơngai ôn kơ'nơp tơ noh wă kơ gơh pơklaih tơdrong arih sư kơdih, bơngai bu hơch 'bơm pơlôch ưh kơ pơrơ̆ng, ưh kơ đei chă areh băl adrol.

English: as when a man goes to the woods with his neighbor to cut timber, and his hand swings a stroke with the ax to cut down the tree, and the head slips from the handle and strikes his neighbor so that he dies—he shall flee to one of these cities and live
Bahnar: Pơtih gia thoi bơngai noh năm hơdai buăl sư mơ̆t tơ lăm bri kăl 'long ŭnh, ti sư oei kăl 'long ŭnh, na pla sung tơgloh 'bơm buăl sư, lôch hloi, na sư kơdâu ôn kơ'nơp akâu sư minh lăm pêng tŏ pơlei 'nâu, wă pơklaih tơdrong arih sư

English: lest the avenger of blood, while his anger is hot, pursue the manslayer and overtake him, because the way is long, and kill him, though he was not deserving of death, since he had not hated the victim in time past.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai wă tơiung kơting, blĕk dêh na druh bơngai mă pơlôch đe noh, yua kơ trong ataih dêh, druh tam na koh pơlôch hloi bơngai noh, mă khan bơngai noh ưh tam trŏ pơlôch ră, ưh kơ đei tơdrong đơ̆ng adrol ki sơ̆, sư tam lah chă tơhil areh băl hăm lu rông 'bôt sư.

English: Therefore I command you, saying, ‘You shall separate three cities for yourself.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh inh bơtho khan kơ iĕm: Klah lê̆ pêng tŏ pơlei âu.

English: “Now if the LORD your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you the land which He promised to give to your fathers
Bahnar: Mưh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơih hơdral teh đak iĕm rai să kiơ̆ thoi Sư đei pơkă pơkăm hăm lu 'bok iĕm, na ăn kơ iĕm đĭ teh đak mă Sư pơkă wă ăn kơ lu 'bok iĕm.

English: and if you keep all these commandments and do them, which I command you today, to love the LORD your God and to walk always in His ways, then you shall add three more cities for yourself besides these three
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm, pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơtă mă inh bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm năr âu, athei 'mêm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yak kiơ̆ trong Sư ling-lang, thoi noh iĕm athei lê̆ thim pêng tŏ pơlei plơ̆ng dơ̆ng

English: lest innocent blood be shed in the midst of your land which the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and thus guilt of bloodshed be upon you.
Bahnar: wă huay kơ đei tuh pham tơdrong kơ đei lăm char mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn boih kơ iĕm jang sa, lei na iĕm huay kơ pŭ yoch tuh pham noh.

English: “But if anyone hates his neighbor, lies in wait for him, rises against him and strikes him mortally, so that he dies, and he flees to one of these cities
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo hil areh kơ bơngai rông 'bôt sư, chă đon wă răp pơlôch bơngai noh, bơngai noh lôch, na kơdâu ôn kơ'nơp kơdih lăm minh lu pơlei 'nâu

English: then the elders of his city shall send and bring him from there, and deliver him over to the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.
Bahnar: Na lu kră pơlei sư wơh athei đe rôp bơngai noh đơ̆ng pơlei ôn kơ'nơp na pơjao ăn kơ lu bơngai pơm 'mong pham pơlôch bơngai noh.

English: Your eye shall not pity him, but you shall put away the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with you.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ lăng khan mơnat kơ bơngai pơlôch đe, mă-lei athei pơlôch lê̆ lu bơngai pơlôch đe ưh kơ pơm yoch đơ̆ng dêh Isơrael, wă kơ lu iĕm đei pŭn hiôk.

English: “You shall not remove your neighbor’s landmark, which the men of old have set, in your inheritance which you will inherit in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ rĭ 'long pơ̆ng hơdral mă đơ̆ng lu kră sơ̆ đei pơ̆ng wă klah asong teh jang sa, lăm dêh char mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm iŏk.

English: “One witness shall not rise against a man concerning any iniquity or any sin that he commits; by the mouth of two or three witnesses the matter shall be established.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng minh 'nu bơngai pơm kơdranh ưh tam gơh ôh wă jô̆ kơ bu khan yoch mă khan sư pơm glăi dêh dah sư đei pơm glăi tơdrong kiơ; athei đei 'bar dah pêng 'nu bơngai pơm kơdranh, lei na gơh jô̆ sư glăi.

English: If a false witness rises against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu roi sơlam hơlĕnh wă jâu kư̆ kă kơ minh 'nu khan pơm yoch glăi

English: then both men in the controversy shall stand before the LORD, before the priests and the judges who serve in those days.
Bahnar: 'bar 'nu bre bơngai đe jâu, bơngai jâu noh gô năm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok soi păng lu kră sek tơlang oei jang kơplah noh.

English: And the judges shall make careful inquiry, and indeed, if the witness is a false witness, who has testified falsely against his brother
Bahnar: Lu kră sek tơlang gô apinh lăng hơlen mă hơđăl, tơdah 'bôh bơngai chă sơlam hơlĕnh, pơglăi ăn kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư

English: then you shall do to him as he thought to have done to his brother; so you shall put away the evil from among you.
Bahnar: Lei ih athei pơm kơ sư thoi sư đei pơm kơ 'nhŏng oh sư; lu iĕm athei pơm rơgoh tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei iĕm thoi noh.

English: And those who remain shall hear and fear, and hereafter they shall not again commit such evil among you.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu bơngai kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh gô hli, ưh pă pơm kơnê̆ chă jâu băl dơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm.

English: Your eye shall not pity: life shall be for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ khan mơnat, tơdrong arih 'mong tơdrong arih, măt 'mong măt, hơnĕnh 'mong hơnĕnh, ti 'mong ti, jơ̆ng 'mong jơ̆ng.

English: “When you go out to battle against your enemies, and see horses and chariots and people more numerous than you, do not be afraid of them; for the LORD your God is with you, who brought you up from the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm năm tơblah ham lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm 'bôh aseh, gre aseh păng linh lơ hloh kơ iĕm, 'nĕ kơ hli, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm Tơ'ngla mă chông iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, gô oei hơdai iĕm.

English: So it shall be, when you are on the verge of battle, that the priest shall approach and speak to the people.
Bahnar: Mưh wă pơtơm tơblah, 'bok soi gô năm adrol, pơtơm krao linh

English: And he shall say to them, ‘Hear, O Israel: Today you are on the verge of battle with your enemies. Do not let your heart faint, do not be afraid, and do not tremble or be terrified because of them
Bahnar: Na sư khan: Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael mơ̆ng bĕ! Năr âu lu bơ̆n gô năm tơblah hăm lu bơngai ayăt lu iĕm 'nĕ rơdu lêl 'nĕ kơ hli, 'nĕ kơ tơrơ, 'nĕ kơ lăng krưp.

English: for the LORD your God is He who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm gô năm hơdai hăm lu iĕm, tơblah lu ayăt dŏng lu iĕm păng ăn jei lu iĕm.

English: “Then the officers shall speak to the people, saying: ‘What man is there who has built a new house and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle and another man dedicate it.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh khan kơ lu linh: Bơngai bu 'nao pơm hnam tam mă et sa pơkeh? Brŏk bĕ tơ hnam sư, kơnh hli kơ lôch lăm năr tơblah, na lê̆ kơ bơngai nai et sa pơkeh.

English: Also what man is there who has planted a vineyard and has not eaten of it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle and another man eat of it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hlôi pơm pơtăm minh hlak pơgar hơmu păng tam mă phĕ sa plei? Brŏk bĕ tơ hnam sư, kơnh hli kơ lôch lăm năr tơblah, na lê̆ kơ bơngai nai phĕ sa plei noh.

English: And what man is there who is betrothed to a woman and has not married her? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle and another man marry her.’
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hơkơ̆t boih hăm bơngai adruh, tam mă oei? Brŏk bĕ tơ hnam sư, kơnh hli kơ lôch lăm năr tơblah, na lê̆ kơ bơngai nai iŏk oei?

English: “The officers shall speak further to the people, and say, ‘What man is there who is fearful and fainthearted? Let him go and return to his house, lest the heart of his brethren faint like his heart.’
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh khan dơ̆ng hăm lu linh: Bơngai bu hli tơrơ? Brŏk bĕ tơ hnam sư, kơnh jơhngơ̆m 'nhŏng oh wang hơdai hli thoi sư mơ̆n

English: And so it shall be, when the officers have finished speaking to the people, that they shall make captains of the armies to lead the people.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh pơma đang boih hăm lu linh, lu sư chă rơih pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng linh.

English: “When you go near a city to fight against it, then proclaim an offer of peace to it.
Bahnar: Kơplah wă năm wang blah pơlei ayơ, adrol hloh athei pơma hiôk hăm pơlei noh.

English: And it shall be that if they accept your offer of peace, and open to you, then all the people who are found in it shall be placed under tribute to you, and serve you.
Bahnar: Tơdah pơlei noh tơl rơngơp păng pơih ăn 'măng jang kơ lu iĕm, lei đĭ-đăng kon pơlei noh gô pơm đĭch păng bơ̆jang kơ iĕm.

English: Now if the city will not make peace with you, but makes war against you, then you shall besiege it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah pơlei noh ưh kơ wă pơhiôk hăm iĕm 'maih tơblah hăm iĕm lei athei wang tăp dăr kơ pơlei noh.

English: And when the LORD your God delivers it into your hands, you shall strike every male in it with the edge of the sword.
Bahnar: Dah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao pơlei noh lăm tơpang ti iĕm, lei iĕm athei pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo pơlei hăm đao gưm.

English: But the women, the little ones, the livestock, and all that is in the city, all its spoil, you shall plunder for yourself; and you shall eat the enemies’ plunder which the LORD your God gives you.
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei rôp iŏk đĭ, lu bơngai drŏ-kăn, lu hơ'lơ̆p, sem dơrong păng đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam kiơ lăm pơlei, noh tơmam blah tơgar iŏk, iĕm gô iŏk yua dôm tơmam đêl blah tơgar iŏk mă Kră Yang ăn boih kơ iĕm.

English: Thus you shall do to all the cities which are very far from you, which are not of the cities of these nations.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơm thoi noh mơ̆n hăm lu pơlei mă oei ataih dêh đơ̆ng iĕm, mă ưh kơ trŏ pơlei lu adrĕch 'nâu.

English: “But of the cities of these peoples which the LORD your God gives you as an inheritance, you shall let nothing that breathes remain alive
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm pơlei lu adrĕch 'nâu, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn boih kơ iĕm bơ̆jang sa, na iĕm athei pơlôch đĭ sem kiơ dui jơhngơ̆m.

English: but you shall utterly destroy them: the Hittite and the Amorite and the Canaanite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite, just as the LORD your God has commanded you
Bahnar: Athei pơlôch pơrăm đĭ, kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Amôrit, kon pơlei Kanaan, kon pơlei Pêrisit, kon pơlei Hêwit, kon pơlei Jêbus, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm đei pơkă boih.

English: lest they teach you to do according to all their abominations which they have done for their gods, and you sin against the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Tơdah ưh lu sư gô pơtơm iĕm rok pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu tơdrong kơnê̆ krưp mă lu sư pơm, kơkuh kơ rup yang lu sư, lu iĕm gô pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: “When you besiege a city for a long time, while making war against it to take it, you shall not destroy its trees by wielding an ax against them; if you can eat of them, do not cut them down to use in the siege, for the tree of the field is man’s food.
Bahnar: Mưh lu iĕm wang dăr pơlei ayơ đunh wă 'maih tơgar iŏk, 'nĕ kơ iŏk sung kăl lu 'long plei sa pơlei noh, yua kơ lu iĕm gô phĕ sa plei 'long noh 'nĕ kơ kăl tŭk lê̆ lu 'long, yua kơ lu 'long 'nâu chăt lăm mir, ưh kơ bơngai mă lu iĕm wang

English: Only the trees which you know are not trees for food you may destroy and cut down, to build siegeworks against the city that makes war with you, until it is subdued.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơrăm păng kăl lu 'long ưh kơ đei plei sa; yua bĕ lu 'long noh pơm kơđông anih wă tơblah hăm pơlei, dĭng mă lu iĕm gơh mơ̆t blah iŏk.

English: “If anyone is found slain, lying in the field in the land which the LORD your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who killed him
Bahnar: Tơdah lăm teh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ lu iĕm iŏk oei, đei 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai đe pơlôch, tơ'bĭch lăm chŭn, ưh kơ băt bơngai bu pơlôch

English: then your elders and your judges shall go out and measure the distance from the slain man to the surrounding cities.
Bahnar: na lu đe kră pơlei păng lu bơngai sek tơlang athei pơtŏ lăng đơ̆ng bơngai lôch noh truh tơ lu pơlei jum dăr noh ataih dang yơ.

English: And it shall be that the elders of the city nearest to the slain man will take a heifer which has not been worked and which has not pulled with a yoke.
Bahnar: Lu đe kră pơlei oei jê̆ hloh bơngai lôch noh, athei rôp minh pôm rơmo akăn adruh tam mă jang dah tam mă tah tơ 'long ăt

English: The elders of that city shall bring the heifer down to a valley with flowing water, which is neither plowed nor sown, and they shall break the heifer’s neck there in the valley.
Bahnar: dui ba rơmo noh truh tơ thŭng, anih mă ưh tam đei bu choh păng đei đak ro tơ noh lu sư gô gơ̆ lê̆ hơko rơmo akăn noh.

English: Then the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come near, for the LORD your God has chosen them to minister to Him and to bless in the name of the LORD; by their word every controversy and every assault shall be settled.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi, kon drŏ-nglo bơngai Lêwi, gô năm jê̆ tơ noh; yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm rơih iŏk lu sư boih wă jang kơ Sư păng yua anăn Kră Yang sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk athei sek tơlang lu tơdrong pơjah pơjăng păng đei pơjĭ băl.

English: And all the elders of that city nearest to the slain man shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley.
Bahnar: Đĭ kơ lu kră pơlei mă oei jê̆ hloh bơngai lôch noh, athei ôp ti lu sư tơ kơpal rơmo akăn adruh noh, mă 'nao gơ̆ hơko tơ lăm thŭng noh

English: Then they shall answer and say, ‘Our hands have not shed this blood, nor have our eyes seen it.
Bahnar: păng ti lu nhôn ưh kơ đei pơm kơ pham bơngai âu lĕch; măt lu nhôn ưh kơ đei 'bôh bu pơlôch.

English: Provide atonement, O LORD, for Your people Israel, whom You have redeemed, and do not lay innocent blood to the charge of Your people Israel.’ And atonement shall be provided on their behalf for the blood.
Bahnar: Kơkuh kơ Ih ơ Kră Yang apinh Ih mơnat ăn tơdrong yoch kon pơlei pơla Ih Isơrael mă Ih huai iŏk boih; apinh 'nĕ kơ jô̆ pham ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch âu kơ kon pơlei Ih! Lei tơdrong yoch tuh pham âu gô huai iŏk.

English: So you shall put away the guilt of innocent blood from among you when you do what is right in the sight of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô rơgoh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na tơdrong tuh pham ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch 'nâu pă đei tơpŭ kơ iĕm.

English: “When you go out to war against your enemies, and the LORD your God delivers them into your hand, and you take them captive
Bahnar: Mưh layơ iĕm tơblah hăm lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm pơjao lu sư lăm ti iĕm păng iĕm rôp lu sư pơm bơnă

English: and you see among the captives a beautiful woman, and desire her and would take her for your wife
Bahnar: tơdah lăm lu bơnă đei minh 'nu bơngai adruh 'lơ̆ng păng hưch kơ sư 'maih iŏk sư pơm akăn

English: then you shall bring her home to your house, and she shall shave her head and trim her nails.
Bahnar: athei chông ba sư brŏk tơ hnam iĕm; adruh ei athei yuă sŏk, kăt tơngiơh ti sư.

English: She shall put off the clothes of her captivity, remain in your house, and mourn her father and her mother a full month; after that you may go in to her and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.
Bahnar: Sư gô plôh lê̆ ao bơnă, na oei lăm hnam iĕm nhơ̆m kơ mĕ 'bă sư lăm minh khei. Đơ̆ng noh iĕm gô năm oei kơ sư, pơm klo sư păng sư gô pơm akăn iĕm.

English: And it shall be, if you have no delight in her, then you shall set her free, but you certainly shall not sell her for money; you shall not treat her brutally, because you have humbled her.
Bahnar: Tơdah năr đơ̆ng rŏng ưh pă wă kơ sư dơ̆ng, sư 'maih wă năm tơ yơ, na athei ăn kơ sư năm mơ̆ng kơ sư wă, yua kơ iĕm hlôi iŏk sư pơm akăn, ưh kơ gơh tĕch păng pơm kơ sư thoi đĭch.

English: “If a man has two wives, one loved and the other unloved, and they have borne him children, both the loved and the unloved, and if the firstborn son is of her who is unloved
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo đei 'bar 'nu akăn, akăn 'nâu sư 'mêm, akăn noh sư areh, mă-lei 'bar 'nu noh đei kon ngăl, na kon kơdră drŏ-nglo gah akăn mă sư areh noh, iŏk jô̆ kon kơdră

English: then it shall be, on the day he bequeaths his possessions to his sons, that he must not bestow firstborn status on the son of the loved wife in preference to the son of the unloved, the true firstborn.
Bahnar: Dah sư klah asong mŭk tơmam ăn kơ lu kon sư lei ưh kơ gơh pơjao ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo kơdră mă sư 'mêm tơplih kơ kon drŏ-nglo akăn mă sư areh ôh, yua kơ sư noh trŏ kơ kon drŏ-nglo mă kơdră.

English: But he shall acknowledge the son of the unloved wife as the firstborn by giving him a double portion of all that he has, for he is the beginning of his strength; the right of the firstborn is his.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh athei iŏk kon drŏ-nglo akăn mă sư areh noh pơm kon kơdră, klah asong 'bar gah dôm tơmam sư đei hloh kơ lu kon nai. Kon kơdră drŏ-nglo noh đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m pran 'bă, na jing kon kơdră noh sư boih.

English: “If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who will not obey the voice of his father or the voice of his mother, and who, when they have chastened him, will not heed them
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu đei minh 'nu kon anat kơ bơtho păng kơchu, ưh kơ mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r mĕ 'bă, mă khan bơtho pơjĭ ră, sư oei kơchu ưh kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r

English: then his father and his mother shall take hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his city, to the gate of his city.
Bahnar: na mĕ 'bă athei rôp dui chông ba sư truh tơ lu kră pơlei, tơ anih 'măng jang pơlei.

English: And they shall say to the elders of his city, ‘This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he will not obey our voice; he is a glutton and a drunkard.’
Bahnar: Mĕ 'bă gô roi ăn kơ lu kră pơlei khan: 'Nâu kon lu nhôn kơchu păng arăng kơ̆l dêh, ưh kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu nhôn, bơtho khan, jing bơngai thông kư̆ kă, chă et suai ling-lang.

English: Then all the men of his city shall stone him to death with stones; so you shall put away the evil from among you, and all Israel shall hear and fear.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đĭ-đăng, lu drŏ-nglo lăm pơlei klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo; iĕm pơm rơgoh tơdrong kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael gô kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh na hli tơrơ.

English: “If a man has committed a sin deserving of death, and he is put to death, and you hang him on a tree
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai bu pơm yoch tih trŏ kơ lôch, na đe pơlôch sư hloi păng hrek atol sư tơ 'long gơ̆ng

English: his body shall not remain overnight on the tree, but you shall surely bury him that day, so that you do not defile the land which the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance; for he who is hanged is accursed of God.
Bahnar: atâu sư 'nĕ kơ lê̆ kơpal gơ̆ng 'long noh truh minh măng, athei 'bŭ lăm năr noh hloi, yua bơngai đe hrek atol noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hiap pơtê̆ boih, na iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ teh đak iĕm mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm jang sa.

English: “You shall not see your brother’s ox or his sheep going astray, and hide yourself from them; you shall certainly bring them back to your brother.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm 'bôh rơmo dah triu lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n jrok, 'nĕ kơ lăng đĕch athei dui ba puh sư brŏk ăn kơ 'nhŏng oh iĕm.

English: And if your brother is not near you, or if you do not know him, then you shall bring it to your own house, and it shall remain with you until your brother seeks it; then you shall restore it to him.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơ'ngla sư ưh kơ oei jê̆ iĕm păng dah iĕm ưh kơ băt kơ bơngai noh, na athei dui rơmo, triu noh tơmơ̆t tơ hnam iĕm, dĭng truh tơ lu 'nhŏng oh năm chă apinh, na pơdrâu tơwih ăn kơ tơ'ngla sư dơ̆ng.

English: You shall do the same with his donkey, and so shall you do with his garment; with any lost thing of your brother’s, which he has lost and you have found, you shall do likewise; you must not hide yourself.
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m athei pơm thoi noh dah 'bôh aseh iĕ, ao tai dah tơmam kiơ đe huŏng hiong, dah jrok wơ̆l mă iĕm đei 'bôh. 'Nĕ kơ sơngah, pơm khan ưh kơ 'bôh.

English: “You shall not see your brother’s donkey or his ox fall down along the road, and hide yourself from them; you shall surely help him lift them up again.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm 'bôh aseh iĕ dah rơmo lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n puh pơ̆k tơ rok trong, 'nĕ khan lăng đĕch; athei pơgring tơiung sư.

English: “A woman shall not wear anything that pertains to a man, nor shall a man put on a woman’s garment, for all who do so are an abomination to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn ưh kơ gơh hrŭk hơbĕn ao bơngai drŏ-nglo păng bơngai drŏ-nglo kư̆m ưh kơ gơh hrŭk hơbĕn ao drŏ-kăn; yua, kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm lăng areh krưp dêh.

English: “If a bird’s nest happens to be before you along the way, in any tree or on the ground, with young ones or eggs, with the mother sitting on the young or on the eggs, you shall not take the mother with the young
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm 'bôh tơ rok trong dah tơ kơpal 'long dah tơ teh, đei tơpu sem, yŏng sư oei 'nơ̆m kon dah kơtăp, 'nĕ kơ rôp yŏng hăm kon sư.

English: you shall surely let the mother go, and take the young for yourself, that it may be well with you and that you may prolong your days.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei achăng lê̆ yŏng sư păr, na rôp iŏk kon sư, wă kơ iĕm gơh đei pŭn hiôk păng arih sot.

English: “When you build a new house, then you shall make a parapet for your roof, that you may not bring guilt of bloodshed on your household if anyone falls from it.
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm pơm hnam 'nao, athei pơm 'long pĕng găn tăp dăr kơ bơbŭng, kơnh hli kơ đei bơngai huŏng đơ̆ng bơbŭng hnam noh, bơ̆n huay pă pŭ kơting, đơ̆ng hnam 'nao noh.

English: “You shall not sow your vineyard with different kinds of seed, lest the yield of the seed which you have sown and the fruit of your vineyard be defiled.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơtăm lăm pơgar hơmu iĕm 'long nai, iĕm athei pơyơ̆r đĭ dôm lu tơmam iĕm đei yua lăm pơgar, plei hơmu dah tơmam đơ̆ng 'long nai.

English: “You shall not plow with an ox and a donkey together.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ tah 'long ăt hơdai rơmo hăm aseh iĕ, mưh iĕm wă rơuơ.

English: “You shall not wear a garment of different sorts, such as wool and linen mixed together.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hrŭk hơbĕn ao đe tanh che hrâu sŏk triu păng lơ brai phara.

English: “You shall make tassels on the four corners of the clothing with which you cover yourself.
Bahnar: Ih athei sĭt reng lem 'bơ̆t puăn pah mum ao tai iĕm hrŭk.

English: “If any man takes a wife, and goes in to her, and detests her
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo iŏk akăn, 'bĭch hăm sư boih, đơ̆ng rŏng areh hrĕch achăng lê̆

English: and charges her with shameful conduct, and brings a bad name on her, and says, ‘I took this woman, and when I came to her I found she was not a virgin,’
Bahnar: na chă roi sa kơnê̆ kơ adruh noh, khan. Inh oei boih kơ adruh noh, wă inh jê̆ sư, inh 'bôh băt kơ sư ưh pă 'lơ̆ng hơnĭl boih.

English: then the father and mother of the young woman shall take and bring out the evidence of the young woman’s virginity to the elders of the city at the gate.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh mĕ 'bă bơngai adruh noh gô roi pơdah tơbăt gah adruh noh oei hơlai 'lơ̆ng, 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei.

English: And the young woman’s father shall say to the elders, ‘I gave my daughter to this man as wife, and he detests her.
Bahnar: 'Bă bơngai drŏ-kăn ei gô roi kơ lu kră pơlei: “Inh ăn kon adruh inh oei kơ bơngai 'nâu pơm akăn sư, mă-lei sư areh hrĕch achăng kon inh

English: Now he has charged her with shameful conduct, saying, “I found your daughter was not a virgin,” and yet these are the evidences of my daughter’s virginity.’ And they shall spread the cloth before the elders of the city.
Bahnar: bơngai âu chă roi khan kơnê̆ kơ sư: ‘Inh ưh kơ 'bôh khan kon ih oei 'lơ̆ng hơnĭl.’ 'Nâu tơdrong wă kơ băt kơnăl kơ kon adruh inh oei 'lơ̆ng hơnĭl.” Na mĕ 'bă sư iŏk ao tai adruh ei lơ̆k bơyar 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră pơlei ei.

English: Then the elders of that city shall take that man and punish him
Bahnar: Lu kră pơlei noh gô rôp bơngai drŏ-nglo noh, teh bơtho pơjĭ sư.

English: and they shall fine him one hundred shekels of silver and give them to the father of the young woman, because he has brought a bad name on a virgin of Israel. And she shall be his wife; he cannot divorce her all his days.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô đô̆ bơngai drŏ-nglo noh minh kĭ hu.a Ăn kơ 'bă bơngai adruh noh, yua kơ bơngai drŏ-nglo noh pơ'brơh anăn adruh jing kơnê̆ kơ minh 'nu adruh hơlai bơngai Isơrael. Bơngai drŏ-kăn noh oei jing akăn sư; sư ưh pă gơh achăng boih kơplah sư oei arih.

English: “But if the thing is true, and evidences of virginity are not found for the young woman
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah tơdrong drŏ-nglo khan noh trŏ tơpă, bơngai adruh noh ưh pă 'lơ̆ng hơnĭl bơih.

English: then they shall bring out the young woman to the door of her father’s house, and the men of her city shall stone her to death with stones, because she has done a disgraceful thing in Israel, to play the harlot in her father’s house. So you shall put away the evil from among you.
Bahnar: Lei lu kră pơlei athei chông ba drŏ-kăn noh truh 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam 'bă sư, kon pơlei gô klơ̆m pơlôch drŏ-kăn noh hăm tơmo, yua kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn noh đei pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lăm Isơrael. Pơm pơyô ngôi kư̆ kă adrol kơ chă klo, kơplah sư oei lăm hnam 'bă sư. Thoi noh. Lu iĕm gô pơm rơgoh hŭt lê̆ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm.

English: “If a man is found lying with a woman married to a husband, then both of them shall die—the man that lay with the woman, and the woman; so you shall put away the evil from Israel.
Bahnar: Tơdah đe rôp minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo 'bĭch hơdai hăm akăn bơngai nai, đĭ măr sư noh đe gô pơlôch; thoi noh lu iĕm gô pơm rơgoh hŭt lê̆ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm Isơrael.

English: “If a young woman who is a virgin is betrothed to a husband, and a man finds her in the city and lies with her
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu adruh hơlai hle hlôi hơkơ̆t boih na 'bĭch hơdai hăm sư.

English: then you shall bring them both out to the gate of that city, and you shall stone them to death with stones, the young woman because she did not cry out in the city, and the man because he humbled his neighbor’s wife; so you shall put away the evil from among you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei chông ba đĭ 'bar 'nu bơngai noh lĕch năm 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei, na iŏk tơmo klơ̆m pơlôch măr sư; bơngai drŏ-kăn glăi yua kơ ưh kơ đei ôr krao lăm pơlei dŏng sư, bơngai drŏ-nglo glăi yua kơ pơm yoch hăm akăn bơngai nai; iĕm gô pơm rơgoh hŭt lê̆ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm lu kon pơlei iĕm.

English: “But if a man finds a betrothed young woman in the countryside, and the man forces her and lies with her, then only the man who lay with her shall die.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah bơngai drŏ-nglo tơ'bơ̆p bơngai drŏ-kăn hơkơ̆t hăm đe boih, na tơrôp 'bĭch hơdai tơ lăm bri, na minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo đĕch đe pơlôch.

English: But you shall do nothing to the young woman; there is in the young woman no sin deserving of death, for just as when a man rises against his neighbor and kills him, even so is this matter.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm kiơ kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn adruh noh; yua kơ sư ưh kơ đei pơm yoch kiơ trŏ kơ lôch. Tơdrong pơm 'nâu nhen thoi minh 'nu bơngai bruh pơlôch lu bơngai rông 'bôt sư

English: For he found her in the countryside, and the betrothed young woman cried out, but there was no one to save her.
Bahnar: yua kơ bơngai drŏ-nglo tơ'bơ̆p bơngai drŏ-kăn hlôi hơkơ̆t hăm đe tơ bri mă drŏ-kăn ei ôr krao, kư̆m ưh kơ đei bơngai bu dŏng.

English: “If a man finds a young woman who is a virgin, who is not betrothed, and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are found out
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn oei adruh hơlai tam mă hơkơ̆t hăm đe, na tơrôp adruh ei 'bĭch hơdai, na đe tơ'bơ̆p 'bôh hloi kơtă ei

English: then the man who lay with her shall give to the young woman’s father fifty shekels of silver, and she shall be his wife because he has humbled her; he shall not be permitted to divorce her all his days.
Bahnar: bơngai drŏ-nglo noh athei ăn kơ 'bă bơngai drŏ-kăn noh tơdrâu-hrĕng gram hu, đơ̆ng noh na gô iŏk drŏ-kăn ei pơm akăn sư, yua kơ sư pơ'brơh kơ drŏ-kăn noh, sư oei arih sot dang yơ, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh tơbrŏk hrĕch achăng bơngai drŏ-kăn noh.

English: “A man shall not take his father’s wife, nor uncover his father’s bed.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bơngai bu gơh iŏk oei đêl akăn kơnhŏng 'bă sư pơm pơ'brơh kơ 'bă sư.

English: “He who is emasculated by crushing or mutilation shall not enter the assembly of the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-nglo krĕo, kăt trong hơyô dah pơchah bŏng ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t lăm khŭl kon pơlei Kră Yang ôh.

English: “One of illegitimate birth shall not enter the assembly of the LORD; even to the tenth generation none of his descendants shall enter the assembly of the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă mĕ sư pơm kư̆ kă pŭ kon pôm ưh kơ gơh ăn mơ̆t tơ lăm khŭl kon bơngai Kră Yang ôh, mă khan truh tơ kon sâu mơjĭt jơhnơr kư̆m ưh kơ gơh ăn mơ̆t.

English: “An Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter the assembly of the LORD; even to the tenth generation none of his descendants shall enter the assembly of the LORD forever
Bahnar: Bơngai Ammôn kư̆m thoi bơngai Môap kư̆m ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t lăm khŭl kon pơlei Kră Yang, mă khan truh tơ kon sâu mơjĭt jơhnơr kư̆m ưh kơ gơh ôh.

English: because they did not meet you with bread and water on the road when you came out of Egypt, and because they hired against you Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse you.
Bahnar: Yua kơ kơplah lu iĕm lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, lu sư ưh kơ năm ba 'bĕng tơmam sa păng đak nhă sơng iŏk lu iĕm mă rai krao apah Balaam kon drŏ-nglo Bêôr oei tơ pơlei Pêthôr char Aram Naharaim, a năm hiap lu iĕm.

English: Nevertheless the LORD your God would not listen to Balaam, but the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the LORD your God loves you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng Balaam, na tơplih lê̆ tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ jing tơdrong sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ lu iĕm, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm 'mêm mơnat kơ lu iĕm.

English: You shall not seek their peace nor their prosperity all your days forever.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ layơ pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm 'bar khŭl adrĕch 'nâu.

English: “You shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, because you were an alien in his land.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hil areh kơ bơngai Eđôm yua kơ lu sư 'nhŏng oh iĕm, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ areh kơ bơngai Êyiptơ, yua kơ lu iĕm đêl oei lăm dêh char sư.

English: The children of the third generation born to them may enter the assembly of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kon sâu lu sư jơhnơr mă pêng ăn gơh mơ̆t lăm khŭl kon pơlei Kră Yang.

English: “When the army goes out against your enemies, then keep yourself from every wicked thing.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm năm tơblah hăm lu bơngai ayăt kơ iĕm, athei kơchăng kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: If there is any man among you who becomes unclean by some occurrence in the night, then he shall go outside the camp; he shall not come inside the camp.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo bu lăm lu iĕm đei đak lĕch kơmăng, athei tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng lăm kơđông, sư ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t lăm kơđông linh dơ̆ng.

English: But it shall be, when evening comes, that he shall wash with water; and when the sun sets, he may come into the camp.
Bahnar: Truh 'năr kơsơ̆ bơngai noh athei hum lăm đak mưh 'năr mơ̆t boih gơh mơ̆t lăm kơđông linh dơ̆ng.

English: “Also you shall have a place outside the camp, where you may go out
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei đei minh anih tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông linh noh anih chă bơyơ̆ng.

English: and you shall have an implement among your equipment, and when you sit down outside, you shall dig with it and turn and cover your refuse.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu athei đei minh pơm 'long hăm tơmam hơmăt akâu tơdah wă năm tơ 'nguaih chă bơyơ̆ng athei iŏk 'long 'nâu na sir đang kơ chă bơyơ̆ng, athei 'bŭ lê̆.

English: For the LORD your God walks in the midst of your camp, to deliver you and give your enemies over to you; therefore your camp shall be holy, that He may see no unclean thing among you, and turn away from you.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm năm lăng kơđông linh iĕm wă dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăt iĕm, kơđông iĕm athei rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, wă kơ Sư huay kơ 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, na mah weh achăng lê̆ lu iĕm.

English: “You shall not give back to his master the slave who has escaped from his master to you.
Bahnar: Tơdah đĭch kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng yŏng tơ'ngla sư truh tơ hnam iĕm, 'nĕ kơ năm ba pơdrâu ăn kơ yŏng sư dơ̆ng

English: He may dwell with you in your midst, in the place which he chooses within one of your gates, where it seems best to him; you shall not oppress him.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'noh gơh oei hơdai hăm iĕm tơ lăm anih ayơ mă bơngai 'noh rơih, lăm minh pôm pơlei ayơ bơngai 'noh sư 'maih oei; iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơjuă pơđep bơngai 'noh.

English: “There shall be no ritual harlot of the daughters of Israel, or a perverted one of the sons of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm lu kon drŏ-kăn dah drŏ-nglo bơngai Isơrael; 'nĕ kơ đei bơngai bu pơm pơyô kư̆ kă tơ anih rup yang.

English: You shall not bring the wages of a harlot or the price of a dog to the house of the LORD your God for any vowed offering, for both of these are an abomination to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ iŏk jên đơ̆ng mơdro akâu mă đơ̆ng drŏ-kăn dah drŏ-nglob chĕp ba tơmơ̆t lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, pơsĭt đêl nơ̆r pơkă yua kơ 'bar tơdrong noh krưp dêh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm areh lăng krưp dêh.

English: “You shall not charge interest to your brother—interest on money or food or anything that is lent out at interest.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ iŏk jên kiĕng đơ̆ng lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm tŏk iŏk tơmam sa, dah jên kăk dah tơmam kiơ nai.

English: To a foreigner you may charge interest, but to your brother you shall not charge interest, that the LORD your God may bless you in all to which you set your hand in the land which you are entering to possess.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơh iŏk kiĕng đơ̆ng lu bơngai 'nguaih, mă-lei 'nĕ kơ iŏk kiĕng đơ̆ng lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm kơdih, Isơrael, lei na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm lăm dôm tơdrong iĕm jang sa lăm dêh mă iĕm wă mơ̆t iŏk.

English: “When you make a vow to the LORD your God, you shall not delay to pay it; for the LORD your God will surely require it of you, and it would be sin to you.
Bahnar: Mưh lu iĕm pơkă pơkăm hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, 'nĕ kơ pơhiơ̆ gô đunh, athei pơm pơkeh hloi, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm athei iĕm pơm pơkeh tơdrong iĕm pơkă pơkăm ei; dah iĕm ưh kơ pơm pơkeh hloi, lei iĕm gô pŭ tơdrong yoch.

English: But if you abstain from vowing, it shall not be sin to you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah iĕm ĕnh ưh kơ pơkă pơkăm, lei iĕm huay kơ pŭ yoch ôh.

English: That which has gone from your lips you shall keep and perform, for you voluntarily vowed to the LORD your God what you have promised with your mouth.
Bahnar: Mưh 'bơ̆r iĕm hlôi pơkă pơkăm boih hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, na iĕm athei pơm pơkeh đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r iĕm pơma noh.

English: “When you come into your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat your fill of grapes at your pleasure, but you shall not put any in your container.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm mơ̆t lăm pơgar hơmu lu bôl buăl iĕm, na gơh phĕ sa plei hơmu, kiơ̆ kơ hơlŏng iĕm sa hrăp, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh phĕ tah ba lăm kơdŭng iĕm.

English: When you come into your neighbor’s standing grain, you may pluck the heads with your hand, but you shall not use a sickle on your neighbor’s standing grain.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm mơ̆t lăm chŭn mir 'ba mi lu bôl buăl iĕm, na ti lu iĕm gơh broch 'ba; mă-lei 'nĕ kơ iŏk săng kô yuă 'ba.

English: “When a man takes a wife and marries her, and it happens that she finds no favor in his eyes because he has found some uncleanness in her, and he writes her a certificate of divorce, puts it in her hand, and sends her out of his house
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo iŏk akăn, mă-lei bơngai drŏ-nglo noh ưh kơ lăp đon, yua kơ đơ̆ng sư 'bôh bơngai drŏ-kăn noh đei tơdrong kơnê̆, na sư gơh chih minh hlak hla bơar hrĕch, ăn tơ tơpang ti drŏ-kăn, puh tơbrŏk lê̆ sư đơ̆ng hnam sư, na sư weh lĕch đơ̆ng hnam sư

English: when she has departed from his house, and goes and becomes another man’s wife
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư lĕch đơ̆ng hnam, klo so sư, oei kơ klo nai dơ̆ng

English: if the latter husband detests her and writes her a certificate of divorce, puts it in her hand, and sends her out of his house, or if the latter husband dies who took her as his wife
Bahnar: tơdah bơngai klo mă 'bar kuă dơ̆ng kơ sư, chih minh hlak hla bơar hrĕch ăn tơ tơpang ti sư păng puh tơbrŏk sư đơ̆ng hnam, dah bơngai klo mă 'bar âu lôch.

English: then her former husband who divorced her must not take her back to be his wife after she has been defiled; for that is an abomination before the LORD, and you shall not bring sin on the land which the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
Bahnar: Lei bơngai klo mă adrol hlôi puh tơbrŏk sư boih, ưh kơ gơh iŏk sư pơm akăn dơ̆ng, yua kơ sư 'mê̆-'mach boih. Noh jơ̆ minh tơdrong pơm krưp dêh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; iĕm 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba yoch tơ dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ iĕm teh bơ̆jang sa.

English: “When a man has taken a new wife, he shall not go out to war or be charged with any business; he shall be free at home one year, and bring happiness to his wife whom he has taken.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo 'nao iŏk akăn, huay pă năm tơblah păng kư̆m huay kơ năm bơ̆jang; bơngai noh gơh oei jang sa lăm hnam sư kơtĕch minh sơnăm, hiôk chơt hăm akăn sư.

English: “No man shall take the lower or the upper millstone in pledge, for he takes one’s living in pledge.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ chĕp pơkơ̆ng tơpăl tơmo păng hơnơ̆l kơpơ̆ng dah ala pơm tơmam pơdơ̆ng pơkă; yua kơ noh thoi chĕp pơkơ̆ng tơdrong arih sa bơngai nai.

English: “If a man is found kidnapping any of his brethren of the children of Israel, and mistreats him or sells him, then that kidnapper shall die; and you shall put away the evil from among you.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai bu rôp tơtông iŏk lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm bơngai Isơrael păng rôp pơm đĭch, dah rôp tĕch, lei bơngai tơtông noh athei pơlôch. Lu iĕm athei hơpuih pơgoh lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm.

English: “Take heed in an outbreak of leprosy, that you carefully observe and do according to all that the priests, the Levites, shall teach you; just as I commanded them, so you shall be careful to do.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong jĭ chin kren, athei kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ mă tơpă dôm tơdrong mă 'bok soi bơtho adrĕch Lêwi pơkă boih lu iĕm athei kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ thoi inh đei bơtho pơkă boih hăm 'bok soi.

English: Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the way when you came out of Egypt!
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk kơ tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, pơm boih kơ Miriam rok trong, kơplah lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: “When you lend your brother anything, you shall not go into his house to get his pledge.
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm asong ăn kơ rông 'bôt iĕm tŏk iŏk mă tơmam kiơ, iĕm 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t lăm hnam iŏk tơmam wă pơkơ̆ng.

English: You shall stand outside, and the man to whom you lend shall bring the pledge out to you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei dơ̆ng tơ 'nguaih, lê̆ bơngai noh chĕp ba tơmam pơkơ̆ng noh.

English: And if the man is poor, you shall not keep his pledge overnight.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai noh dơnuh hin, 'nĕ kơ wei tơmam pơkơ̆ng noh truh kơmăng wă tep

English: You shall in any case return the pledge to him again when the sun goes down, that he may sleep in his own garment and bless you; and it shall be righteousness to you before the LORD your God.
Bahnar: tơdah pơkơ̆ng ao tai athei pơdrâu ăn kơ bơngai noh adrol kơ măt 'năr mơ̆t, wă kơ sư tep đei ao sư hrŭk tep, lei na sư bơnê kơ iĕm, jô̆ iĕm bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: “You shall not oppress a hired servant who is poor and needy, whether one of your brethren or one of the aliens who is in your land within your gates.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm kơ lu bơngai dơnuh păng bơngai hoh kơ đei, mă khan 'nhŏng oh iĕm bơngai Isơrael dah bơngai tơmoi chă oei lăm pơlei iĕm.

English: Each day you shall give him his wages, and not let the sun go down on it, for he is poor and has set his heart on it; lest he cry out against you to the LORD, and it be sin to you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei apah ăn kơ bơngai noh lăm năr sư jang hloi adrol kơ 'năr mơ̆t; yua kơ bơngai dơnuh noh sư chang kơ tơmam apah noh, kơnh hli kơ bơngai noh krao ôr truh tơ Kră Yang na lu iĕm gô pŭ yoch.

English: “Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor shall children be put to death for their fathers; a person shall be put to death for his own sin.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơlôch 'bă yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch kon, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pơlôch lu kon yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch 'bă, bơngai bu pơm yoch na pơlôch bơngai noh.

English: “You shall not pervert justice due the stranger or the fatherless, nor take a widow’s garment as a pledge.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm ưh kơ tơpăt hơnơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai tơmoi dah lu bơngai mơti; kư̆m 'nĕ kơ iŏk ao tai lu yă adro pơm tơmam pơkơ̆ng.

English: But you shall remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you from there; therefore I command you to do this thing.
Bahnar: Athei 'blŏk kơ lu iĕm đêl hlôi pơm đĭch tơ dêh Êyiptơ păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm dŏng pơklaih iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng anih noh. Noh na inh bơtho pơkă tơtă ăn kơ lu iĕm.

English: “When you reap your harvest in your field, and forget a sheaf in the field, you shall not go back to get it; it shall be for the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm yuă 'ba tơ mir chŭn, na hiơt minh hơchô̆ 'ba oei tơ noh, 'nĕ pă năm wơ̆t iŏk dơ̆ng hơchô̆ 'ba noh lê̆ kơ lu bơngai tơmoi, lu bơngai mơti păng lu yă adro, wă kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm lăm dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng iĕm pơm.

English: When you beat your olive trees, you shall not go over the boughs again; it shall be for the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm preh plei 'long ôliwơ, 'nĕ kơ preh 'bar wơ̆t hơlơ̆k, noh lê̆ kơ lu bơngai tơmoi, lu bơngai mơti păng lu yă adro.

English: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you shall not glean it afterward; it shall be for the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm phĕ plei hơmu, 'nĕ kơ chă phĕ hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng lu plei oei đei, noh lê̆ kơ lu bơngai tơmoi, lu bơngai mơti păng lu yă adro.

English: And you shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; therefore I command you to do this thing.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk kơ iĕm kư̆m đêl pơm đĭch lăm dêh Êyiptơ; yua kơ thoi ei na inh bơtho pơkă tơtă kơ iĕm.

English: “If there is a dispute between men, and they come to court, that the judges may judge them, and they justify the righteous and condemn the wicked
Bahnar: Tơdah đei tơdrong pơjah băl, 'bar pah athei năm apinh truh tơ anih sek tơlang, lu kră sek tơlang, sek tơpăt kơ bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng sek phak lu bơngai mă đei yoch noh.

English: then it shall be, if the wicked man deserves to be beaten, that the judge will cause him to lie down and be beaten in his presence, according to his guilt, with a certain number of blows.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai pơm yoch trŏ kơ teh tôn, kră sek tơlang athei bơngai noh 'bĭch kơmŭ brum tơ teh, teh tôn bơngai noh 'bơ̆t anăp sư hơdôm wơ̆t kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong yoch bơngai noh pơm

English: Forty blows he may give him and no more, lest he should exceed this and beat him with many blows above these, and your brother be humiliated in your sight.
Bahnar: mă loi 'nĕ kơ tôn teh truh tơ puăn-jĭt wơ̆t, dah teh hloh kơ noh, mă khan trŏ kơ teh hloh kơ noh, kơnh pơm kơ sư mơlâu dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm khan kơ ih pơm pơgră hnang.

English: “You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ trôp 'bơ̆r rơmo kơplah oei juă hơnong 'ba.

English: “If brothers dwell together, and one of them dies and has no son, the widow of the dead man shall not be married to a stranger outside the family; her husband’s brother shall go in to her, take her as his wife, and perform the duty of a husband’s brother to her.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'nhŏng oh pôm mĕ 'bă oei hơdai, đei minh 'nu lôch tam mă đei kon, na akăn bơngai mă lôch noh 'nĕ kơ iŏk klo bơngai nai; 'nhŏng oh gah klo sư athei năm truh tơ sư, iŏk sư pơm akăn, đơ̆ng noh pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong juăt 'nhŏng oh klo sư păng duch adro.

English: And it shall be that the firstborn son which she bears will succeed to the name of his dead brother, that his name may not be blotted out of Israel.
Bahnar: Kon kơdră drŏ-nglo mă đei tơpŭ noh athei krao anăn bơngai lôch noh, wă kơ anăn bơngai lôch noh huay kơ hiong đơ̆ng adrĕch Isơrael.

English: But if the man does not want to take his brother’s wife, then let his brother’s wife go up to the gate to the elders, and say, ‘My husband’s brother refuses to raise up a name to his brother in Israel; he will not perform the duty of my husband’s brother.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei, tơdah 'nhŏng oh bơngai 'noh ưh kơ lăp đon iŏk duch adro noh, sư athei năm tơ 'măng jang, na roi: Lu 'nhŏng oh klo inh ưh kơ wă pơtrơp adrĕch 'nhŏng lu sư lăm adrĕch Isơrael; păng ưh kơ wă iŏk oei kơ inh pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'nhŏng oh klo.

English: Then the elders of his city shall call him and speak to him. But if he stands firm and says, ‘I do not want to take her,’
Bahnar: Lu kră pơlei ei gô krao bơngai noh păng pơma dơnuh kơ sư hăm bơngai noh; tơdah bơngai noh oei pơma khan: Inh ưh kơ wă iŏk sư pơm akăn.

English: then his brother’s wife shall come to him in the presence of the elders, remove his sandal from his foot, spit in his face, and answer and say, ‘So shall it be done to the man who will not build up his brother’s house.’
Bahnar: Thoi noh drŏ-kăn adro, mi dah oh sư 'noh năm jê̆, 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră, plôh lê̆ chơkhŏ wăn đơ̆ng jơ̆ng bơngai drŏ-nglo noh, gơsoh đak hai tơ muh măt, đơ̆ng noh pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă pơdơ̆ng dơ̆ng đơ̆ng hnam dơnŏ 'nhŏng oh sư kơdih gô pơm ăn thoi noh!

English: And his name shall be called in Israel, ‘The house of him who had his sandal removed.’
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lăm bơngai Isơrael gô krao kơ hnam dơnŏ bơngai noh hnam dơnŏ bơngai đe plôh lê̆ chơkhŏ wăn.

English: “If two men fight together, and the wife of one draws near to rescue her husband from the hand of the one attacking him, and puts out her hand and seizes him by the genitals
Bahnar: Kơplah 'bar 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo tơteh băl, tơdah akăn minh 'nu lăm 'bar 'nu noh truh wă dŏng klo sư, na ti sư rôp 'bơm 'bơ̆t anih hlơp bơngai ei.

English: then you shall cut off her hand; your eye shall not pity her.
Bahnar: Na iĕm ih athei chơ̆ng lê̆ ti bơngai drŏ-kăn noh; 'nĕ mơnat kơ sư.

English: “You shall not have in your bag differing weights, a heavy and a light.
Bahnar: Lăm 'bi ih 'nĕ kơ đei 'bar tŏ plei 'long kŏng, minh pah trăp trŏ, minh pah phiơl hơlĕch ĕnh.

English: You shall not have in your house differing measures, a large and a small.
Bahnar: Lăm hnam lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ đei 'bar tŏ 'long kŏng minh hơlĕnh minh tơpăt.

English: You shall have a perfect and just weight, a perfect and just measure, that your days may be lengthened in the land which the LORD your God is giving you.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei đei 'long kŏng trŏ păng tơpăt, wă kơ lu iĕm gơh arih sot soi jơnoi đunh tơ kơpal teh lăm dêh char Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ iĕm.

English: For all who do such things, all who behave unrighteously, are an abomination to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm areh krưp dêh kơ bơngai bu pơm dôm tơdrong ưh kơ trŏ 'nâu.

English: “Remember what Amalek did to you on the way as you were coming out of Egypt
Bahnar: Ih athei 'blŏk dôm tơdrong bơngai Amalek pơm ăn kơ lu iĕm tơ rok trong, kơplah lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ

English: how he met you on the way and attacked your rear ranks, all the stragglers at your rear, when you were tired and weary; and he did not fear God.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na druh blah pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai yak đơ̆ng rŏng, kơplah iĕm rok trong, 'bơ̆t lu iĕm oei lap gleh rơmơ̆n rơmok.

English: Therefore it shall be, when the LORD your God has given you rest from your enemies all around, in the land which the LORD your God is giving you to possess as an inheritance, that you will blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven. You shall not forget.
Bahnar: Layơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm ăn tơdrong hiôk hơđơ̆ng pơdơh đơ̆ng lu bơngai dăr wang tăp dăr kơ iĕm lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ lu iĕm iŏk bơ̆jang sa, asong băl athei sŭt lê̆ tơdrong 'blŏk đơ̆ng Amalek đơ̆ng ala teh âu, 'nĕ kơ hiơt hŏ.

English: “And it shall be, when you come into the land which the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you possess it and dwell in it
Bahnar: Mưh lu iĕm mơ̆t lăm dêh char mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ lu iĕm bơ̆jang sa, gơh iŏk asong păng oei tơ noh boih

English: that you shall take some of the first of all the produce of the ground, which you shall bring from your land that the LORD your God is giving you, and put it in a basket and go to the place where the LORD your God chooses to make His name abide.
Bahnar: iĕm athei iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng dôm plei blŭng-a mă đơ̆ng teh, lăm dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ lu iĕm, tah lăm minh pôm bai, năm ba tơ anih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô rơih, wă kơ 'măn anăn Sư tơ noh.

English: And you shall go to the one who is priest in those days, and say to him, ‘I declare today to the LORD your God that I have come to the country which the LORD swore to our fathers to give us.’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei năm tơ 'bok soi mă oei bơ̆jang kơplah noh, na khan kơ sư: Năr 'nâu, inh năm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, wă khan kơ sư: Inh băt kơnăl kơ inh mơ̆t boih lăm dêh mă Kră Yang pơkă hăm 'bok yă wă ăn kơ lu bơ̆n.

English: “Then the priest shall take the basket out of your hand and set it down before the altar of the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Na, 'bok soi gô iŏk bai đơ̆ng ti lu iĕm, dan 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: And you shall answer and say before the LORD your God: ‘My father was a Syrian, about to perish, and he went down to Egypt and dwelt there, few in number; and there he became a nation, great, mighty, and populous.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, lu iĕm roi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm: 'Bă inh bơngai Aram thông mang, kơplah năm jur tơ dêh Êyiptơ oei tơ noh tŏ sĕt bơngai đĕch, mă-lei dang ei jing minh adrĕch adrung tih, pran păng lơ kơdrâ̆m.

English: But the Egyptians mistreated us, afflicted us, and laid hard bondage on us.
Bahnar: Bơngai Êyiptơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu nhôn, rôp lu nhôn pơm đĭch bơ̆jang gleh hrat, lu sư pơmat lu nhôn dêh tơpă.

English: Then we cried out to the LORD God of our fathers, and the LORD heard our voice and looked on our affliction and our labor and our oppression.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, lu nhôn krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok yă lu nhôn, Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng păng 'bôh tơdrong pơmat lu nhôn păng tơdrong đe pơjuă pơđep lu nhôn.

English: So the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm, with great terror and with signs and wonders.
Bahnar: Kră Yang yua tơpang ti mơsêh pran kơtang, Kră Yang pơm mơsêh tih krưp hlĭch chrơp na chông lu nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: He has brought us to this place and has given us this land, “a land flowing with milk and honey”
Bahnar: Chông ba lu nhôn truh tơ âu, ăn kơ lu nhôn dêh char 'nâu, dêh char đak toh păng đak sut.

English: and now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land which you, O LORD, have given me.’ “Then you shall set it before the LORD your God, and worship before the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Dang ei inh chĕp pơyơ̆r dôm lu plei blŭng-a đơ̆ng teh mă Ih ăn kơ inh. Lê̆ plei 'long tơ noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng drap bon kơkuh Sư.

English: So you shall rejoice in every good thing which the LORD your God has given to you and your house, you and the Levite and the stranger who is among you.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh iĕm, bơngai Lêwi păng lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm, hăm hnam dơnŏ lu iĕm gô chơt hiôk gah tơdrong pŭn hiôk mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn boih kơ lu iĕm.

English: “When you have finished laying aside all the tithe of your increase in the third year—the year of tithing—and have given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, so that they may eat within your gates and be filled
Bahnar: Kư̆ rim pêng sơnăm jơ̆ sơnăm pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt lu iĕm 'măn lê̆ pha dôm tơmam iĕm roi, na athei asong ăn kơ bơngai Lêwi, kơ bơngai tơmoi, bơngai mơti păng ăn kơ yă adro, wă kơ lu sư đei tơmam sa phĭ mah.

English: then you shall say before the LORD your God: ‘I have removed the holy tithe from my house, and also have given them to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, according to all Your commandments which You have commanded me; I have not transgressed Your commandments, nor have I forgotten them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh iĕm năm roi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm: Inh iŏk tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đơ̆ng hnam inh, na asong ăn kơ lu bơngai Lêwi, bơngai tơmoi, bơngai mơti păng yă adro, pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Kră Yang tơtă; inh ưh kơ pơm glăi kư̆m ưh kơ hiơt nơ̆r tơtă ayơ đơ̆ng ih athei.

English: I have not eaten any of it when in mourning, nor have I removed any of it for an unclean use, nor given any of it for the dead. I have obeyed the voice of the LORD my God, and have done according to all that You have commanded me.
Bahnar: Lăm năr ơh kơ bơngai lôch, inh ưh kơ sa tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'nâu; kơplah 'mê̆-'mach inh kư̆m ưh kơ hơtŭt 'bơm păng kư̆m ưh kơ yua tơmam âu yua kơ bơngai lôch; inh chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Ih hlôi pơkă khan kơ inh.

English: Look down from Your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the land which You have given us, just as You swore to our fathers, “a land flowing with milk and honey.” ’
Bahnar: Apơi kơ Kră Yang đơ̆ng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih tơ kơpal plĕnh ti, nger lăng păng ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu bơngai Isơrael, Ih hăm teh đak mă Ih ăn boih kơ lu nhôn kư̆m thoi đei pơkă boih hăm 'bok yă lu nhôn sơ̆, wă khan dêh thoi đak toh thoi đak sut 'nâu.

English: “This day the LORD your God commands you to observe these statutes and judgments; therefore you shall be careful to observe them with all your heart and with all your soul.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm athei pơkă khan kơ iĕm pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu, iĕm athei kơchăng wei răk hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak

English: Today you have proclaimed the LORD to be your God, and that you will walk in His ways and keep His statutes, His commandments, and His judgments, and that you will obey His voice.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu iĕm pơkă drơ̆ng iŏk Kră Yang pơm 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, yak năm kiơ̆ trong Sư, wei răk khôi juăt Sư, nơ̆r tơtă păng nơ̆r đơ̆ng Sư athei, kư̆m chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r sư khan.

English: Also today the LORD has proclaimed you to be His special people, just as He promised you, that you should keep all His commandments
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu Kră Yang kư̆m pơkă drơ̆ng iŏk iĕm pơm kon pơlei pơla Sư, jing tơmam gĭt Sư thoi Sư đei pơkă hăm iĕm păng iĕm athei wei răk đĭ dôm lu nơ̆r Sư tơtă.

English: and that He will set you high above all nations which He has made, in praise, in name, and in honor, and that you may be a holy people to the LORD your God, just as He has spoken.”
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m khan ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong ư-ang păng tơdrong pơyom hloh kơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung mă Sư đei pơjing păng iĕm jing minh adrĕch 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, kư̆m thoi Sư đei khan boih.

English: Now Moses, with the elders of Israel, commanded the people, saying: “Keep all the commandments which I command you today.
Bahnar: Môis păng lu đe kră bơngai pơgơ̆r bơtho khan Isơrael pơkă nơ̆r 'nâu ăn kơ kon pơlei: Wei răk bĕ dôm nơ̆r inh tơtă ăn kơ iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: And it shall be, on the day when you cross over the Jordan to the land which the LORD your God is giving you, that you shall set up for yourselves large stones, and whitewash them with lime.
Bahnar: Lăm năr iĕm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn wă mơ̆t tơ dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn kơ lu iĕm, na iĕm athei pơdơ̆ng lu tơmo tih păng bah chŭr tơ tơmo noh.

English: You shall write on them all the words of this law, when you have crossed over, that you may enter the land which the LORD your God is giving you, ‘a land flowing with milk and honey,’ just as the LORD God of your fathers promised you.
Bahnar: Na chih dôm nơ̆r khôi juăt 'nâu, mưh iĕm năm hlôi boih kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn mơ̆t tơ dêh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm ăn, mă dêh 'bĕnh kơ đak toh păng đak sut, thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok iĕm pơkă boih hăm iĕm.

English: Therefore it shall be, when you have crossed over the Jordan, that on Mount Ebal you shall set up these stones, which I command you today, and you shall whitewash them with lime.
Bahnar: Dah lu iĕm tŏk hlôi boih kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, athei iĕm pơdơ̆ng tơmo 'nâu tơ kơpal kông Êbal păng bah chŭr, thoi nơ̆r inh bơtho khan ăn kơ lu iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: And there you shall build an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones; you shall not use an iron tool on them.
Bahnar: Tơ anih noh, iĕm kư̆m athei pơm minh pôm chơnang soi ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, chơnang soi păng tơmo; 'nĕ kơ yua tơmam bơsei wă blah tơmo.

English: You shall build with whole stones the altar of the LORD your God, and offer burnt offerings on it to the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pơm chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng tơmo oei 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ tơphĕ, na pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'buh tơ kơpal noh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: You shall offer peace offerings, and shall eat there, and rejoice before the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Kŭm athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi bơnê, sa kơtă hloi tơ anih noh hiôk chơt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: And you shall write very plainly on the stones all the words of this law.”
Bahnar: Iĕm athei chih tơ tơmo đĭ dôm lu nơ̆r khôi juăt 'nâu, chih mă rơđah tơpă.

English: Then Moses and the priests, the Levites, spoke to all Israel, saying, “Take heed and listen, O Israel: This day you have become the people of the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Môis păng lu 'bok soi adrĕch bơngai Lêwi khan kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael: Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael, athei ngăn păng mơ̆ng bĕ! Năr 'nâu, lu iĕm jing kon pơlei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm boih.

English: Therefore you shall obey the voice of the LORD your God, and observe His commandments and His statutes which I command you today.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh iĕm athei mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng wei răk pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu nơ̆r Sư tơtă păng dôm khôi juăt Sư, mă inh bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: And Moses commanded the people on the same day, saying
Bahnar: Năr noh. Môis bơtho khan kơ kon pơlei

English: “These shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people, when you have crossed over the Jordan: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin
Bahnar: Mưh lu iĕm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn boih, lei đe Simêôn, Lêwi, Juđa, Isakar, Jôsep păng Bênjamin athei dơ̆ng kơpal kông Gêrasim, wă sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ kon pơlei.

English: and these shall stand on Mount Ebal to curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
Bahnar: Mă đe Rubên, Gat, Aser, Sabulôn, Đan, Neptali athei dơ̆ng kơpal kông Êbal, wă hiap pơtê̆.

English: “And the Levites shall speak with a loud voice and say to all the men of Israel
Bahnar: Bơngai Lêwi pơma 'bơ̆r re hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael thoi âu

English: ‘Cursed is the one who makes a carved or molded image, an abomination to the LORD, the work of the hands of the craftsman, and sets it up in secret.’ “And all the people shall answer and say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu pơm rup yang, man dah hling, tơmam mă Kră Yang areh krưp dêh, tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti kon bơngai, pơdơ̆ng kơkuh sư noh tơ anih hlơp! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who treats his father or his mother with contempt.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu pơdê mĕ 'bă sư! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who moves his neighbor’s landmark.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu tŭn rĭ hơdral hăm bôl buăl sư! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who makes the blind to wander off the road.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu pơm ăn kơ bơngai măt tol jrok trong! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who perverts the justice due the stranger, the fatherless, and widow.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu sek ưh kơ tơpăt kơ lu bơngai tơmoi, lu bơngai mơti păng lu yă adro! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who lies with his father’s wife, because he has uncovered his father’s bed.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu 'bĭch hơdai hăm akăn kơnhŏng 'bă sư kơdih; bơngai 'noh pơm pơ'brơh kơ 'bă sư kơdih! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who lies with any kind of animal.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu 'bĭch hăm minh pôm kon sem brem! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who lies with his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu 'bĭch hơdai hăm mŏ dah oh sư kơdih, dah minh pôm 'bă, mĕ phara, dah minh pôm mĕ 'bă phara! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who lies with his mother-in-law.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu 'bĭch hơdai hăm tơnei drŏ-kăn sư kơdih! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who attacks his neighbor secretly.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu teh pơlôch ôn kon pơlei sư! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who takes a bribe to slay an innocent person.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu sa tơmam apah wă pơlôch bơngai ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: ‘Cursed is the one who does not confirm all the words of this law by observing them.’ “And all the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
Bahnar: Hiap pơtê̆ bĕ kơ bơngai bu ưh kơ wei răk pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu nơ̆r lăm khôi juăt 'nâu! Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô khan: A-men!

English: “Now it shall come to pass, if you diligently obey the voice of the LORD your God, to observe carefully all His commandments which I command you today, that the LORD your God will set you high above all nations of the earth.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm mă kơjăp, pơ'lơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă, mă inh bơtho khan kơ iĕm năr 'nâu, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô pôk hơtŏk iĕm hloh kơ adrĕch nai mă oei tơ kơpal teh âu.

English: And all these blessings shall come upon you and overtake you, because you obey the voice of the LORD your God
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm mơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, dôm tơdrong pŭn hiôk gô jur tơ iĕm đei hloi.

English: “Blessed shall you be in the city, and blessed shall you be in the country.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn kơ iĕm pŭn hiôk tơ jơ̆p-jang anih, tơ lăm pơlei dah tơ mir chŭn.

English: “Blessed shall be the fruit of your body, the produce of your ground and the increase of your herds, the increase of your cattle and the offspring of your flocks.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu kon sâu iĕm, hơnik anăn lơlang, sem dơrong rơmo triu bơbe chek lar.a

English: “Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm, plei 'long gô 'bĕnh kơ bai păng tơpŭng bơlah 'bĕnh kơthŭng.

English: “Blessed shall you be when you come in, and blessed shall you be when you go out.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn kơ lu iĕm đei pŭn hiôk lăm tôm tơdrong, kơplah iĕm mơ̆t dah lĕch.

English: “The LORD will cause your enemies who rise against you to be defeated before your face; they shall come out against you one way and flee before you seven ways.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn kơ lu iĕm iung blah hăm bơngai ayăt jei iĕm, lu sư yak minh trong năm blah iĕm, mă-lei gô kơdâu ôn lĕch yak tơpơh trong kơdâu ôn 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm.

English: “The LORD will command the blessing on you in your storehouses and in all to which you set your hand, and He will bless you in the land which the LORD your God is giving you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm ăn kơ iĕm pŭn hiôk, tơ lăm pơk 'ba păng tơ lăm lu tơdrong jang iĕm pơm; Sư gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm lăm dêh char mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn.

English: “The LORD will establish you as a holy people to Himself, just as He has sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of the LORD your God and walk in His ways.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm wei răk dôm nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng yak năm kiơ̆ trong Sư, na Kră Yang gô ăn kơ iĕm jing minh adrĕch adrung 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Sư kư̆m thoi Sư pơkă boih kơ iĕm.

English: Then all peoples of the earth shall see that you are called by the name of the LORD, and they shall be afraid of you.
Bahnar: Lu kon bơngai kơpal teh gô 'bôh anăn Kră Yang păng lu sư gô hli kơ iĕm.

English: And the LORD will grant you plenty of goods, in the fruit of your body, in the increase of your livestock, and in the produce of your ground, in the land of which the LORD swore to your fathers to give you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang iĕm gô ăn kơ iĕm đei mŭk tơmam rơkah rơkai, tơ lăm dêh mă Kră Yang hlôi pơkă boih hăm lu 'bok iĕm wă ăn kơ iĕm ăn kơ lu kon sâu iĕm hrôh lơlang lơlap, sem dơrong chek lar păng hơnik nơnăm đơ̆ng teh pơgar iĕm gô đei thim rai lơ.

English: The LORD will open to you His good treasure, the heavens, to give the rain to your land in its season, and to bless all the work of your hand. You shall lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơih anih 'mong tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng plĕnh, ăn đak 'mi jur tơ teh trŏ bơyan păng ăn pŭn hiôk dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti iĕm pơm. Iĕm gô ăn kơ lơ teh đak tŏk iŏk, mă-lei gah iĕm ưh kơ đei tŏk iŏk đơ̆ng bơngai bu.

English: And the LORD will make you the head and not the tail; you shall be above only, and not be beneath, if you heed the commandments of the LORD your God, which I command you today, and are careful to observe them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pôk iĕm jing kơ̆l ưh kơ trŏ kiĕng ôh, tơdah iĕm chu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă năr 'nâu inh bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm, iĕm gô oei adrol tơ kơpal ling-lang, ưh kơ trŏ tuch-luch dah oei tơ kơđeh.

English: So you shall not turn aside from any of the words which I command you this day, to the right or the left, to go after other gods to serve them.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ weh achăng hŭt lê̆ nơ̆r tơtă inh bơtho khan năr 'nâu, 'nĕ kơ weh tơ 'ma dah tơ 'ngiĕo 'nĕ kơ năm bơ̆jang kiơ̆ lu yang nai.

English: “But it shall come to pass, if you do not obey the voice of the LORD your God, to observe carefully all His commandments and His statutes which I command you today, that all these curses will come upon you and overtake you
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah iĕm ưh kơ chu mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, ưh kơ pơ'lơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơtă păng khôi juăt đơ̆ng Sư mă inh bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm năr 'nâu, na 'nâu boih dôm tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ gô truh kơ iĕm, đei hloi

English: “Cursed shall you be in the city, and cursed shall you be in the country.
Bahnar: Đe gô hiap pơtê̆ iĕm mă oei lăm pơlei dah tơ mir chŭn.

English: “Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
Bahnar: Bai păng kơthŭng jrâu tơpŭng iĕm hoh-hoy kơ đei yua kơ đơ̆ng hiap pơtê̆.

English: “Cursed shall be the fruit of your body and the produce of your land, the increase of your cattle and the offspring of your flocks.
Bahnar: Đe gô hiap iĕm ưh kơ đei kon hơ'lơ̆p lăm chŭn mir iĕm ưh kơ đei hơnik hơnam rơmo triu bơbe iĕm ưh kơ tuh kon.

English: “Cursed shall you be when you come in, and cursed shall you be when you go out.
Bahnar: Đe gô hiap pơtê̆ iĕm lăm tôm tơdrong kơplah iĕm lĕch kơplah iĕm mơ̆t

English: “The LORD will send on you cursing, confusion, and rebuke in all that you set your hand to do, until you are destroyed and until you perish quickly, because of the wickedness of your doings in which you have forsaken Me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm kơ iĕm tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong hiap pơtê̆, đei tơdrong răm truh, kơ̆l jrok 'ngok răm ơh blĕk lăm tơdrong jang dĭng iĕm lôch răm đĭ dah iĕm pơm yoch achăng lê̆ Kră Yang.

English: The LORD will make the plague cling to you until He has consumed you from the land which you are going to possess.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn jĭ hơbuh druh kiơ̆ iĕm dĭng Sư pơrăm iĕm lôch hiong đĭ đơ̆ng teh mă iĕm gô mơ̆t iŏk.

English: The LORD will strike you with consumption, with fever, with inflammation, with severe burning fever, with the sword, with scorching, and with mildew; they shall pursue you until you perish.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơrăm iĕm hăm tơdrong jĭ dơsoh hiĕn-hiok, bơlŏ chĕp tơngiĕt, rơka rơkĕch, jĭ bơôr, tŏ, phang-ang, 'long pơlei 'nhĕt 'nhot kro đĭ phơ̆k phok dôm tơdrong noh druh kiơ̆ iĕm dĭng truh tơ iĕm lôch hiong đĭ.

English: And your heavens which are over your head shall be bronze, and the earth which is under you shall be iron.
Bahnar: Lu plĕnh tơ kơpal kơ̆l nhen thoi kong, na teh tơ ala jơ̆ng nhen thoi bơsei.

English: The LORD will change the rain of your land to powder and dust; from the heaven it shall come down on you until you are destroyed.
Bahnar: Tơplih kơ đak 'mi, Kră Yang ăn 'mi lăm char jing 'mui chuơh đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh jruh tơ teh đak dĭng truh pơrăm đĭ lu iĕm lôch.

English: “The LORD will cause you to be defeated before your enemies; you shall go out one way against them and flee seven ways before them; and you shall become troublesome to all the kingdoms of the earth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn lu bơngai ayăt blah pơrăm iĕm jei lu sư; lu iĕm gô năm blah sư minh trong, lĕch kơdâu ôn kơ lu sư tơpơh trong; lu adrĕch adrung kơpal teh 'bôh iĕm gô hli tơrơ.

English: Your carcasses shall be food for all the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth, and no one shall frighten them away.
Bahnar: Akâu lôch lu iĕm gô pơm tơmam sa ăn kơ lu sem păr kơpal plĕnh păng ăn kơ lu sem bri lăm teh sa, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu pơpuh lê̆ lu sư weh.

English: The LORD will strike you with the boils of Egypt, with tumors, with the scab, and with the itch, from which you cannot be healed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn kơ iĕm jĭ pơtôch đuh đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, pơ'ngeh đek, rơka tơlŏng, đơđik, lu iĕm hơmet ưh kơ klaih.

English: The LORD will strike you with madness and blindness and confusion of heart.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn kơ iĕm jing wơnh, măt tol, hiong tơdrong tơchĕng rŭng răng.

English: And you shall grope at noonday, as a blind man gropes in darkness; you shall not prosper in your ways; you shall be only oppressed and plundered continually, and no one shall save you.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'năr dơ̆ng iĕm nơnăm chă hơbơ̆ nhen thoi bơngai măt tol yak lăm măng mu; iĕm bơ̆jang sa ưh kơ pŭn. Rim năr đe gô pơjuă pơđep păng tơgar iŏk, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu dŏng iĕm.

English: “You shall betroth a wife, but another man shall lie with her; you shall build a house, but you shall not dwell in it; you shall plant a vineyard, but shall not gather its grapes.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm hơkơ̆t boih hăm minh 'nu bơngai adruh, mă-lei đei bơngai drŏ-nglo nai oei kơ sư. Iĕm pơm hnam, mă-lei ưh kơ đei oei; iĕm pơtăm minh hlak pơgar hơmu, mă-lei ưh kơ đei phĕ sa plei sư.

English: Your ox shall be slaughtered before your eyes, but you shall not eat of it; your donkey shall be violently taken away from before you, and shall not be restored to you; your sheep shall be given to your enemies, and you shall have no one to rescue them.
Bahnar: Rơmo iĕm đe gô pơlôch 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm; mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ đei sa 'nhĕm sư; aseh iĕ iĕm đe gô rôp tơgar đơ̆ng iĕm, mă-lei ưh kơ đei layơ pơdrâu kơ iĕm dơ̆ng: Triu bơbe đei gô iŏk ăn kơ lu bơngai ayăt, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu rôp pơdrâu.

English: Your sons and your daughters shall be given to another people, and your eyes shall look and fail with longing for them all day long; and there shall be no strength in your hand.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo păng kon drŏ-kăn iĕm đe gô rôp jao ăn kơ lu bơngai tơmoi măt iĕm lăng chang gô năr âu truh tơ năr nai, mă-lei lu iĕm tôch kơ đon ưh pă băt wă pơm kiơ.

English: A nation whom you have not known shall eat the fruit of your land and the produce of your labor, and you shall be only oppressed and crushed continually.
Bahnar: Minh adrĕch adrung mă iĕm tam lah băt gô iŏk sa tơmam đơ̆ng mir chŭn păng đơ̆ng tơdrong jang iĕm gleh hrat; đe gô pơjuă pơđep păng pơjuă bơhlơ̆r iĕm ling-lang rim năr.

English: So you shall be driven mad because of the sight which your eyes see.
Bahnar: Na iĕm jing wơnh yua kơ đêl tơm măt iĕm oei 'bôh.

English: The LORD will strike you in the knees and on the legs with severe boils which cannot be healed, and from the sole of your foot to the top of your head.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn kơ iĕm jĭ pơtôch đuh tơ kŭl-tăng păng tơ 'bar pah jơ̆ng jĭ dêh, hơmet ưh kơ gơh klaih, lanh rai să đơ̆ng kơnơl jơ̆ng truh tơ kơpal kơ̆l.

English: “The LORD will bring you and the king whom you set over you to a nation which neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you shall serve other gods—wood and stone.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô puh iĕm păng pơtao mă iĕm rơih pôk kơdih, truh tơ minh adrĕch adrung mă iĕm hăm 'bok iĕm tam lah băt. Tơ noh iĕm gô kơkuh kơ lu yang nai, pơm păng 'long dah păng tơmo.

English: And you shall become an astonishment, a proverb, and a byword among all nations where the LORD will drive you.
Bahnar: Lăm lu adrĕch adrung mă Kră Yang puh iĕm truh tơ yơ, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei tơ noh hli tơrơ, 'bôh tơdrong pơmat-tat lu iĕm. Lu iĕm jing bơngai pơm kơ đe pơjăm hiĕk ăr.

English: “You shall carry much seed out to the field but gather little in, for the locust shall consume it.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô rei adrĕch lơ tơ lăm mir chŭn, mă-lei kĕch iŏk tŏ sĕt đĕch yua kơ gô đei lep 'ba sa đĭ.

English: You shall plant vineyards and tend them, but you shall neither drink of the wine nor gather the grapes; for the worms shall eat them.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô pơtăm plei 'long hơmu, mă-lei ưh kơ đei phĕ huch đak hơmu, yua kơ hơdrông kơnu gô sa pơrăm đĭ.

English: You shall have olive trees throughout all your territory, but you shall not anoint yourself with the oil; for your olives shall drop off.
Bahnar: Iĕm gô đei tơm 'long ôliwơ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh, mă-lei ưh kơ đei đak rơmă wă pik; yua kơ tơm 'long ôliwơ plei sư hơlŭng đĭ.

English: You shall beget sons and daughters, but they shall not be yours; for they shall go into captivity.
Bahnar: Iĕm gô pơjing kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn, mă-lei ưh kơ đei oei hăm iĕm, yua kơ lu sư noh đe gô rôp pơm đĭch đĭ.

English: Locusts shall consume all your trees and the produce of your land.
Bahnar: Lep tung-nut gô kăp pơrăm đĭ lu tơm 'long 'ba hơ'bo.

English: “The alien who is among you shall rise higher and higher above you, and you shall come down lower and lower.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơmoi oei hơdai iĕm gô rai tŏk pran păng mơdrŏng hloh kơ iĕm rim 'năr, gah lu iĕm, rai 'năr rai rơdu jur ling-lang.

English: He shall lend to you, but you shall not lend to him; he shall be the head, and you shall be the tail.
Bahnar: Lu sư ăn kơ iĕm tŏk iŏk, mă-lei gah iĕm ưh kơ đei ăn kơ bu tŏk iŏk; lu sư gô pơm kơ̆l, gah iĕm jing kiĕng.
