English: “Moreover all these curses shall come upon you and pursue and overtake you, until you are destroyed, because you did not obey the voice of the LORD your God, to keep His commandments and His statutes which He commanded you.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dôm lu tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ 'nâu gô truh tơ iĕm druh tam iĕm, dĭng lu iĕm lôch hiong răm đĭ, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng ưh kơ wei răk dôm lu nơ̆r tơtă păng khôi juăt mă Sư ăn boih kơ iĕm.

English: And they shall be upon you for a sign and a wonder, and on your descendants forever.
Bahnar: Lu tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ 'nâu gô oei đom tơ lăm akâu jăn păng oei tơ lăm adrĕch adrung iĕm nhen thoi tơdra tơ'blŏk trăp, ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: “Because you did not serve the LORD your God with joy and gladness of heart, for the abundance of everything
Bahnar: Kơplah đei mŭk tơmam rơkah rơkai, iĕm ưh tam lăp đon jơhngơ̆m hiôk bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: therefore you shall serve your enemies, whom the LORD will send against you, in hunger, in thirst, in nakedness, and in need of everything; and He will put a yoke of iron on your neck until He has destroyed you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô bơ̆jang kơ lu bơngai ayăt, mă Kră Yang wơh năm blah iĕm. Iĕm gô pơngot rơwĕt hoh-hoy păng kơ'bah kơ'bôch lăm tôm tơdrong, Sư gô tơ'băk 'long ăt bơsei tơ hơko iĕm dĭng truh iĕm lôch răm đĭ.

English: The LORD will bring a nation against you from afar, from the end of the earth, as swift as the eagle flies, a nation whose language you will not understand
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ba minh adrĕch adrung đơ̆ng ataih, đơ̆ng tôch kơ plei teh năm blah lu iĕm, thoi klang păr rôp sa kon sem; iĕm ưh kơ hlôh nơ̆r lu sư pơma ôh.

English: a nation of fierce countenance, which does not respect the elderly nor show favor to the young.
Bahnar: Muh măt lu sư krưp tơpă, ưh kơ lăng lu bơngai kră, kư̆m ưh kơ băt mơnat kơ bơngai 'lơ̆p

English: And they shall eat the increase of your livestock and the produce of your land, until you are destroyed; they shall not leave you grain or new wine or oil, or the increase of your cattle or the offspring of your flocks, until they have destroyed you.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô sa đĭ lu sem dơrong hơnik hơnam plei sa đơ̆ng chŭn mir iĕm dĭng truh tơ lu iĕm răm đĭ; sư ưh kơ lê̆ kiơ mă phe 'ba hơ'bo, sik hơmu, đak rơmă ôliwơ, dah rơmo păng triu ih, dĭng truh iĕm lôch răm đĭ.

English: “They shall besiege you at all your gates until your high and fortified walls, in which you trust, come down throughout all your land; and they shall besiege you at all your gates throughout all your land which the LORD your God has given you.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô wang tăp dăr kơ pơlei jơ̆p lăm dêh char mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm dĭng truh tơ lu dur tih kơjung kơjăp tơ noh, mă iĕm gơnang, gô teh pơchah răm đĭ.

English: You shall eat the fruit of your own body, the flesh of your sons and your daughters whom the LORD your God has given you, in the siege and desperate straits in which your enemy shall distress you.
Bahnar: Kơplah đe wang tăp dăr, lu ayăt pơrŭng iĕm, iĕm gô 'buh sa kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn iĕm kơdih, mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm.

English: The sensitive and very refined man among you will be hostile toward his brother, toward the wife of his bosom, and toward the rest of his children whom he leaves behind
Bahnar: Kơplah đei lu ayăt wang tơ pơlei, pơm kơ iĕm tôch đon đĭ boih, bơngai drŏ-nglo mă 'lơ̆ng, iơ̆m dim hloh lăm lu iĕm gô jing kret kơ 'nhŏng oh sư, kon akăn sư mă oei arih.

English: so that he will not give any of them the flesh of his children whom he will eat, because he has nothing left in the siege and desperate straits in which your enemy shall distress you at all your gates.
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơmat-tat bơngai noh ưh kơ asong ôh tơmam sa sư đei, 'nhŏ kơ 'nhĕm kon sư kơdih mă sư oei sa, yua kơ sư pă đei tơmam kiơ sa.

English: The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground because of her delicateness and sensitivity, will refuse to the husband of her bosom, and to her son and her daughter
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn 'lơ̆ng hloh lăm lu iĕm, bơngai mă ưh kơ lah jur jơ̆ng sư tơ teh ôh. Sư bơngai iơ̆m dim, gơh găt, mă-lei gô kret kơ klo sư mă hưch wă păng kơ kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn sư

English: her placenta which comes out from between her feet and her children whom she bears; for she will eat them secretly for lack of everything in the siege and desperate straits in which your enemy shall distress you at all your gates.
Bahnar: gô ôn lê̆ tơpu kon sư păng kon sư 'nao tơpŭ lĕch đơ̆ng klak, yua kơ wă sa ôn hơdrô̆ sư, yua kơ ưh kơ đei tơmam kiơ sa, kơplah lăm năr rŭng răng đe wang, lu ayăt gô pơrŭng iĕm lăm pơlei iĕm.

English: “If you do not carefully observe all the words of this law that are written in this book, that you may fear this glorious and awesome name, THE LORD YOUR GOD
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm ưh kơ kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng khôi juăt 'nâu, chih boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'nâu, ưh pă hli kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rŏ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm anăn ư-ang trŏ kơ hli yom krưp

English: then the LORD will bring upon you and your descendants extraordinary plagues—great and prolonged plagues—and serious and prolonged sicknesses.
Bahnar: na Kră Yang gô ăn đei tơdrong truh kơ iĕm păng tơ lu kon sâu iĕm pơmat-tat krưp đe tam lah 'bôh ôh, tơdrong pơmat tih păng đunh, đei tơdrong jĭ anat păng đunh, lu tơdrong jĭ krưp.

English: Moreover He will bring back on you all the diseases of Egypt, of which you were afraid, and they shall cling to you.
Bahnar: Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm đei tơdrong jĭ đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, tơdrong jĭ noh mă đêl iĕm hli tơrơ boih, lu sư gô đom druh kiơ̆ iĕm.

English: Also every sickness and every plague, which is not written in this Book of the Law, will the LORD bring upon you until you are destroyed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m gô ăn kơ iĕm tôm tĕch tơdrong jĭ jăn păng tôm tĕch tơdrong pơmat-tat ưh kơ đei chih lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar Khôi Juăt 'nâu, dĭng truh tơ iĕm lôch răm đĭ.

English: You shall be left few in number, whereas you were as the stars of heaven in multitude, because you would not obey the voice of the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai iĕm lơ thoi sơnglŏng kơpal plĕnh mă-lei oei pă tŏ sĕt, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: And it shall be, that just as the LORD rejoiced over you to do you good and multiply you, so the LORD will rejoice over you to destroy you and bring you to nothing; and you shall be plucked from off the land which you go to possess.
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi Kră Yang đei hiôk pơm 'lơ̆ng păng ăn kơ iĕm rai lơ kơdrâ̆m thoi yơ, kư̆m thoi noh na Kră Yang kư̆m hiôk ăn kơ iĕm đei tơdrong gleh truh tơhiong pơrăm iĕm; Lu iĕm đe gô buch lê̆ puh tơlĕch đơ̆ng teh lăm dêh iĕm wă mơ̆t iŏk.

English: “Then the LORD will scatter you among all peoples, from one end of the earth to the other, and there you shall serve other gods, which neither you nor your fathers have known—wood and stone.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô tơraih iĕm tơrak 'brak jơ̆p kơ teh đak, đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak 'nâu truh tôch kơ teh đak to. Tơ noh, lu iĕm gô kơkuh kơ lu yang nai pơm hăm 'long păng tơmo yang noh iĕm hăm lu 'bok iĕm ưh kơ lah băt ôh.

English: And among those nations you shall find no rest, nor shall the sole of your foot have a resting place; but there the LORD will give you a trembling heart, failing eyes, and anguish of soul.
Bahnar: Oei lăm teh đak noh, iĕm ưh kơ đei hiôk rơnŭk ôh, ưh kơ đei anih wă ăn kơ kơnơl jơ̆ng iĕm pơdơh ôh. Tơ anih noh Kră Yang gô ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m iĕm hli tơrơ, măt hơ'nhôi, jơhngơ̆m đon ơh sơ'ngon.

English: Your life shall hang in doubt before you; you shall fear day and night, and have no assurance of life.
Bahnar: Iĕm tơtăm tơdrong arih ưh pă hơđơ̆ng; măng năr iĕm hli tơrơ, ưh kơ băt tơdrong arih wă jing thoi yơ, yua kơ lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm hli tơtăm lu tơdrong măt iĕm 'bôh.

English: In the morning you shall say, ‘Oh, that it were evening!’ And at evening you shall say, ‘Oh, that it were morning!’ because of the fear which terrifies your heart, and because of the sight which your eyes see.
Bahnar: Pơgê hrôih iĕm khan: Rŏ kơ jah măng! Gơsơ̆ măng boih iĕm khan: Rŏ kơ jah hơdah

English: “And the LORD will take you back to Egypt in ships, by the way of which I said to you, ‘You shall never see it again.’ And there you shall be offered for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô chông ba iĕm hăm duk hơlơ̆k brŏk tơ dêh Êyiptơ dơ̆ng; mă khan Sư đei pơkă hăm lu iĕm ưh pă đei layơ wă wih brŏk tơ noh dơ̆ng; lu iĕm gô tĕch akâu iĕm kơ lu bơngai ayăt pơm đĭch, đĭ drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu wă răt.

English: These are the words of the covenant which the LORD commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which He made with them in Horeb.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu nơ̆r pơgơ̆p tơ'blŏk đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơkă khan kơ Môis hăm lu bơngai Isơrael, lăm dêh Môap, 'nguaih kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư tơ kông Hôrêp.

English: Now Moses called all Israel and said to them: “You have seen all that the LORD did before your eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his servants and to all his land
Bahnar: Môis krao đĭ bơngai Isơrael khan kơ lu sư: Lu iĕm hlôi 'bôh boih dôm tơdrong Kră Yang pơm lăm dêh Êyiptơ 'bơ̆t tơm măt iĕm kơ Pharaôn kơ đĭ bơngai jang kơ sư păng lăm dêh sư.

English: the great trials which your eyes have seen, the signs, and those great wonders.
Bahnar: Dôm lu tơdrong truh tih krưp dêh, tơdra hlĭch tơdrong mơsêh tih, mă măt lu iĕm hlôi 'bôh boih.

English: Yet the LORD has not given you a heart to perceive and eyes to see and ears to hear, to this very day.
Bahnar: Mă-lei truh tơ dang ei Kră Yang ưh tam ăn kơ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm hlôh băt, măt iĕm 'bôh păng đon iĕm kơtơ̆ng.

English: And I have led you forty years in the wilderness. Your clothes have not worn out on you, and your sandals have not worn out on your feet.
Bahnar: Inh chông lu iĕm puăn-jĭt sơnăm boih lăm char glă ao lu iĕm ưh kơ so hiah, chơkhŏ lu iĕm 'bot tơ jơ̆ng ưh kơ huach luih.

English: You have not eaten bread, nor have you drunk wine or similar drink, that you may know that I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ đei sŏng sa păng ưh kơ đei huch đak hơmu dah et tơdrô suai ôh, wă kơ iĕm băt Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: And when you came to this place, Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out against us to battle, and we conquered them.
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm truh tơ anih 'nâu, Sihôn, pơtao pơlei Hesbôn păng Ôk, pơtao char Basan, năm tơblah hăm lu bơ̆n mă-lei tơblah jei bơ̆n.

English: We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, to the Gadites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh.
Bahnar: Iŏk dêh char sư pơjao ăn kơ adrĕch Rubên, Gat păng pơjao ăn minh puăt kơ adrĕch Manase jang sa.

English: Therefore keep the words of this covenant, and do them, that you may prosper in all that you do.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei kơchăng wei răk pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r tơdrong pơgơ̆p pơkă 'nâu, wă kơ lu iĕm gơh đei jing lăm tôm tơdrong jang iĕm pơm.

English: “All of you stand today before the LORD your God: your leaders and your tribes and your elders and your officers, all the men of Israel
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu đĭ-đăng kơ lu iĕm oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang đei lu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch, lu kră pơlei, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh păng đĭ-đăng lu drŏ-nglo bơngai Isơrael.

English: your little ones and your wives—also the stranger who is in your camp, from the one who cuts your wood to the one who draws your water
Bahnar: Lu kon hơ'lơ̆p păng lu akăn iĕm, hăm lu bơngai tơmoi oei lăm kơđông, lu bơngai kăl 'long ŭnh truh tơ lu bơngai chhŏ đak.

English: that you may enter into covenant with the LORD your God, and into His oath, which the LORD your God makes with you today
Bahnar: Lu iĕm dơ̆ng tơ âu wă yak mơ̆t lăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, noh boih tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, pơm hăm iĕm năr 'nâu, wă kơ iĕm pơkă wă pơm keh, wă kơ iĕm pơkă wă pơm kiơ̆ thoi đei chih lăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p pơkă Kră Yang.

English: that He may establish you today as a people for Himself, and that He may be God to you, just as He has spoken to you, and just as He has sworn to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu Sư pơjing iĕm jing kon pơlei pơla Sư păng Sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, thoi Sư đei pơkă boih hăm iĕm păng sư kư̆m đei pơkăm hăm 'bok iĕm, Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp.

English: “I make this covenant and this oath, not with you alone
Bahnar: Kră Yang krao lu iĕm wă kơ lu iĕm pơkă wă pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă Kră Yang đei pơm, ưh kơ sĭ lu bơ̆n đĕch ôh wă khan ưh kơ lăp dôm lu bơ̆n dơ̆ng tơ âu 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n đĕch ôh.

English: but with him who stands here with us today before the LORD our God, as well as with him who is not here with us today
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơjing hăm lu kon sâu lu bơ̆n mă ưh kơ đei dơ̆ng hơdai bơ̆n năr âu hai.

English: (for you know that we dwelt in the land of Egypt and that we came through the nations which you passed by
Bahnar: Lu iĕm băt hơđăl boih lu bơ̆n oei arih lăm dêh Êyiptơ păng trong lu bơ̆n năm rok găn lăm dêh char đe, mă truh tơ anih âu.

English: and you saw their abominations and their idols which were among them—wood and stone and silver and gold)
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'bôh lu kon pơlei lu sư kơkuh kơ rup yang lăng krưp, lu rup yang pơm hăm 'long, tơmo, hăm hu hăm maih.

English: so that there may not be among you man or woman or family or tribe, whose heart turns away today from the LORD our God, to go and serve the gods of these nations, and that there may not be among you a root bearing bitterness or wormwood
Bahnar: Athei kơchăng bĕ, 'nĕ kơ đei bu drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn, hnam dơnŏ dah adrĕch adrung ayơ mă dơ̆ng tơ âu năr 'nâu achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, na năm kơkuh kơ lu yang adrĕch drung nai; lăm lu iĕm athei 'nĕ kơ ăn đei rơh kơnê̆ hơkăm chăt sôr tơ lăm lu iĕm.

English: and so it may not happen, when he hears the words of this curse, that he blesses himself in his heart, saying, ‘I shall have peace, even though I follow the dictates of my heart’—as though the drunkard could be included with the sober.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu kơtơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r pơkă pơkăm lăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nâu, 'nĕ sơkat pŭn hiôk kơdih 'nâu, 'nĕ kơ đei lăm jơhngơ̆m tơchĕng khan: Inh gô oei arih sa kiơ̆ tơdrong inh kơdih kư̆m bưh, huay kơ đei kiơ. Pơm thoi noh pơrăm iĕm kư̆m thoi teh hơiuh hăm teh hrĕng kro.

English: “The LORD would not spare him; for then the anger of the LORD and His jealousy would burn against that man, and every curse that is written in this book would settle on him, and the LORD would blot out his name from under heaven.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ mơnat tơdrong yoch bơngai noh, mă-lei tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl păng gar sư noh chhông blah bơngai noh păng đĭ lu tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'nâu gô tơpŭ tơ kơpal sư; păng Kră Yang gô sŭt lê̆ anăn sư đơ̆ng lăm teh đak 'nâu.

English: And the LORD would separate him from all the tribes of Israel for adversity, according to all the curses of the covenant that are written in this Book of the Law
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô tơklah lê̆ sư lĕch đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, wă kơ pŭ iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat kiơ̆ thoi đơ̆ng tơdrong pơgơ̆p đei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt 'nâu.

English: so that the coming generation of your children who rise up after you, and the foreigner who comes from a far land, would say, when they see the plagues of that land and the sicknesses which the LORD has laid on it
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung lu iĕm ning-mônh chăl lu kon sâu lu iĕm păng lu bơngai tơmoi đơ̆ng ataih, 'bôh dôm tơdrong răm pơmat-tat păng tơdrong jĭ jăn mă Kră Yang đei ăn truh wă pơrăm dêh char 'nâu

English: ‘The whole land is brimstone, salt, and burning; it is not sown, nor does it bear, nor does any grass grow there, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, which the LORD overthrew in His anger and His wrath.’
Bahnar: 'Bôh jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh 'nâu răm đĭ ŭnh păng 'boh sa đĭ teh ưh pă gơh rei pơtăm, ưh kơ đei kiơ gơh bluh chăt, ưh kơ đei minh tơnơm kiơ gơh chăt, nhen thoi pơlei Sôđôm Gômôrơ, Atma păng Sêbôlim, pơlei mă Kră Yang hil mĭl krưp pơlôch pơrăm lê̆ boih.

English: “All nations would say, ‘Why has the LORD done so to this land? What does the heat of this great anger mean?’
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung lu sư gô jet: Lơliơ mă Kră Yang pơm kơ dêh âu thoi noh liơ mă tơdrong Sư hil mĭl tih krưp dêh thoi noh?

English: Then people would say: ‘Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD God of their fathers, which He made with them when He brought them out of the land of Egypt
Bahnar: Nơ̆r đe tơl: Yua kơ kon pơlei âu sơngah kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu 'bok lu sư, pơm boih hăm lu sư, kơplah Sư chông ba lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ

English: for they went and served other gods and worshiped them, gods that they did not know and that He had not given to them.
Bahnar: lu sư năm kơkuh kơ lu yang nai mă kơdih lu sư ưh kơ băt. Kră Yang ưh kơ ăn.

English: Then the anger of the LORD was aroused against this land, to bring on it every curse that is written in this book.
Bahnar: Thoi ei Kră Yang hil mĭl dêh kơ char noh, na Sư ăn kơ char noh dôm tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ chih boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'nâu.

English: And the LORD uprooted them from their land in anger, in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as it is this day.’
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong ơh blĕk dêh păng tơdrong hil mĭl krưp dêh tơpă Kră Yang buch lê̆ boih na klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ lu sư tơ char nai, thoi kơ năr 'nâu.

English: “The secret things belong to the LORD our God, but those things which are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong hlơp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n đĕch băt; mă-lei dôm lu tơdrong Sư tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu bơ̆n păng kơ lu kon sâu bơ̆n ling-lang hlŏng hloi, noh lăm khôi juăt âu, wă kơ lu bơ̆n chu pơm kiơ̆.

English: “Now it shall come to pass, when all these things come upon you, the blessing and the curse which I have set before you, and you call them to mind among all the nations where the LORD your God drives you
Bahnar: Layơ dôm tơdrong 'nâu đei truh kơ iĕm, pŭn hiôk dah pơmat-tat, mă inh đei roi pơdah truh tơ iĕm, kơplah oei lăm lu teh đak, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm puh iĕm năm, lu iĕm gô 'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ dôm tơdrong inh bơtho khan.

English: and you return to the LORD your God and obey His voice, according to all that I command you today, you and your children, with all your heart and with all your soul
Bahnar: Dah kơplah noh iĕm wih brŏk dơ̆ng tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, iĕm păng lu kon sâu iĕm athei đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak chu kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong inh bơtho khan kơ iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: that the LORD your God will bring you back from captivity, and have compassion on you, and gather you again from all the nations where the LORD your God has scattered you.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô dŏng pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng pơm đĭch păng gô chông ba iĕm brŏk. Kră Yang gô mơnat păng akŭm pơpôi lu iĕm đơ̆ng rim anih mă Sư pơm kơ iĕm tơklah tơklang.

English: If any of you are driven out to the farthest parts under heaven, from there the LORD your God will gather you, and from there He will bring you.
Bahnar: Mă khan lu iĕm Sư puh boih truh tơring ataih tôch kơ plĕnh teh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm kư̆m gô pơpôi akŭm iĕm dơ̆ng păng chông wih brŏk đơ̆ng anih noh.

English: Then the LORD your God will bring you to the land which your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it. He will prosper you and multiply you more than your fathers.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô chông ba iĕm brŏk tơ dêh 'bok, 'bă iĕm iŏk boih: Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm chek lar hrôh ngôh mơdrŏng hloh kơ 'bok iĕm.

English: And the LORD your God will circumcise your heart and the heart of your descendants, to love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul, that you may live.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ bơ̆n păng kon sâu lu bơ̆n đei jơhngơ̆m rơmuăn băt chu yom, wă kơ iĕm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak 'mêm yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ gơh arih.

English: “Also the LORD your God will put all these curses on your enemies and on those who hate you, who persecuted you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô tuh dôm nơ̆r hiap pơtê̆ 'nâu kơ lu bơngai ayăt areh pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm.

English: And you will again obey the voice of the LORD and do all His commandments which I command you today.
Bahnar: Iĕm gô chu, mơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu nơ̆r Sư tơtă, mă inh bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm năr 'nâu.

English: The LORD your God will make you abound in all the work of your hand, in the fruit of your body, in the increase of your livestock, and in the produce of your land for good. For the LORD will again rejoice over you for good as He rejoiced over your fathers
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm: Sư gô ăn tơdrong pŭn tih lăm dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti iĕm pơm ăn kơ kon sâu iĕm hrôh ngôh rai lơ, sem dơrong, chek lar păng 'ba hơ'bo đơ̆ng chŭn mir gơh đei mah rơkah rơkai; Kră Yang lăp đon mơnat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm, thoi Sư lăp đon ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu 'bok iĕm.

English: if you obey the voice of the LORD your God, to keep His commandments and His statutes which are written in this Book of the Law, and if you turn to the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm chu pơm kiơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm wei răk nơ̆r tơtă tơdrong juăt mă sư đei chih lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt mă sư đei chih lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt 'nâu păng đĭ jơhngơ̆m đĭ bơhngol wih tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: “For this commandment which I command you today is not too mysterious for you, nor is it far off.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong mă inh bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm năr 'nâu ưh kơ trŏ tơnat dêh kơ iĕm, kư̆m ưh kơ ataih dêh kơ iĕm

English: It is not in heaven, that you should say, ‘Who will ascend into heaven for us and bring it to us, that we may hear it and do it?’
Bahnar: Kŭm ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong tơ kơpal plĕnh na iĕm mah jet: Bơngai bu gô tŏk tơ plĕnh chĕp ba tơjur tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng, na wă kơ lu bơ̆n pơm kiơ̆?

English: Nor is it beyond the sea, that you should say, ‘Who will go over the sea for us and bring it to us, that we may hear it and do it?’
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m ưh kơ tơ pah to đak dơsĭ, na iĕm jet: Bơngai bu gơh tŏk hlôi pah to đak dơsĭ, na chĕp ba ăn kơ lu bơ̆n wă kơ bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng păng pơm kiơ̆?

English: But the word is very near you, in your mouth and in your heart, that you may do it.
Bahnar: Ưh ôh, nơ̆r Kră Yang jê̆ iĕm lăm 'bơ̆r iĕm păng lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm, na wă kơ iĕm pơm kiơ̆ Sư.

English: “See, I have set before you today life and good, death and evil
Bahnar: Âu, năr 'nâu inh apinh iĕm rơih iŏk tơdrong arih pŭn hiôk, dah tơdrong pơmat-tat lôch răm.

English: in that I command you today to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments, His statutes, and His judgments, that you may live and multiply; and the LORD your God will bless you in the land which you go to possess.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu inh athei iĕm 'mêm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yak kiơ̆ trong Sư păng wei răk dôm lu nơ̆r tơtă, khôi juăt Sư păng nơ̆r Sư athei, wă kơ iĕm arih sot hrôh ngôh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lăm dêh char mă iĕm gô mơ̆t iŏk.

English: But if your heart turns away so that you do not hear, and are drawn away, and worship other gods and serve them
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah jơhngơ̆m iĕm tơplih sơngah, kuă kơ mơ̆ng kră kơ pơm kiơ̆, na chu đe pơhlŭ kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh kơ lu yang nai

English: I announce to you today that you shall surely perish; you shall not prolong your days in the land which you cross over the Jordan to go in and possess.
Bahnar: na năr 'nâu inh tơbăt kơ iĕm thoi âu, tơpă lu iĕm gô lôch hiong răm, iĕm ưh kơ gơh arih sot lăm teh mă iĕm wă năm iŏk mưh tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: I call heaven and earth as witnesses today against you, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and cursing; therefore choose life, that both you and your descendants may live
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu, inh krao plĕnh păng teh pơm kơdranh ăn kơ inh, inh dan tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm rơih iŏk tơdrong arih păng tơdrong lôch, tơdrong pŭn hiôk păng tơdrong hiap pơtê̆. Thoi noh, rơih bĕ tơdrong arih, wă kơ iĕm păng lu kon sâu iĕm gơh arih.

English: that you may love the LORD your God, that you may obey His voice, and that you may cling to Him, for He is your life and the length of your days; and that you may dwell in the land which the LORD swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give them.”
Bahnar: 'Mêm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư păng kiơ̆ Sư mă tơpă yua kơ lăp Sư đĕch gơh ăn tơdrong arih na Kră Yang gô ăn kơ iĕm gơh arih sot, tơ lăm teh đak mă Kră Yang hlôi pơkă wă ăn kơ lu 'bok iĕm, 'bok Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp.

English: Then Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis lĕch pơma nơ̆r 'nâu hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael dôm lu nơ̆r tơ ala âu

English: And he said to them: “I am one hundred and twenty years old today. I can no longer go out and come in. Also the LORD has said to me, ‘You shall not cross over this Jordan.’
Bahnar: Dang ei inh đei minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm boih; inh ưh pă gơh lĕch păng ưh pă gơh mơ̆t dơ̆ng; Kră Yang đei khan hăm inh boih: Ih ưh pă gơh yak tŏk năm hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, 'nâu dơ̆ng.

English: The LORD your God Himself crosses over before you; He will destroy these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess them. Joshua himself crosses over before you, just as the LORD has said.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm gô năm tŏk kơ đak krong adrol kơ iĕm Sư gô pơlôch đĭ lu kon pơlei âu 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm, lei na iĕm gô iŏk asong băl dêh lu sư; Jôsuê gô năm adrol jing yŏng iĕm, thoi Kră Yang khan boih.

English: And the LORD will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites and their land, when He destroyed them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm kơ lu kon pơlei noh thoi Sư đei pơm boih kơ Sihôn păng Ôk pơtao bơngai Amôrit kơplah Sư pơlôch pơrăm 'bar 'nu păng dêh char lu sư boih.

English: The LORD will give them over to you, that you may do to them according to every commandment which I have commanded you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơjao kon pơlei noh ăn kơ lu iĕm păng lu iĕm athei pơm kơ lu sư gô mơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r inh athei lu iĕm pơm.

English: Be strong and of good courage, do not fear nor be afraid of them; for the LORD your God, He is the One who goes with you. He will not leave you nor forsake you.”
Bahnar: Athei nuih pran kơtang bĕ. 'Nĕ kơ hli tơrơ krưp dêh 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei noh yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm kư̆m gô năm hơdai hăm iĕm; Sư ưh kơ đei layơ achăng lê̆ iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ weh ataih đơ̆ng iĕm.

English: Then Moses called Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel, “Be strong and of good courage, for you must go with this people to the land which the LORD has sworn to their fathers to give them, and you shall cause them to inherit it.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis krao Jôsuê khan kơ sư 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael: Ih athei chơ̆n jơhngơ̆m; păng nuih kơtang bĕ, yua kơ ih gô năm mơ̆t hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei 'nâu lăm dêh char mă Kră Yang hlôi pơkă boih wă ăn kơ 'bok lu sư păng ih gô klah asong ăn kơ lu sư dêh noh.

English: And the LORD, He is the One who goes before you. He will be with you, He will not leave you nor forsake you; do not fear nor be dismayed.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang boih gô năm adrol kơ ih, Sư gô oei hơdai hăm ih păng Sư ưh kơ achăng lê̆ ih, kư̆m ưh kơ weh ataih đơ̆ng ih. Ih 'nĕ kơ hli păng 'nĕ kơ rơdu jơhngơ̆m.

English: So Moses wrote this law and delivered it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and to all the elders of Israel.
Bahnar: Môis chih khôi juăt 'nâu, pơjao ăn kơ lu 'bok soi, kon drŏ-nglo bơngai Lêwi lu bơngai tung Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang păng pơjao ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu kră bơngai Isơrael.

English: And Moses commanded them, saying: “At the end of every seven years, at the appointed time in the year of release, at the Feast of Tabernacles
Bahnar: Păng pơkă kơ lu sư: Tôch rim kơ tơpơh sơnăm, lăm sơnăm ăn rơngei đơ̆ng hre, lăm năr pơm Giĕng Bơsŭn.

English: when all Israel comes to appear before the LORD your God in the place which He chooses, you shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
Bahnar: Kơplah đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael năm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, tơ anih mă Sư gô rơih, na lu iĕm athei đŏk ăn mă re kơ lu sư mơ̆ng khôi juăt 'nâu.

English: Gather the people together, men and women and little ones, and the stranger who is within your gates, that they may hear and that they may learn to fear the LORD your God and carefully observe all the words of this law
Bahnar: Iĕm athei krao akŭm bĕ đĭ lu kon pơlei, drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, lu hơ'lơ̆p păng lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei lăm pơlei iĕm, wă kơ lu sư dai mơ̆ng, pơhrăm băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng kơchăng pơm kiơ̆ dôm lu nơ̆r đơ̆ng lăm khôi juăt 'nâu.

English: and that their children, who have not known it, may hear and learn to fear the LORD your God as long as you live in the land which you cross the Jordan to possess.”
Bahnar: Lu kon hơ'lơ̆p iĕm, lu bơngai mă tam mă băt khôi juăt 'nâu, athei mơ̆ng păng athei pơhrăm iŏk băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, đĭ lăm chăl arih lu iĕm mă oei tơ dêh lu iĕm wă mơ̆t iŏk noh, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ iĕm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Behold, the days approach when you must die; call Joshua, and present yourselves in the tabernacle of meeting, that I may inaugurate him.” So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Năr ih lôch wă jê̆ boih; ih krao Jôsuê na măr iĕm năm 'bơ̆t anăp Inh tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm. Tơ noh Inh wă pơjao ăn kơ Jôsuê jang. Thoi noh, Môis păng Jôsuê năm truh tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Now the LORD appeared at the tabernacle in a pillar of cloud, and the pillar of cloud stood above the door of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơ'bôh akâu Sư, lăm jrăng hơmơ̆l păng hơmơ̆l dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And the LORD said to Moses: “Behold, you will rest with your fathers; and this people will rise and play the harlot with the gods of the foreigners of the land, where they go to be among them, and they will forsake Me and break My covenant which I have made with them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Ih gô pơdơh hăm lu 'bok ih; kon pơlei 'nâu gô kơkuh kơ yang nai lăm dêh lu sư wă năm mơ̆t lu sư gô achăng lê̆ Inh păng pơm glăi kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă Inh đei pơgơ̆p boih hăm lu sư.

English: Then My anger shall be aroused against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide My face from them, and they shall be devoured. And many evils and troubles shall befall them, so that they will say in that day, ‘Have not these evils come upon us because our God is not among us?’
Bahnar: Năr ei kơnh Inh gô hil blĕk; Inh gô achăng lê̆ lu sư, ôn muh măt Inh đơ̆ng lu sư păng lu sư gô jing tơmam sa kơ lu kon pơlei nai. Lu sư gô đei tơdrong răm-'băm pơmat-tat. Lăm năr noh lu sư gô jet: Hăm trŏ bơ̆n đei tơdrong răm pơmat-tat yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n ưh kơ oei hơdai bơ̆n dơ̆ng?

English: And I will surely hide My face in that day because of all the evil which they have done, in that they have turned to other gods.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm năr noh, Inh gô ôn muh măt Inh, yua kơ đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng lu tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư pơm năm kiơ̆ lu yang nai.

English: “Now therefore, write down this song for yourselves, and teach it to the children of Israel; put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness for Me against the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, chih bĕ nơ̆r hơri 'nâu păng bơtho ăn kơ kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael hơri, lu sư athei thuơk lăm đon kơ nơ̆r hơri 'nâu wă roi tơbăt ăn Inh kơ nơ̆r Inh chrih ayăt hăm lu sư.

English: When I have brought them to the land flowing with milk and honey, of which I swore to their fathers, and they have eaten and filled themselves and grown fat, then they will turn to other gods and serve them; and they will provoke Me and break My covenant.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng Inh chông ba lu sư mơ̆t lăm dêh char Inh hlôi pơkă boih hăm 'bok lu sư; dêh 'bĕnh kơ đak toh đak sut; lu sư gô sa phĭ păng bek, wơ̆t bơ̆jang kơkuh lu yang nai, lu sư gô pơdê lê̆ Inh păng pơm glăi kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh.

English: Then it shall be, when many evils and troubles have come upon them, that this song will testify against them as a witness; for it will not be forgotten in the mouths of their descendants, for I know the inclination of their behavior today, even before I have brought them to the land of which I swore to give them.”
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư đei tơdrong pơmat-tat anat anot tơdrong kơnê̆ truh kơ lu sư, tơdrong hơri 'nâu gô roi tơbăt tơ'blŏk kơ lu sư, yua kơ tơdrong hơri 'nâu ưh kơ hiơt ôh, gô oei ling-lang lăm 'bơ̆r lu kon sâu lu sư. Inh băt lăm kơ̆l đon lu sư tơchĕng wă pơm hơmet boih, adrol kơ Inh wă chông ba lu sư mơ̆t lăm dêh char mă Inh đei pơkă wă ăn.

English: Therefore Moses wrote this song the same day, and taught it to the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Môis chih nơ̆r hơri 'nâu păng bơtho pơhrăm ăn kơ lu kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael

English: Then He inaugurated Joshua the son of Nun, and said, “Be strong and of good courage; for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land of which I swore to them, and I will be with you.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơjao ăn tơdrong jang kơ Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun, khan: Ih athei chơ̆n jơhngơ̆m nuih kơtang, yua kơ ih gô ba kon pơlei Isơrael mơ̆t lăm dêh char mă Inh pơkă boih wă ăn kơ lu sư; Inh gô oei hơdai ih.

English: So it was, when Moses had completed writing the words of this law in a book, when they were finished
Bahnar: Lăp Môis chih dôm lu nơ̆r khôi juăt 'nâu đơ̆ng tơm truh tơ tôch tơ lăm minh sơ̆p hla bơar keh đang boih.

English: that Moses commanded the Levites, who bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Na Môis athei lu bơngai Lêwi tung Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang

English: “Take this Book of the Law, and put it beside the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, that it may be there as a witness against you
Bahnar: iŏk bĕ sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt 'nâu, lê̆ 'bơ̆t cheng Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, lê̆ Sơ̆p hla bơar tơ noh 'bơ̆t cheng Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p pơm nơ̆r tơbăt pơsĭt ayăt hăm lu iĕm

English: for I know your rebellion and your stiff neck. If today, while I am yet alive with you, you have been rebellious against the LORD, then how much more after my death?
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh băt kơ jơhngơ̆m iĕm arăng dêh kơplah inh oei arih oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm hlôi blah plơ̆ boih hăm Kră Yang thoi noh, pơma kiơ đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh lôch kơnh, lu iĕm wă blah plơ̆ dang yơ dơ̆ng!

English: Gather to me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their hearing and call heaven and earth to witness against them.
Bahnar: Krao pơpôi akŭm bĕ lu kră đơ̆ng rim khŭl adrĕch adrung lu iĕm păng lu kră pơgơ̆r lu iĕm, đơ̆ng rim kơ adrĕch bơngai; wă kơ inh roi kơ lu sư kơtơ̆ng mơ̆ng lăm đon lu sư dôm lu nơ̆r 'nâu păng Inh wă apinh plĕnh păng teh pơm kơdranh chrih blah plơ̆ hăm lu sư.

English: For I know that after my death you will become utterly corrupt, and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you. And evil will befall you in the latter days, because you will do evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke Him to anger through the work of your hands.”
Bahnar: Inh băt gô răm-'băm tơpă, achăng lê̆ trong mă đơ̆ng inh bơtho khan, ning-mônh lu iĕm gô tơblĕk Kră Yang pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆, mă Kră Yang, ưh kơ lăp đon păng tơdrong răm pơmat-tat gô truh kơ lu iĕm.

English: Then Moses spoke in the hearing of all the assembly of Israel the words of this song until they were ended
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis đŏk dôm lu nơ̆r hơri 'nâu đơ̆ng tơm truh tơ tôch ăn kơ đĭ-đăng đon bơngai Isơrael mơ̆ng

English: “Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak; And hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
Bahnar: Ơ lu tăl plĕnh mơ̆ng bĕ, 'nâu wă pơma; ơ teh apinh mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh.

English: Let my teaching drop as the rain, My speech distill as the dew, As raindrops on the tender herb, And as showers on the grass.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ nơ̆r inh bơtho huŏng jruh thoi đak 'mi; nơ̆r inh pơma lĕch thoi đak ngom jur, thoi 'mi pruh tơ kơpal 'nhĕt 'lơ̆p thoi 'mi hngach ruh tơ kơpal hla 'nhĕt adrih.

English: For I proclaim the name of the LORD: Ascribe greatness to our God.
Bahnar: Inh ư-ang anăn Kră Yang. Bĕ bơ̆n hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla mă tih hloh!

English: He is the Rock, His work is perfect; For all His ways are justice, A God of truth and without injustice; Righteous and upright is He.
Bahnar: Kră Yang thoi Tơmo Tih 'lơ̆ng tôm; lu tơdrong Sư jang keh dang 'lơ̆ng tôm, trong Kră Yang tơpăt hơnơ̆ng. Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sĭt, 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ưh kơ đei hơlĕnh. Sư tơpăt ling-lang 'lơ̆ng hơnơ̆ng.

English: “They have corrupted themselves; They are not His children, Because of their blemish: A perverse and crooked generation.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm oei hư răm. Ưh pă rŏ trŏ jing kon drŏ-nglo Kră Yang dơ̆ng.

English: Do you thus deal with the LORD, O foolish and unwise people? Is He not your Father, who bought you? Has He not made you and established you?
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei kơhlôh kơwao ưh kơ đei đon tơchĕng, lu iĕm pơm kơ Kră Yang thoi noh hă? Ưh kơ trŏ kơ 'Bă lu iĕm hă, ưh kơ tơ'ngla pơjing iĕm hă? Ưh kơ trŏ Sư pơjing iĕm jing adrĕch adrung Sư hă?

English: “Remember the days of old, Consider the years of many generations. Ask your father, and he will show you; Your elders, and they will tell you
Bahnar: 'Blŏk bĕ kơ năr sơ̆ ki. Tơchĕng bĕ kơ lu bơngai chăl adrol sơ̆. Jet bĕ 'bă iĕm lu sư gô tơl. Apinh bĕ lu kră iĕm, lu sư gô roi tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm.

English: When the Most High divided their inheritance to the nations, When He separated the sons of Adam, He set the boundaries of the peoples According to the number of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Mưh kơplah Kră Yang Tih Hloh klah asong ăn teh kơ kon pơlei. 'Bơ̆t Sư ăn kơ adrĕch adrung Ađam tơklah tơklang. Sư hơgăt ăn hơdral kơ rim adrĕch, kiơ̆ kơ kơ̆l kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael.a

English: For the LORD’s portion is His people; Jacob is the place of His inheritance.
Bahnar: Gah Kră Yang noh kon pơlei Sư, Jakôp noh gah Sư.

English: “He found him in a desert land And in the wasteland, a howling wilderness; He encircled him, He instructed him, He kept him as the apple of His eye.
Bahnar: Kră Yang chă 'bôh lu kon pơlei Sư tơ lăm char glă. Tơ lăm bri brah đei nơ̆r ôr krao Kră Yang wei rong lu sư, bơwei lu sư wei thoi kon-ngai lăm măt Sư.

English: As an eagle stirs up its nest, Hovers over its young, Spreading out its wings, taking them up, Carrying them on its wings
Bahnar: Thoi sem klang tơdrŏ kơ tơpu Sư râu kon sư 'nao cheh, Păr bah kơ lu hơnar sư, bơlang pơnăr sư gram hơnar păng pŭ hơnar sư kơpal pơnăr.

English: So the LORD alone led him, And there was no foreign god with him.
Bahnar: Minh Kră Yang đĕch chông anhăk lu kon pơlei Sư, Ưh kơ đei yang kiơ nai.

English: “He made him ride in the heights of the earth, That he might eat the produce of the fields; He made him draw honey from the rock, And oil from the flinty rock
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ lu sư oei tơ tơring groi kông; Rong lu sư hăm tơmam sa đơ̆ng lăm mir chŭn; Ăn sa đak sut iŏk đơ̆ng lăm tơmo tih. Păng đak rơmă lĕch đơ̆ng teh lăm tơmo.

English: Curds from the cattle, and milk of the flock, With fat of lambs; And rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, With the choicest wheat; And you drank wine, the blood of the grapes.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng khŭl rơmo păng triu bơbe lu sư đei đak toh păng đak toh iŭ. Sa 'nhĕm sĕch rơmă đơ̆ng triu kon păng triu tơno. Rơmo triu tơno, bơbe tơno đơ̆ng char Basan lu iĕm sŏng 'ba 'mi mă 'lơ̆ng hloh; Huch sik đak hơmu đơ̆ng tơm 'brê thoi pham.

English: “But Jeshurun grew fat and kicked; You grew fat, you grew thick, You are obese! Then he forsook God who made him, And scornfully esteemed the Rock of his salvation.
Bahnar: Jêsurunb wă rai bek mơdrŏng pran, wă iŏk jơ̆ng đă plơ̆ akâu sư bek lơluĭnh boih na lu sư achăng lê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla mă pơjing lu sư, păng pơjăm lê̆ Tơmo Tih mă dŏng pơklaih.

English: They provoked Him to jealousy with foreign gods; With abominations they provoked Him to anger.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơkuh kơ rup yang nai wă tơblĕk Kră Yang tơ'ngla 'mêm gar. Pơm wă kơ Kră Yang ơh hil kơ lu sư pơm rup yang, Sư areh lăng krưp.

English: They sacrificed to demons, not to God, To gods they did not know, To new gods, new arrivals That your fathers did not fear.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ lu yang kơnê̆, ưh kơ trŏ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh. Kơkuh kơ yang mă lu sư ưh kơ tam lah băt, Yang đơ̆ng ataih 'nao truh. Mă 'bok lu sư ưh kơ hli yom.

English: Of the Rock who begot you, you are unmindful, And have forgotten the God who fathered you.
Bahnar: Ih sơngah kơ Tơmo Tih tơ'ngla pơjing ih, Hiơt boih kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla pơjing ih.

English: “And when the LORD saw it, He spurned them, Because of the provocation of His sons and His daughters.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'bôh đĭ, na Sư hil. Na achăng hŭt lê̆ kon drŏ-nglo păng kon drŏ-kăn.

English: And He said: ‘I will hide My face from them, I will see what their end will be, For they are a perverse generation, Children in whom is no faith.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Inh gô ôn muh măt Inh ưh pă lăng lu sư wă lăng lăng tuch-luch lu sư thoi yơ, lu sư minh adrĕch hơlĕnh kơnê̆ dêh, jơ̆ lu kon mă ưh kơ tơnăp.

English: They have provoked Me to jealousy by what is not God; They have moved Me to anger by their foolish idols. But I will provoke them to jealousy by those who are not a nation; I will move them to anger by a foolish nation.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơblĕk Inh dêh yua kơ lu sư kơkuh kơ yang nai ưh kơ yua kiơ. Pơm kơ inh hil gar hăm yang mă ưh kơ đei tơdrong anăn kiơ. Na inh gô pơm kơ lu sư 'ngeng kơ lu adrĕch mă răm hloh. Iŏk minh adrĕch adrung mă lŭch hloh tơblĕk lu sư. Iŏk minh teh đak kơhlôh kơwao na tơblĕk pơklai lu sư.

English: For a fire is kindled in My anger, And shall burn to the lowest hell; It shall consume the earth with her increase, And set on fire the foundations of the mountains.
Bahnar: Inh hil thoi ŭnh sa khơ̆ng blông blông. Sa hloi tôch tơ kơđĕl hơnă pơlei lôch, ŭnh sa đĭ teh păng plei sa, sa kông pơđĭ truh tơ hơnă.

English: ‘I will heap disasters on them; I will spend My arrows on them.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơpŭ ăn tơdrong răm pơmat-tat tơ kơpal lu sư. Iŏk hră Inh prah lu sư, dĭng đĭ 'brơ̆m.

English: They shall be wasted with hunger, Devoured by pestilence and bitter destruction; I will also send against them the teeth of beasts, With the poison of serpents of the dust.
Bahnar: Inh ăn tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt, tơngiĕt găng pơm kơ lu sư hiong răm. Ba tŏ sa pơm kơ lu sư rơmơ̆n rơmok ăn tơdrong jĭ apoh pơm kơ lu sư lôch rŭng. Inh gô ăn sem bri kăp hek sa lu sư. Athei 'bih đei bih hơkăm năm choh lu Sư lôch.

English: The sword shall destroy outside; There shall be terror within For the young man and virgin, The nursing child with the man of gray hairs.
Bahnar: Tơ rok trong tih, đei đao gưm pơlôch lu sư, tơ lăm hnam đei tơdrong hli tơrơ ling-lang Tơdăm, adruh, bơngai kră păng lu kon nge gô lôch răm đĭ.

English: I would have said, “I will dash them in pieces, I will make the memory of them to cease from among men,”
Bahnar: Inh khan: Inh gô pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang, sŭt pơgoh lê̆ tơdrong đe 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ lu sư đơ̆ng lăm kon bơngai.

English: Had I not feared the wrath of the enemy, Lest their adversaries should misunderstand, Lest they should say, “Our hand is high; And it is not the LORD who has done all this.” ’
Bahnar: Mă-lei hli kơ lu bơngai ayăt noh pơjăm, Păng lu bơngai ayăt hlôh hơwơ̆l khan: Đơ̆ng tơpang ti lu nhôn mă đei jơnei tih Kră Yang ưh kơ pơm kiơ lăm tơdrong noh!

English: “For they are a nation void of counsel, Nor is there any understanding in them.
Bahnar: Lu Sư jing minh adrĕch ưh kơ hlôh, Tơchĕng ưh kơ hơdah hơdong

English: Oh, that they were wise, that they understood this, That they would consider their latter end!
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư gơh hơgei, lei lu sư hlôh boih tơdrong âu păng băt tôch ning-mônh sư thoi yơ.

English: How could one chase a thousand, And two put ten thousand to flight, Unless their Rock had sold them, And the LORD had surrendered them?
Bahnar: Tơdah Kră Yang Tơmo Tih ưh kơ đei tĕch lu sư, kư̆m ưh kơ jao lu sư kơ lu bơngai ayăt, pơm liơ lăp minh 'nu đĕch gơh druh puh lê̆ minh-rơbâu 'Bar 'nu gơh druh mơjĭt-rơbâu 'nu kơdâu?

English: For their rock is not like our Rock, Even our enemies themselves being judges.
Bahnar: Tơmo tih lu sư ưh kơ dang thoi Tơmo Tih lu bơ̆n, lu bơngai ayăt kư̆m băt thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: For their vine is of the vine of Sodom And of the fields of Gomorrah; Their grapes are grapes of gall, Their clusters are bitter.
Bahnar: Lu ayăt noh tơm hơmu chăt lăm pơlei Sôđôm lăm mir pơgar pơlei Gômôrơ. Plei hơmu lu sư đei đak hơkăm, hơie hơmu lu sư jing tăng.

English: Their wine is the poison of serpents, And the cruel venom of cobras.
Bahnar: Sik hơmu lu sư thoi bih 'bih hơkăm, bih hơkăm choh bơngai lôch đơ̆ng 'bih tur makkang.

English: ‘Is this not laid up in store with Me, Sealed up among My treasures?
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong thoi noh gô 'blŏk răk, inh wei sư lăm hnam mong tơmam gĭt inh.

English: Vengeance is Mine, and recompense; Their foot shall slip in due time; For the day of their calamity is at hand, And the things to come hasten upon them.’
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơm 'mong gô lê̆ kơ Inh, Inh gô pơm tôm. Trŏ năr jơ̆ng lu sư tơsĕr pơ̆k. Tơdrong răm wă jê̆ truh kơ lu sư bơih. Tơdrong pơlôch lu sư, gô truh tĕnh.

English: “For the LORD will judge His people And have compassion on His servants, When He sees that their power is gone, And there is no one remaining, bond or free.
Bahnar: Trŏ boih Kră Yang gô sek tơlang kơ kon pơlei Sư. 'Mêm mơnat kơ đĭch đam Sư. Kơplah Kră Yang 'bôh jơhngơ̆m lu sư gleh lap đĭ boih, ưh pă đei bu oei đĭch dah yŏng tơ'ngla lu sư.

English: He will say: ‘Where are their gods, The rock in which they sought refuge?
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô apinh: Dang ei lu yang lu sư tơ yơ, Tơmo tih mă lu sư kơ'nơp

English: Who ate the fat of their sacrifices, And drank the wine of their drink offering? Let them rise and help you, And be your refuge.
Bahnar: lu yang sa rơmă tơmam soi sư pơyơ̆r păng huch đak sik hơmu lu sư pơyơ̆r, dang ei oei tơ yơ boih? Liơ ưh kơ iung tơgŭm, liơ ưh kơ krôp bơwei lu sư?

English: ‘Now see that I, even I, am He, And there is no God besides Me; I kill and I make alive; I wound and I heal; Nor is there any who can deliver from My hand.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ, Inh âu boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Nguaih kơ Inh ưh kơ đei yang nai dơ̆ng. Inh gơh ăn lôch păng ăn arih dơ̆ng, Inh teh rơka păng Inh ming pơklaih. Ưh kơ đei bu gơh tơgar iŏk klaih đơ̆ng tơpang ti Inh.

English: For I raise My hand to heaven, And say, “As I live forever
Bahnar: Inh yơ̆r ti tơhlâu tơ plĕnh păng khan: Tơpă Inh oei arih ling-lang.

English: If I whet My glittering sword, And My hand takes hold on judgment, I will render vengeance to My enemies, And repay those who hate Me.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh pat đao rang mơnhal Ti Inh chĕp đao, Inh hơ-oei sek tơlang. Inh gô pơm 'mong kơ lu bơngai ayăt păng pơm tơwih kơ lu bơngai areh kơ Inh.

English: I will make My arrows drunk with blood, And My sword shall devour flesh, With the blood of the slain and the captives, From the heads of the leaders of the enemy.” ’
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn 'brơ̆m hră Inh huch pham; dĭng thoi et sik suai, Đao gưm Inh gô sa sĕch, Pham lu bơngai bơnă đe koh pơlôch. Chơ̆ng kơ̆l lu yŏng ayăt.

English: “Rejoice, O Gentiles, with His people; For He will avenge the blood of His servants, And render vengeance to His adversaries; He will provide atonement for His land and His people.”
Bahnar: Ơ lu adrĕch adrung kon bơngai! Hiôk chơt bĕ hăm kon pơlei Kră Yang. Yua kơ Sư gô iung kơting, pơm 'mong pham kơ đĭch đam Sư, Sư pơm 'mong blah lu bơngai ayăt kơ Sư, mơnat ăn kơ dêh char Sư păng lu kon pơlei pơla Sư.

English: So Moses came with Joshua the son of Nun and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people.
Bahnar: Môis hăm Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun đŏk đĭ dôm lu nơ̆r hơri 'nâu ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla mơ̆ng.

English: Moses finished speaking all these words to all Israel
Bahnar: Môis đŏk đang boih dôm lu nơ̆r 'nâu ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael

English: and he said to them: “Set your hearts on all the words which I testify among you today, which you shall command your children to be careful to observe—all the words of this law.
Bahnar: na sư khan kơ kon pơlei: Lăm jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm athei wei răk bĕ đĭ dôm nơ̆r inh roi ăn kơ lu iĕm lăm năr 'nâu, wă kơ lu iĕm gơh bơtho ăn kơ lu kon sâu iĕm pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r lăm khôi juăt noh.

English: For it is not a futile thing for you, because it is your life, and by this word you shall prolong your days in the land which you cross over the Jordan to possess.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu ưh kơ sĭ nơ̆r pơma ngôi đĕch, mă-lei noh jơ̆ tơdrong arih lu iĕm; kơplah gơnang kơ nơ̆r 'nâu, na lu iĕm gô oei arih sot tơ kơpal teh đak mă lu iĕm gô iŏk mưh iĕm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses that very same day, saying
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Go up this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, across from Jericho; view the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel as a possession
Bahnar: Năm tŏk bĕ tơ lu kông Abarim, tơ Nêbô lăm dêh char Môap, tơklă pơlei Jêrikô; wă tơmang lăng dêh Kanaan mă Inh wă ăn kơ kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael bơ̆jang sa.

English: and die on the mountain which you ascend, and be gathered to your people, just as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people
Bahnar: Ih gô lôch tơ kơpal kông mă ih wă tŏk noh păng ih gô oei hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei ih, kư̆m thoi Arôn 'nhŏng ih lôch tơ kơpal kông Hôr păng đe kư̆m akŭm hơdai hơbĭ boih hăm lu 'bok yă iĕm.

English: because you trespassed against Me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah Kadesh, in the Wilderness of Zin, because you did not hallow Me in the midst of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Yua kơ măr iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Inh, 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Isơrael, 'bơ̆t đak Mêriba tơ Kades, lăm char glă Yin, yua kơ ih ưh kơ kơkuh pơyom kơ Inh lăm kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: Yet you shall see the land before you, though you shall not go there, into the land which I am giving to the children of Israel.”
Bahnar: Lei na ih lăp lăng 'bôh dêh char noh đơ̆ng ataih ih ưh kơ mơ̆t ôh lăm dêh mă Inh ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: Now this is the blessing with which Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Môis, bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ kon pơlei Isơrael adrol kơ sư wă lôch.

English: And he said: “The LORD came from Sinai, And dawned on them from Seir; He shone forth from Mount Paran, And He came with ten thousands of saints; From His right hand Came a fiery law for them.
Bahnar: Sư khan: Kră Yang truh đơ̆ng kông Sinai. Pơchrang hơdah kơpal lu bơ̆n đơ̆ng Seirơ, păng rang mơnhal đơ̆ng Kông Paran; Sư truh hăm lơ rơbâu hơngan linh jang, Rang hơdah kơmlat lĕch đơ̆ng ti 'ma Sư.

English: Yes, He loves the people; All His saints are in Your hand; They sit down at Your feet; Everyone receives Your words.
Bahnar: Sư 'mêm kơ kon pơlei pơla Sư tơpă; đĭ-đăng lu linh jang oei lăm tơpang ti Sư; Sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Sư. Sơng iŏk nơ̆r bơtho khan đơ̆ng Sư.

English: Moses commanded a law for us, A heritage of the congregation of Jacob.
Bahnar: Tơdrong juăt mă Môis bơtho ăn kơ lu bơ̆n noh boih mŭk tơmam kơ adrĕch Jakôp.

English: And He was King in Jeshurun, When the leaders of the people were gathered, All the tribes of Israel together.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu kră kon pơlei akŭm băl hơdai hăm lu khŭl adrĕch bơngai Isơrael. Na Kră Yang Sư boih pơtao kơ Jêsurun.

English: “Let Reuben live, and not die, Nor let his men be few.”
Bahnar: Apơi kơ Rubên oei arih ưh kơ lôch, ưh kơ tôch adrĕch. Mă khan Rubên bơngai kơtuei.a

English: And this he said of Judah: “Hear, LORD, the voice of Judah, And bring him to his people; Let his hands be sufficient for him, And may You be a help against his enemies.”
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Juđa thoi âu: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r lu bơngai Juđa krao apinh, ăn kơ sư brŏk tơ kon pơlei lu sư. Ăn kơ tơpang ti lu sư bơwei dŏng kon pơlei lu sư kơdih, Ơ Kră Yang apinh Ih tơgŭm sư blah lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu sư.

English: And of Levi he said: “Let Your Thummim and Your Urim be with Your holy one, Whom You tested at Massah, And with whom You contended at the waters of Meribah
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Lêwi thoi âu: Thumim păng Urimb Ih ăn boih kơ bơngai băt hli yom wei răk. Bơngai mă Ih pơlong lăng boih tơ Masa, bơngai mă Ih đei pơjah pơjăng boih tơ đak Mêriba

English: Who says of his father and mother, ‘I have not seen them’; Nor did he acknowledge his brothers, Or know his own children; For they have observed Your word And kept Your covenant.
Bahnar: Lêwi pơma khan: Inh ưh kơ lah 'bôh mĕ 'bă inh; Inh ưh kơnăl kơ 'nhŏng oh inh păng inh ưh kơ băt kon hơ'lơ̆p inh Yua kơ sư chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang. Kral kơchăng wei răk tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang.

English: They shall teach Jacob Your judgments, And Israel Your law. They shall put incense before You, And a whole burnt sacrifice on Your altar.
Bahnar: Sư bơtho nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang ăn kơ adrĕch Jakôp. Păng khôi juăt Kră Yang ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael Sư soh pơyơ̆r 'long 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: Bless his substance, LORD, And accept the work of his hands; Strike the loins of those who rise against him, And of those who hate him, that they rise not again.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih ăn kơ lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m pran 'nao. Ăn pŭn kơ tơdrong jang đơ̆ng tơpang ti lu sư pơm. Apinh Ih teh tơgơ̆ lê̆ rơhiĕo lu bơngai ayăt, păng pơrăm lu bơngai areh kơ lu sư, wă kơ lu sư huay pă iung blah dơ̆ng!

English: Of Benjamin he said: “The beloved of the LORD shall dwell in safety by Him, Who shelters him all the day long; And he shall dwell between His shoulders.”
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Bênjamin; ăn kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'mêm kơeng gơh oei hiôk-hian lăm Sư. Prăt năr đei Kră Yang wei-lăng sư, tơpă bơngai mă Kră Yang 'mêm oei tŏk-bŏk 'bar pah hơngiĕng Sư.

English: And of Joseph he said: “Blessed of the LORD is his land, With the precious things of heaven, with the dew, And the deep lying beneath
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Jôsep thoi âu: Apinh Kră Yang ăn pŭn hiôk kơ dêh char ih. Đơ̆ng plĕnh Kră Yang tơjruh ăn kơ ih đak ngom. Păng ăn đak lĕch đơ̆ng lăm teh

English: With the precious fruits of the sun, With the precious produce of the months
Bahnar: Lu tơmam gĭt yua hloh đei đơ̆ng măt 'năr, plei 'long hơ'bo 'lơ̆ng hloh đơ̆ng măt khei

English: With the best things of the ancient mountains, With the precious things of the everlasting hills
Bahnar: Lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng hloh đơ̆ng kơpal kông so sơ̆, Lu tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng teh kông groi oei ling-lang.

English: With the precious things of the earth and its fullness, And the favor of Him who dwelt in the bush. Let the blessing come ‘on the head of Joseph, And on the crown of the head of him who was separate from his brothers.’
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơdah akâu lăm bơmreh jơ'bôt 'long ăn kơ teh pŭn hiôk đei 'ba hơ'bo rơkah rơkai. Ăn pŭn hiôk 'bĕnh blai kơpal kơ̆l Jôsep, kơpal klĕng, bơngai pơm yŏng lăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư.

English: His glory is like a firstborn bull, And his horns like the horns of the wild ox; Together with them He shall push the peoples To the ends of the earth; They are the ten thousands of Ephraim, And they are the thousands of Manasseh.”
Bahnar: Rơmo tơno kơdră sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ pran kơtang. Ake sư noh ake rơmo tơno bri. Ake noh boih sư tơ̆m kon pơlei pơla. Dĭng truh tơ kon pơlei oei tôch teh đak, noh boih rơbâu hơngan 'nu bơngai Êphraim, kư̆m thoi dôm rơbâu 'nu bơngai Manase.

English: And of Zebulun he said: “Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going out, And Issachar in your tents!
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Sabulôn păng Isakar: Ơ Sabulôn, hiôk chơt bĕ, kơplah duk ih lĕch năm chă mơdro sa lăm đak dơsĭ. Gah ih ơ Isakar, kư̆m athei hiôk chơt bĕ lăm ih chă jang sa.

English: They shall call the peoples to the mountain; There they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness; For they shall partake of the abundance of the seas And of treasures hidden in the sand.”
Bahnar: Lu sư gô krao pơtơm lu kon pơlei tŏk tơ kông. Tơ noh, lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt mă Kră Yang bơtho. Yua kơ lu sư đei iŏk yua tơmam rơkah rơkai đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ păng tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng lăm ala chuơh.

English: And of Gad he said: “Blessed is he who enlarges Gad; He dwells as a lion, And tears the arm and the crown of his head.
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Gat, hơri ư-ang kơ Tơ'ngla pơih ăn kơ Gat hơdral rai să. Sư arih thoi dăm-brang akăn, châu sa kon sem hek ti hăm kơ̆l.

English: He provided the first part for himself, Because a lawgiver’s portion was reserved there. He came with the heads of the people; He administered the justice of the LORD, And His judgments with Israel.”
Bahnar: Sư rơih kơ sư anih teh 'lơ̆ng hloh lăm dêh noh, teh noh să 'măn kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r. Kơplah lu bơngai kră chĕp kơ̆l kon pơlei akŭm, sư pơm keh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Kră Yang, păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: And of Dan he said: “Dan is a lion’s whelp; He shall leap from Bashan.”
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Đan: Đan thoi dăm-brang dăm mơlôh, plŏng dơhrông đơ̆ng char Basan năm blah ayăt sư.

English: And of Naphtali he said: “O Naphtali, satisfied with favor, And full of the blessing of the LORD, Possess the west and the south.”
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Naptali: Ơ Naptali pŭn hiôk đơ̆ng Kră Yang, 'bĕnh blai tơdrong pŭn hiôk đơ̆ng Kră Yang, ih iŏk bĕ teh gah bơmơ̆t truh gah gơal dơnâu Galilê.

English: And of Asher he said: “Asher is most blessed of sons; Let him be favored by his brothers, And let him dip his foot in oil.
Bahnar: Môis sơkat kơ Aser: Apơi kơ Aser đei pŭn hiôk hloh kơ lu adrĕch adrung nai. Ăn kơ sư jing bơngai lu 'nhŏng oh sư lăp đon, Gơh tong jơ̆ng sư lăm đak rơmă ôliwơ!

English: Your sandals shall be iron and bronze; As your days, so shall your strength be.
Bahnar: Lu 'long chơkăl tang 'măng jang pơm hăm bơsei mam păng kong, chăl arih ih sot dang yơ, jơhngơ̆m ih oei pran dang noh.

English: “There is no one like the God of Jeshurun, Who rides the heavens to help you, And in His excellency on the clouds.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jêsurun, Tơ'ngla, păr tơ lu tăl plĕnh, năm dŏng tơgŭm ih. Tơ lăm lu hơmơ̆l, Sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ hloh.

English: The eternal God is your refuge, And underneath are the everlasting arms; He will thrust out the enemy from before you, And will say, ‘Destroy!’
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang noh anih ih kơ'nơp, gah ala kơ ih đei tơpang ti Kră Yang drơng tơgŭm, Sư puh lê̆ lu bơngai ayăt 'bơ̆t anăp ih, Na sư khan: Pơrăm pơlôch lu sư bĕ.

English: Then Israel shall dwell in safety, The fountain of Jacob alone, In a land of grain and new wine; His heavens shall also drop dew.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơngai Isơrael gô arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng: Kon sâu Jakôp oei tơ noh lăm dêh teh phe 'ba, hơ'bo păng tơm hơmu lơ. Đak ngom đơ̆ng plĕnh ruh hngôm.

English: Happy are you, O Israel! Who is like you, a people saved by the LORD, The shield of your help And the sword of your majesty! Your enemies shall submit to you, And you shall tread down their high places.”
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Isơrael ih pŭn hiôk dêh, kon pơlei Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih bơih, Kră Yang. Sư thoi khêl pĕng tơgŭm ih, thoi đao gưm pơm ăn kơ ih kĕ jei jơnei tih. Lu bơngai ayăt gô năm chă pơm lung, na ih gô pơjuă bơhlơ̆r anih kơjung lu sư.

English: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is across from Jericho. And the LORD showed him all the land of Gilead as far as Dan
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơmăn glă char Môap, Môis tŏk tơ kông Nêbô, tơ kơ̆l kông Pisga, tơklă anăp pơlei Jêrikô; đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang ăn kơ sư lăng 'bôh jơ̆p kơ dêh char, đơ̆ng Gileat truh tơ char Đan

English: all Naphtali and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the Western Sea
Bahnar: jơ̆p kơ char Naptali păng dêh Êphraim păng Manase, đĭ kơ dêh Juđa truh tơ đak dơsĭ gah bơmơ̆t, a

English: the South, and the plain of the Valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, as far as Zoar.
Bahnar: tơring gah gơal, jơ̆p tơmăn glă, thŭng dơnă Jêrikô; noh pơlei tih 'long gol, truh tơ Soar.

English: Then the LORD said to him, “This is the land of which I swore to give Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have caused you to see it with your eyes, but you shall not cross over there.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: 'Nâu bơih dêh char mă Inh pơkă wă ăn kơ Abraham, Isăk păng Jakôp. Inh gô ăn dêh âu kơ lu adrĕch adrung ih. Inh tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih lăng dêh noh, mă-lei ih ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t tơ noh ôh.

English: So Moses the servant of the LORD died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: Môis, đĭch đam Kră Yang, lôch tơ lăm dêh char Môap, trŏ thoi Kră Yang khan.

English: And He buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, opposite Beth Peor; but no one knows his grave to this day.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'bŭ sư lăm thŭng glă tơ dêh Môap, tơklă Bêt Pêôr; truh tơ dang ei ưh kơ đei bơngai bu mă băt kơ bơsat 'bŭ sư tơ yơ.

English: Moses was one hundred and twenty years old when he died. His eyes were not dim nor his natural vigor diminished.
Bahnar: Môis lôch, kơplah sư đei minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm; măt sư oei hơdah 'lơ̆ng, jơhngơ̆m sư oei pran.

English: And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days. So the days of weeping and mourning for Moses ended.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơla bơngai Isơrael nhơ̆m hmoi pơdong Môis lăm pêng-jĭt năr tơ anih tơmăn glă char Môap; dôm lu năr nhơ̆m hmoi păng năr pơdong Môis hlôi keh đang bơih.

English: Now Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands on him; so the children of Israel heeded him, and did as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun, đei 'bĕnh blai kơ tơdrong gơh hơgei, yua kơ Môis đei dan tơpang ti tơ akâu Jôsuê boih; na kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael chu nơ̆r sư păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Kră Yang bơtho pơkă kơ Môis.

English: But since then there has not arisen in Israel a prophet like Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr noh, lăm lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ đei bơngai bu khan lê̆ adrol nhen thoi Môis, mă Kră Yang băt juăt kơ tơ'bơ̆p pơma dơnuh

English: in all the signs and wonders which the LORD sent him to do in the land of Egypt, before Pharaoh, before all his servants, and in all his land
Bahnar: 'Nguaih kơ Môis ưh kơ đei bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă Kră Yang wơh pơm lu tơdrong hlĭch, mơsêh chrơp thoi noh, 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Pharaôn păng yŏng pơgơ̆r păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: and by all that mighty power and all the great terror which Moses performed in the sight of all Israel.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh tơ'bôh tơdrong pran kơtang păng jang tơdrong tih krưp tơpă trŏ kơ hli tơrơ thoi tơdrong jang Môis đei pơm 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael.
